Catalan series based on the autobiographical novel \El mundo amarillo\" by author Albert Espinosa. The series tells the story of a group of young people suffering from cancer in a hospital. The series served as a model for adaptations in several other countries."

Captain Stottlemeyer has arrested a Colombian drug lord who is feared for his many outbursts, but he is supposed to hand him over to the FBI. Mr. Monk, however, has other things to worry about, because he has to do his jury duty. In the process, he drives the other jurors crazy, because not only does he disagree with them, he also solves another case along the way.

A man kills his casual acquaintance in an argument when he realizes that she was secretly filming their affair. But the case is a minor matter for Monk this time, as a film crew is there to adapt an old case of his. Monk is to be played by well-known actor David Ruskin, but Ruskin soon gets too carried away with his role.

The old piano teacher Traude Krüger already worked in the women's prison when it was a military hospital during the war. Now she teaches the few people who are interested. But then she meets Jenny, who is serving time for murder. She immediately recognizes that the raw and violent young woman has great talent. But it is a rocky road for Jenny to find her way back into life through music.

Costume historical drama about the British Duchess Georgiana of Devonshire, played by Keira Knightley. The young aristocrat was spurned by her husband because she did not bear him a male heir and was frequently subjected to the press's scorn, partly because of her gambling debts.

Much to Mr. Monk's displeasure, the sanitation workers are on strike and garbage has been piling up in the streets of the city for days. Then the union boss is found dead in his office. In the case of murder, the union wants to put all negotiations on hold, which is why Monk simply claims it was suicide. But Natalie talks him into telling the truth ...

The gifted pianist Jenny spent 15 years in prison for a murder committed by her then boyfriend. Now, full of bitterness, she lives in a Christian community and works as a cleaner. But then she finds out that her ex is a star and is on the jury for the music competition in which she is to take part with Syrian Omar. Sequel to the 2006 drama \Four Minutes\"."

The basketball coach at Natalie's daughter Julie's school has died in the changing room. Julie and her friends believe it's murder and ask Mr. Monk to investigate. But Natalie needs him too, because she's taking over basketball practice and he's supposed to be the assistant coach in an important game. For this, he absolutely needs a whistle, which he makes extensive use of ...

Allan Karlsson, now a hundred and one years old, has run out of money in Bali that he took from a gangster a year ago. Among his belongings is an old bottle of lemonade that was produced in the Soviet Union. There is a lot of money to be made from this tasty drink, but Allan has the recipe in a cigar box that has to be found first.

Shortly before his 100th birthday, Allan Karlsson escapes from an old people's home and embarks on an adventurous journey on which he makes new friends. While he is being sought by gangsters whose suitcases full of money he has taken by chance, he thinks back on his life, which has repeatedly brought the explosives fan to the center of world history.

Mr. Monk is at the fire station when someone sneaks into the building and, when noticed, kills a fireman and splashes acid in Monk's face. This causes him to go blind and he may never be able to see again. At first Monk is devastated and doesn't want to do anything any more, but then he tries to see the positive side of his blindness.
Peppa celebrates 20 years with 10 new episodes, a 3-part wedding special, a mix of animation and live action where Peppa enters the real world, a party bus bonus episode, and 5 sing-along songs.

In 1923, Pádraic lives on a remote Irish island with his sister Siobhán and regularly goes to the village pub with his older friend Colm. But one day Colm no longer wants to be friends with him. Pádraic is suddenly too simple for him and he would rather write pieces of music to be preserved for posterity. Pádraic can neither understand nor accept this ...

Lily has her first date, and Mitch and Cam, who is nervous about a possible head coaching job, accompany her to dinner. There they meet Claire and Phil with Haley and Dylan, who think their twins' parenting is going wrong. Jay and Gloria also come to the restaurant with Joe, who had a school play. Because of an overdose of painkillers, Jay gets sentimental there...

Natalie surprises Mr. Monk with an idea: he should start his own business as a private detective. She has already arranged everything behind his back and rented an office. His first case, however, is a little petty: a real estate agent's car was damaged in the parking lot of the marina. But of course there is a connection to a murder there too ...

Mr. Monk goes to the 25-year reunion at his old university. But there he realizes that he wasn't as popular as he remembered. Only Dianne, Trudy's former roommate, receives him kindly. The reunion is overshadowed by the death of the now retired university nurse, which Captain Stottlemeyer believes to be murdered.

The film tells the story of the search for and subsequent rescue of 13 boys from a flooded cave in Thailand in 2018, primarily from the perspective of two British divers. It uses original footage, re-enacted scenes and interviews.

Mr. Monk argues with Harold Krenshaw, another patient, outside the office of his psychiatrist Dr. Kroger in the morning. But when Dr. Kroger arrives, they find the cleaning lady in the office murdered and the room trashed. Because a patient has threatened him, Dr. Kroger believes that the murder is his fault and wants to retire. But this is something Mr. Monk cannot accept.

Captain Stottlemeyer learns that his son Jared is skipping school and is at a rock festival. Natalie and, mistakenly, Mr. Monk go there with Stottlemeyer to look for Jared. Mr. Monk quickly regrets his decision, but then a dead roadie is found in the toilets. Now he has to help convict the famous rock singer Kris Kedder.

Decades after leaving the family without a word, father Monk contacts Mr. Monk again because he has been arrested for a traffic offence. Adrian reluctantly helps his father, who is a trucker and urgently needs to make a trip. Natalie persuades Adrian to go along for the ride, which he soon regrets ...

Mr. Monk meets a stranger in a dark bar who offers him a lot of money if he takes something from the stranger's house. It's Derek Bronson, who everyone thinks is dead, which he wants to keep it that way because, to Mr. Monk's great shock, he has leprosy. Monk fears he has contracted the disease, so Natalie takes him to a specialist, Dr. Aaron Polanski.

Abe Applebaum successfully played detective as a child and solved many cases, making him popular in his home town. But then a friend of his disappeared and neither he nor the police were able to solve the case. Now 32, he is considered a failure and gets by with small cases until 16-year-old Caroline hires him to find her boyfriend's murderer.
Music satire about the semi-fictional band \Spinal Tap\"
column3: which follows the life of a rock band on the road to success with all its ups and downs and alludes to numerous bands
column4: concerts and songs with insider gags."

abstract: Tokyo, 1923: bon vivant Saburo secretly observes his neighbors through peepholes to watch their intimate goings-on. One day, he witnesses a prostitute committing murder.

60 years in the future, Lisa tells her family at Thanksgiving, that six decades earlier, the nuclear power plant had burned down and the whole of Springfield lost power during a snowstorm. Homer is made the scapegoat and the whole town is angry with him, even Marge finds it hard to believe his claim of innocence.

A former police employee is found murdered after returning from vacation. Mr. Monk knew her from his active days, but he is busy with something else: Outside the supermarket he has bumped into Hal Tucker, a man who is very friendly towards him and wants to meet up. Monk hopes to have a real friend for the first time.

Mr. Monk is with Natalie at her parents' house, where they learn that rich neighbor Paul Buchanan is living alone with staff in his mansion after the sudden death of his parents. Natalie has never liked Paul and wants Monk to take a closer look at the case. But he is mistaken for the new butler and Monk accepts the job because he can finally live out his perfectionism there.

While the notorious radio host Max Hudson is doing his daily live show, his wife Jeanette dies from an open gas tap. Jeanette's sister Linda believes that Max caused her death and calls in Mr. Monk. But Hudson only wants to talk to him live on his show, where he and his colleagues are making fun of the detective.

After Lieutenant Randy Disher once again messes up on duty, he quits and moves to the farm he has just inherited from his uncle. Since the circumstances of his uncle's death seem strange to him, he asks Mr. Monk to look into the matter. Under pressure from Natalie, Monk actually takes the bus to the dirty country.

Mr. Monk is busy investigating the murder of a woman when another murder demands everyone's attention: The perpetrator has killed his victim in six ways and announces another crime in 36 hours. The FBI takes over the case using the latest technology and Monk is now only seen as an old-fashioned and disruptive marginal figure ...

Mr. Monk has a nosebleed and has gone to the hospital with Natalie. But the emergency room is overcrowded and Natalie has her day off and a date at last, so she leaves Monk alone. He accidentally finds the body of a doctor who was murdered that night, but the evidence leads to a seriously ill patient who was connected to a heart monitor the whole time.

A colleague of real estate agent Linda Fusco, Captain Stottlemeyer's girlfriend, is murdered during a house viewing. Mr. Monk soon comes to the conclusion that Linda is the murderer, but Stottlemeyer doesn't want to hear about it, especially as he was talking to her at home via webcam shortly before the crime. This puts the friendship between the two men on the rocks ...

Mr. Monk takes part in a bachelor auction for a good cause and is bought by Marci Maven, of all people, his biggest and somewhat crazy fan. Her biting dog is said to have killed a neighbor, but according to Marci, it had died and been buried beforehand. Now Monk is supposed to help her ...

Rapper Xtra Large is killed in his limousine with a car bomb. His rival Murderuss, who had wished him exactly the same death in his songs, is immediately suspected of the crime. Murderuss seeks out Mr. Monk to exonerate him and in a panic agrees, but all the evidence points to Murderuss as the culprit.

A woman is found murdered on the beach after ringing the doorbell of computer tycoon Peter Magneri's beach villa that evening to no avail. To Mr. Monk's great shock, it is a nudist beach, and for him the convinced nudist Chance Singer, who lives in a caravan right next door, must be the murderer.

Mitch and Cam have an offer to adopt a little boy, but they have to decide within a day, which is not easy for them. Claire has a job interview via video conference for her dream job in an organization company, but gets stuck in the broken staircase just before. Alex runs into an old acquaintance at university and realizes that her job is not popular.

Businessman Robert Sherman kills a burglar in his house, whom he hired himself, and frames him for the murder of his wife. However, Monk discovers links between the burglar and the businessman. Meanwhile, Natalie is worried about her daughter Julie, who is dating a much older boy. Monk, of all people, is asked to talk to the girl.

The son of Mr. Monk's psychiatrist Dr. Kroger contacts Monk with two friends to ask him to use his skills to help them with a treasure hunt. Monk is happy to help with the supposed homework assignment to make himself look better to his doctor. But the three boys had actually found the treasure map on a dead bank robber.
US satire series based on the film of the same name about a field hospital during the Korean War in the 1950s.
A dark secret lurks behind these walls ... Do not dare to reveal it!

Monk is an American crime series about private detective Adrian Monk. He has been suspended from the police force due to his severe obsessive-compulsive disorder and phobias, but continues to work for the police as a detective and consultant. Thanks to his extraordinary flair for crime, he solves even seemingly impossible cases.

Bart has detention with janitor Willie after a failed action at school, but gets on well with him. Then Willie suddenly disappears and Bart receives a call for help from him in Edinburgh. So the Simpsons set off for Scotland, with Homer happy to escape a wedding to which they had been invited.
\Frisco Fly\"
column3: a celebrated climber
column4: falls from a skyscraper and miraculously survives. This reveals who the disguised hero is: under the mask is Harold
column5: Monk's arch-rival as a patient of Dr. Kroger. Monk can't believe that the one person he thought was even more disturbed than himself is supposed to be a daredevil hero."

abstract: 14 years ago, a married couple were brutally murdered in their home. With Mr. Monk's help, Max Barton was convicted as the perpetrator. But now a new DNA analysis reveals that the traces found are not Barton's and he is released. Monk is shocked by his mistake and tries to apologize to Barton.

Mr. Monk happens to see a woman on the street and has the feeling that something is wrong with her. But before he can get to the bottom of it, the woman has disappeared. Because he can't get her out of his mind, Monk can no longer sleep, which is why he spends the night strolling through the neighborhood. While doing so, he witnesses a murder in the drug scene - or was it just a hallucination?

It's just before Christmas, a holiday that Mr. Monk can't stand. He is stuck in a traffic jam with Natalie and Julie when a Santa Claus throws stuffed animals into the crowd from a rooftop. Monk wants to stop this, but it leads to an argument in which he shoots Santa Claus. Now he is the most unpopular person in town ...

The parents of a murdered young woman ask Mr. Monk for help. The victim had recently escaped from a cult and a witness claims to have recognized the cult leader as the perpetrator. Natalie is supposed to join the group incognito, but is not accepted. So Mr. Monk spontaneously offers himself. But because he is so mentally unstable, he soon falls in with the cult ...

A bank has been robbed and an employee shot, and Captain Stottlemeyer takes on the case on a temporary basis. Because Mr. Monk had a safe deposit box there whose contents were stolen, he wants to solve the case. He quickly suspects that the perpetrator must have had an accomplice in the bank. To find out more, he starts working there as a security guard.

The film tells the true story of the Granite Mountain Hotshots, a firefighting unit in Arizona that specialized in wildfires. After many years, leader Eric Marsh has managed to ensure that his tough squad is counted among the elite, the \hotshots\". But in 2013
column3: the men are trapped by fire while trying to protect the town of Yarnell..."

abstract: Captain Stottlemeyer, Lieutenant Disher, Mr. Monk and Natalie arrive at a crime scene, with the captain proudly showing off his new police car. But Natalie steals it without further ado when she hears on the police radio that a Julie Teeger has been murdered. On the scene, she is relieved to discover that the victim is not her daughter. But this is not the last death ...

Dr. Kroger encourages Mr. Monk to find a hobby. So it's a good thing that he and Natalie find some old canvases and paints in a junkyard while investigating a death. Monk wants to learn how to paint and even attends a course. However, no one is enthusiastic about the results until a Russian art dealer turns up and offers Mr. Monk a lot of money for his paintings.

Single mother Callie Spengler inherits a dilapidated house in the godforsaken town of Summerville from her unknown father. Her nerdy daughter Phoebe and son Trevor soon discover the secret of their grandfather - one of the legendary Ghostbusters of the 80s - and have to face the Sumerian demon Gozer again ...

After the unexpected death of Dr. Kroger, Mr. Monk can no longer stand the piano playing of a neighbor because it reminds him of his beloved therapist. When he looks into the case of a senior citizen who was killed in a fall down the stairs and learns that the house is for sale, he spontaneously buys it. Everything seems perfect, but then a handyman arrives and discovers damage to the house ...

Things change in the life of Jack Russell terrier Max when his owner gets married and has a baby. From now on, he anxiously watches over the little one. A family trip to a farm causes particular problems for the city dog. Meanwhile, Max leaves his favorite toy to his girlfriend Gidget, who loses it at the first opportunity in an apartment full of cats...

For Jack Russell terrier Max, his owner Katie, with whom he lives in Manhattan, is his everything. But one day she returns from the animal shelter with mongrel Duke. The two dogs can't stand each other and their quarrel leads to them ending up on the street. A gang led by rabbit Snowball is after them, but neighbor dog Gidget wants to save Max.

After the idea of the four dissimilar sons-in-law of Mr. and Mrs. Verneuil to set up a halal organic company failed, all four want to emigrate with their families independently of each other. Monsieur Claude and his wife Marie naturally want to prevent this because because then they would hardly see their four daughters and their grandchildren.

During a store robbery, clues are found that indicate that the perpetrator is the one who killed Mr. Monk's wife Trudy years ago with a car bomb. Monk unravels a coded message that takes him to a place where he meets the perpetrator. He is shot dead - and all the evidence points to Mr. Monk. Sheriff John Rollins is certain he has the culprit.

After Captain Stottlemeyer shot Mr. Monk, Natalie is in deep mourning and Lieutenant Disher is also preparing for Monk's funeral. But Sheriff Rollins is not so sure that Monk is dead, especially as his body is missing. Meanwhile, a certain Leland Rodriguez attracts attention because, as an employee of a car wash, he cleans the vehicles with extreme care ...

In LA, unsuccessful actress Mia meets jazz pianist Sebastian, who has just lost his job. Neither of them really like each other at first, but as fate would have it, they keep bumping into each other...

The wife of chess master Patrick Kloster turns up at Mr. Monk's and pays him to solve a murder - that of herself, because her highly intelligent husband threatened to kill her. She is indeed dead on the same day and there is no evidence of foul play. Monk is determined to convict the man, but Kloster is always one move ahead of him ...

The lotto girl is killed outside the TV studio after the lottery numbers have been drawn. While Mr. Monk tries to solve the case, Natalie is approached by the show's producer to stand in for the dead woman at short notice. Natalie's appearance as the new lotto girl is a complete success, which makes Monk jealous, for whom she now has hardly any time left.
Fawn and the NeverBeast get into mischief and cause trouble for the fairy kingdom. Neither are what they seem. Will they always be misunderstood, or will the others come to see the light?
A lonely man experiences a condition in which everyone appears to have the same face and voice. In this world of sameness, there may yet be uniqueness for him to discover, but can he hold on to it?

Film adaptation of the classic Fitzgerald novel with Robert Redford in the leading role of Jay Gatsby, who has worked his way up from the lower classes to become rich. But even with all his money, he can't buy back his childhood sweetheart Daisy (Mia Farrow). Francis Ford Coppola wrote the screenplay.
The waitstaff of the restaurant The Slammin' Salmon have one night to make $20,000, or else Cleon \Slammin'\" Salmon
column3: former heavyweight boxing champion
column4: will take it out on them. Can they hold it together long enough to avoid being punched into a puddle of pudding?"

abstract: An attack is made on boxer Ray Regis and it soon becomes clear that they are dealing with a contract killer who will try again. In gratitude for Mr. Monk's support, Ray helps him prepare for a fitness test that Monk must pass in order to continue working for the police.

Lt. Steven Albright, a good friend of Natalie's deceased husband, contacts Mr. Monk because a comrade has died on board the submarine on which he is serving, allegedly by suicide. Mr. Monk lets Natalie persuade him to investigate for a few minutes in the submarine, but then there is an emergency drill and the two of them have to stay under water for several days.

Randy Disher accidentally discovers a cab driver murdered in his vehicle. Various pieces of evidence left behind point to Leyla Zlatavich, a refugee aid worker from Zemenia in Eastern Europe. Mr. Monk, however, falls in love with the woman and is certain that she is innocent, even though more and more evidence points against her ...

Mr. Monk and a few others have gathered in TV host James Novak's apartment because Novak's latest show is airing on TV, which is about how Monk solved his 100th case. In a series of murders, several young women were killed who had been acting casually. But during the broadcast, Monk realizes that the case is not yet completely solved ...
US drama series centered on Midge Maisel, a Jewish housewife and mother in New York in the late 1950s who embarks on a career as a stand-up comedian.
Six-part US mini-series about social and political events in the city of Yonkers, north of New York City, from 1987 to 1993.

Family drama by Robert Benton from 1979 with Dustin Hoffman and Meryl Streep in the leading roles. Joanna leaves her husband Ted because he only has his career in mind. Ted is forced to make his family the focus of his life for the first time and look after their son Billy. But then Joanna demands sole custody...
Film adaptation of George Orwell's dystopian novel of the same name, in which the state monitors the lives of its citizens in a totalitarian manner. Big Brother is watching you!

In Gotham City, mentally disturbed comedian Arthur Fleck is ignored and mistreated by society. For him, this marks the beginning of a downward spiral of revolution and bloody crime, and becoming the Joker.
Biopic about the US scientist J. Robert Oppenheimer, who was responsible for the development of the atomic bomb as head of the Manhattan Project during the Second World War.
In January 1942, 15 high-ranking representatives of the Nazi regime gather for a meeting in a villa in Berlin-Wannsee. Their only item on the agenda is the \Final Solution to the Jewish Question\"
column3: the organization of the systematic murder of all Jews in Europe."

abstract: Barney is an outsider at his school and has no friends. This is partly due to the fact that everyone else has a modern B-bot that they use to connect with each other. But Barney's father can't afford one. At least not one from the store, which is why he buys a damaged B-bot underhand, which Barney christens \Ron\". However
column3: this initially backfires..."

abstract: Third cinematic adaptation of the science fiction novel series of the same name by Frank Herbert. The plot of the film is based on the first half of the first book and is continued in the second part from 2024. The noble Atreides family and their son Paul are supposed to monitor the extraction of the miracle substance Spice on a planet, but are lured into a trap.

Sequel to 'A Quiet Place', which follows on seamlessly from the first part: After the death of her husband, Evelyn has to fend for herself with her 3 children. They leave the farm to find a new home somewhere. At least they now have a weapon against the omnipresent monsters that have depopulated the area. But that's only half the battle...

Millie is lucky enough to escape a notorious serial killer. The only problem is that the stab wound on her shoulder no longer hurts the very next day. Not because her wound healing is so extraordinary, but because she has swapped bodies with the killer...

Sonic is a super-fast, hedgehog-like alien who has fled to Earth because he was persecuted in his world. He lives undetected in a small country town, but feels lonely. When he accidentally causes a major blackout, the mad scientist Dr. Robotnik gets on his trail. Small-town policeman Tom has to help Sonic escape from him.

Kim Ki-taek lives with his wife Chung-sook and their grown-up children Ki-woo and Ki-jung in a run-down apartment because none of them can get a proper job. When a friend gives Ki-woo the opportunity to teach English at the wealthy Park family, he manages to get his family jobs there through intrigue and deceit.

Lance is a super spy in the style of James Bond. He seems to succeed at everything and every kick in the ass is accompanied by a witty line. But then he is suddenly mistaken for a traitor and has to rely on the help of an outsider from the technology department: Walter, who makes glitter cat video distraction gadgets instead of grenades...

In his biographically inspired drama, Alfonso Cuarón tells the story of a wealthy family and their housemaid Cleo against the backdrop of the student unrest in Mexico City in the early 1970s. While the man of the house is away most of the time, Cleo sacrificially looks after the family's four children, but her own life is neglected.

Aggressive monsters that are blind but react to every sound have turned the world into a silent place. On a remote farm, a family tries to survive as silently as possible. However, this is difficult with 3 children and a pregnant wife...

The satirical film biography follows the life of Dick Cheney. In 1963, the Yale student loses his scholarship due to alcoholic escapades, but his ambitious wife Lynne gives him an ultimatum, whereupon he starts an internship in Congress and soon rises through the ranks. At the height of his power, as Vice President under George W. Bush, he is jointly responsible for the US actions after September

When Mary was still a baby, her mother committed suicide. Since then, her uncle Frank has looked after her. Mary is now six and starts school - which leads to problems. It soon becomes clear that the girl, just like her mother, is a math genius. This arouses the desires of her dominant but previously disinterested grandmother - and an ugly custody battle breaks out...
Little bear Paddington wants to give his aunt Lucy a birthday present. But a washed-up actor has other plans, and Paddington finds himself in a very awkward situation.

After his home in Peru is destroyed by an earthquake, the talking bear Paddington travels to the UK, the land of his dreams. But when he arrives in London, he realizes that nothing is as he had imagined. But then he meets the Brown family, who take him in.

Syrian refugee Khaled is living illegally in Helsinki after his asylum application is rejected. He meets ex-commercial agent Wikström, who takes him in at the restaurant he has just taken over. The Berlinale presented the film in competition for the 2017 Golden Bear.

Joe doesn't exactly have a peaceful retirement: mortgage rates are rising, his pension is being cut - he's about to lose his house. So he decides to rob a bank with his best buddies Albert and Willie. But a test run in a supermarket is rather sobering for the gang of pensioners...

The taciturn bus driver Patterson lives a modest and orderly life in the New Jersey town of the same name. Every day he writes poems in a small notebook, but he doesn't even show them to his wife Laura. She lives out her creative side by decorating their small house and dreams of success with cupcakes or as a country singer.

Dropout Ben has been living with his six children deep in the forest, far away from civilization. But when his wife kills herself after a long battle with bipolar disorder, the family returns - at least temporarily - to modern society. The culture shock is not without its conflicts...

Winfried has become estranged from his daughter Ines, who is making a career as a management consultant. He spontaneously decides to visit her in Romania, where she is currently working. There he appears in her environment in a bizarre disguise as Toni Erdmann. The film premiered in competition at Cannes in 2016 and won the European Film Award.

In his first movie, Shaun the Sheep and his flock experience adventures in the city in search of their farmer. He has lost his memory in an accident and has taken a job in a hairdressing salon. But the animal trapper Trumper is also lurking in the town. Will they manage to find the farmer and bring him back to the farm?

The movie describes a dozen lives around the world that are affected by a drone attack on a house in Kenya. The British Colonel Powell wants to attack the building because there are wanted terrorists inside, the drone is controlled from the USA. But the girl Alia is also in the area of the strike.

In the 1990s, Maria Altmann, who fled from Vienna to the USA to escape the Nazis, tries to get back a painting by Gustav Klimt that had been taken from her family. She has the help of a US lawyer and an Austrian. However, the Austrian authorities refuse to return the \Golden Adele\" and a legal dispute ensues."

Gummi lives in a remote Icelandic valley as a sheep farmer, just like his quick-tempered brother Kiddi, who lives in the yard next door. But the two have not spoken to each other for 40 years. When Gummi discovers that one of Kiddi's sheep has scrapie, all the sheep in the valley are to be killed. This doesn't exactly improve the sibling relationship at first.

The northern Rocky Mountains in the 1820s: Trapper Hugh Glass is attacked and seriously injured by a bear during a hunting expedition. Pursued by Indians, his companions decide not to take him any further, as his transportation puts them all in danger. Three men are told to wait for Glass to die and then bury him - but they leave him alone.

The film tells how in 2004 Mary Mapes, the producer of the CBS program 60 Minutes, and her team research a story according to which President George W. Bush was given preferential treatment by the National Guard in the 1960s. However, after Mapes' role model Dan Rather publishes the story, doubts arise about its accuracy and the team comes under pressure.

After a visit to the jeweler, actress Sally Larkin has disappeared without a trace. Her husband Aaron, from whom she was about to separate, is a suspect. Mr. Monk is more concerned that his nemesis Harold seems to be doing well after a hypnosis treatment. Against Natalie's advice, Monk also allows himself to be hypnotized and now behaves like a child ...

Three homeless people come to Mr. Monk and want him to investigate the death of a friend. Monk is disgusted by them, but Natalie manages to get him to agree. Meanwhile, Captain Stottlemeyer is on sick leave for back pain, but then he gets a tip that a fountain at a monastery has healing powers. As if by a miracle, his pain disappears when he drinks from it.

13-year-old Meilin lives in Toronto with her parents, who come from China. She and her three friends are outsiders and Meilin always wants to please her mother. But one morning she wakes up as a big red panda. She learns that strong feelings lead to the transformation and that she has to take part in a ritual to banish the panda. But her new outfit also has positive aspects...
Poetic drama by Philippe Lioret, set in Brittany. Camille returns to the Breton island of Quessant to sell her parents' house. But there she finds a book that will change her perspective.

Police procedural crime series about a special unit of the FBI: the Behavioral Analysis Unit (BAU) from Quantico (Virginia). In Criminal Minds, the focus of the episodes is less on the crimes and more on the perpetrators. The focus is on operational case analysis in order to find the criminals.

An escaped prisoner suddenly appears in Mr. Monk's apartment and introduces himself as his half-brother Jack Junior. He is said to have killed a social worker during his escape, but swears he didn't do it. Mr. Monk wants to throw the filthy man out immediately, but relents. However, it turns out that Jack Junior is not so particular about the truth.

Natalie inadvertently helps a thief who is about to steal the bike of the CEO of a biotech company. To make up for this, she gets Mr. Monk to track down the thief. But in the process, Monk is shot and confined to a wheelchair. Now he takes every opportunity to remind Natalie that she is to blame for his condition.

Because they have unexpectedly come into some money, the Simpsons go on a cruise at Lisa's suggestion. But to Homer's disappointment, only nerds are on board. Then Comic Book Guy has a valuable action figure stolen and everything points to Bart as the culprit. Lisa tries to solve the case and gets help from Taika Waititi.
Nina Gladitz's documentary examines the circumstances surrounding the film \Lowlands\"
column3: which was shot by Leni Riefenstahl during the Nazi era and in which interned Sinti and Romani were also used as extras.."

abstract: Hungarian Judith and her boyfriend Taddek try to flee to the West after the failure of the Hungarian revolution in 1956. The young woman makes it to Austria, the man, it seems, dies. 20 years later, Judith leads a comfortable life as a teacher in a small Austrian town...

Animated game about the mouse Fievel Mousekewitz, who immigrates from Russia to New York City and loses the rest of his family in a storm. In the USA, the new immigrants have to work hard, but continue to believe in the American dream.

As a child, Helen witnessed her mother being murdered. Even as an adult, she is still tormented by nightmares. Gradually, however, dreams of other murders begin to intermingle. Or are these even real crimes?
British gangster series about the conflicts between competing gangs in London.
Canadian-Irish series, loosely based on the legends about the Viking Ragnar \Lothbrok\" Sigurdsson
column3: who ravages the English kingdoms in the 9th century. Series published by History Channel in 6 seasons from 2013-2019 with Travis Fimmel in the lead role of Ragnar."

abstract: US animated series that was produced from 2001 to 2004 and again in 2017 and broadcast by Cartoon Network. It is about Samurai Jack, who lives and fights in medieval Japan.

A security guard has been killed in a museum of records and a robot has been stolen. But Mr. Monk is more occupied with an elderly lady he met on the street. The resolute Marge manages to make Monk change things that were sacred to him. Now he has found a surrogate mother, for whom he even stands up to her noisy neighbor ...

Mr. Monk has been given VIP tickets for a football playoff game, but doesn't actually want to go. But Captain Stottlemeyer is a big fan and so the two of them go to the stadium. But a barbecue explodes in the parking lot and then the body of a player is found - good reasons for Mr. Monk not to watch the game, much to Stottlemeyer's annoyance.
Italian crime series based on novels by Antonio Manzini and set in the Alps.

Documentary from 1959 by Bernhard Grzimek and his son Michael Grzimek, who died in an accident during filming. The film won the Oscar for best documentary. The Grzimeks observe the migration of animal herds in Tanzania's Serengeti National Park and draw attention to the impending destruction of this animal paradise.

Natalie accepts an job for Mr. Monk. When he hears who the client is, he is shocked: it is Roderick Brody, a former classmate who used to torment him. Despite his reservations, Monk accepts. But when he learns that he is to find out whether Brody's wife is having an affair, Monk is delighted because he hopes that this will torment Brody in the same way that Monk was tormented by him in the past.

Mr. Monk's neighbor Kevin Dorfman does the bookkeeping for professional magician Karl Torini and notices some discrepancies. Torini doesn't care because he wants to go to Reno for the weekend with his girlfriend, so he offers Kevin the chance to do a show for Torini. The amateur magician is thrilled, but the big surprise comes after the show ...

The parking garage where Mr. Monk's wife Trudy was killed is to be demolished and replaced by a playground. Monk protests against this while chained up, and indeed city councillor Eileen Hill is persuaded to hold a new vote on the case. But shortly afterwards she disappears without a trace. Mr. Monk is worried, especially as his rival Harold Krenshaw wants to vote for the demolition.

A red women's skirt falls from a high-rise building onto the grounds of an Iranian military barracks. The soldiers secretly take it with them into the barracks and dress up in it until one of them decides to return the garment to its owner. But the residents of the tower block are not very forthcoming with information towards the soldier.

Historical drama by Martin Scorsese based on a novel by Shûsaku Endô: In 1633, two Portuguese Jesuits set off for Japan in search of their former mentor, Father Cristóvão Ferreira. Christians are being mercilessly persecuted in the country and Ferreira is said to have renounced his faith. The two missionaries soon experience the misery first-hand...

Ex-child star Christine Rapp from Mr. Monk's favourite childhood TV show is publishing her memoirs and he wants to be the first to get a copy. But just before the release there is an attack on her. While everyone soon realizes that this must have something to do with the scandalous sex revelations in the book, Monk doesn't want to know anything about it and is happy to play Rapp's bodyguard.

On the street corner where Mr. Monk lives, a Nigerian woman visiting San Francisco is hit by a van and the driver commits a hit-and-run. Her husband Samuel sits on the corner grieving, which disturbs Monk. But when he learns that Samuel has lost his wife like he did, he wants to do everything he can to help him ...

Mr. Monk has accompanied Natalie to Nevada, but on the way back at night her car breaks down. Mr. Monk sees something that looks like a UFO. Since it takes time to repair the car, the two of them take a hotel room in a village, where others also see the UFO. The place fills up with UFO believers and they quickly notice that Mr. Monk is strange for a human...

Hitman Frank DePalma is run over by a bus in Los Angeles. Since Mr. Monk looks very much like him, FBI agent Stone wants Monk to pose as DePalma in order to find out what job he had in LA. Monk doesn't want to at first, but as time goes by he becomes more and more absorbed in his new self ...

Film adaptation of William Diehl's novel of the same name: a Chicago archbishop is brutally murdered. Aaron, covered in blood, is arrested as an urgent suspect. Although the case seems clear-cut, star defense attorney Martin Vail takes it on pro bono. For Edward Norton as the accused, his role in this film laid the foundations for a stellar career.
Scandalous erotic film by Bernardo Bertolucci from 1972 about the affair between a young French woman and an older American man.

Fifth part of the successful Scary Movie series. Jody and Dan take in his brother's three neglected children who have been found abandoned in the woods. But in doing so, they bring something evil into the house...
Persiflage on numerous horror films from the US.

Archaeologist Jack Wilder (Shane West) accidentally receives clues to the location of El Dorado, the legendary city of gold, from an ancient Inca oracle. He sets off on a long journey to the center of Peru. His expedition turns into a deadly hunt when he is pursued by the mysterious mercenary Colonel Sam Grissom (Luke Goss) and falls into the hands of the corrupt Peruvian army.
TV drama based on German comedian Gaby Köster's book about her stroke.

Because of global warming, Christmas is snowless across the United States. Only in Springfield does any kind of snow fall due to pollution. That's why vacationers come to the city from everywhere and everything becomes more expensive. Marge is forced to turn the Simpsons' house into a guesthouse and take in guests.

The comic book seller meets a young Japanese woman in his shop. He wants to be with her and seeks advice from Homer. In fact, young Kumiko accepts the fat bachelor as he is, but then her father suddenly appears.
Bart meets a boy who runs a falconry business at school. Bart befriends him, but discovers that his new friend is actually crazy.

Bart refuses to play a prank on Lisa when the school bullies ask him to. This earns him the appreciation of his mother, but ridicule at school. So, as a test of courage, he jumps off a dam wall, which almost costs him his life. When he awakens again, he claims to have spoken to Jesus. This calls Christian filmmakers into action...

Film project produced by Robert de Niro, in which he also played a leading role. It was directed by Martin Scorsese. It's about the American labor leader Jimmy Hoffa, who had connections to organized crime, was considered an enemy of the FBI and disappeared without a trace on July 30, 1975.
Five school friends meet again after years and want to relive old times. But it also brings back memories of a terrible experience.

Grampa Simpsons retires as champion of the fishing competition and expects Homer to take over his position. Although he has never won anything, he catches the biggest fish. He soon realizes that Bart has been cheating and they decide to cheat in all kinds of competitions. Meanwhile, Lisa hopes to be accepted to the university summer camp.

Mr. Monk seems to have solved another murder case in his ingenious way, this time how the artist Evan Gildea killed his wife. But then Gildea's lawyer Harrison Powell takes Monk apart in the trial, so that the jury acquits Gildea. Mr. Monk wants to quit his job, but there is still the young murder suspect Rudy, whose innocence Lieutenant Disher is convinced of.

Mr. Monk and Natalie are at a play in which Natalie's daughter Julie is also taking part. Critic John Hannigan is also in the audience, but to Natalie's great outrage he writes a scathing review of Julie's performance. When a murdered woman is found nearby and Natalie thinks she smells Hannigan's aftershave, she is convinced that he is the killer.

An elderly woman is fatally hit by a child's baseball. A package sent three days earlier containing a voodoo doll that predicts this very death is found in her apartment. More such cases occur and Natalie is very worried because, to Mr. Monk's astonishment, she believes in voodoo. He himself is sure that there is a natural explanation.

After attending a wedding, Selma asks Marge to help her find a husband. She delegates the task to Homer, whose choice falls on principal Skinner. But Selma is shy at the get-to-know-you dinner, so she sends her twin sister Patty ahead. Skinner promptly falls in love - with Patty...

Bart wins a bottle of tequila on a Spanish-language TV show. Homer steals it from his son and treats everyone to one in Moe's tavern. Moe drinks a little too much himself and begins to spill the secrets of the people of Springfield that he knows through the bartenders' secret organization. As a result, he is kicked out of the organization and his guests are never allowed to drink alcohol again.

In 1970, Agent Terrance from the British secret service MI5 believes that a spy is working for the Russians in the USA under the code name Grey Fox. But it is not until 50 years later that he thinks he has uncovered him: It's supposed to be Grampa Simpson. Terrance sneaks into his retirement home and seeks contact with Homer. At first, Homer can't believe that his father could be a spy.
Explore the life of Moses, his journey from outcast and murderer to prophet and liberator of the Hebrews from Egyptian oppression.
Film adaptation of the cult comics by Jim Davis about the fat, lazy cat Garfield. Garfield's master Jon takes a liking to the little dog Odie - much to the cat's displeasure.

In the original production by NRK and Netflix, Sopranos veteran Steven Van Zandt plays a New York mobster who rats out his boss. As he is a sports fan, he chooses the Norwegian town of Lillehammer as his new home in the witness protection program, which he always pronounces as 'Lilyhammer'.

After four weeks in prison, transgender prostitute Sin-Dee learns from her friend Alexandra that her boyfriend and pimp Chester has cheated on her in the meantime. Furious, Sin-Dee sets off in search of him. In the process, she meets Armenian cab driver Razmik, a good customer whose family knows nothing about his preferences.

The owner of the ageing Grand Budapest Hotel tells a guest about his experiences as a lobby boy in the 1930s with Gustave, the concierge at the time. Gustave comes under suspicion of murder when a wealthy regular guest of the hotel dies.

In 1947, the now 93-year-old Sherlock Holmes lives in a country house with his housekeeper Mrs. Munro and her son Roger and devotes himself to beekeeping. He is trying to write down his last case, which involved a woman. But that was 35 years ago and his memory has deteriorated considerably.

Astronaut and test pilot Colonel Steve Austin is critically injured in a plane crash. Only an operation costing 6 million dollars, in which bionic body parts are transplanted, saves him. With the enormous strength he has gained as a result, he now works as an agent for the Office of Scientific Intelligence.

Mr. Monk's health insurance no longer pays for his therapy sessions with Dr. Bell. Mr. Monk is shocked and because he has no choice, he goes to Dr. Bell's group therapy instead. There he meets his arch-enemy Harold Krenshaw of all people and, to make matters worse, someone seems to be murdering the group members one by one ...

Mr. Monk is turning 50 and Natalie is determined to give him a surprise party, which Monk wants to prevent because he hates birthdays. Apart from that, he has to solve the case of a janitor who was dismembered in a trash compactor and a patent attorney who was poisoned during a police interview.
The crime drama series shows the experiences of the crew of a third watch in Manhattan, which consists of firefighters, police officers and paramedics.

Mr. Monk's previous assistant Sharona comes to visit unexpectedly. She has an appointment in town because her uncle died after a fall on a golf course and she is supposed to receive compensation. But Monk quickly realizes that it was no accident. His bigger problem, however, is that he is now with Sharona and Natalie and the two don't always get on well.

Steve DeWitt has an argument with his mistress, causing her to fall and die. Since he hides the body, no one knows where the dead woman is and someone has to take care of her dog. Mr. Monk surprisingly offers to take it in, and although the animal doesn't always do what Mr. Monk wants, he also finds positive sides to his new companion.

Homer gets a job offer at the new nuclear power plant in Shelbyville. Because he doesn't think he can pass the online interview, Professor Frink helps him. When Homer actually gets the job, Frink has to tell him what to do at work via earplugs. But there's still Dr. Spivak, whose job Homer got and who is now his assistant ...

Mr. Monk hopes to return to the police force, but Captain Frank Willis from the three-man committee deciding on the case doesn't seem to like Monk. When Monk learns that Lieutenant Disher is going camping with some boys and that Willis' son Brian is with them, Monk wants to go along to ingratiate himself with Brian. But in the wilderness they come across criminals ...

Musical from 1955, starring Frank Sinatra, Jean Simmons and Marlon Brando. Sinatra plays Nathan Detroit, who is being watched by the police and at the same time has to organize an illegal dice game, which will get him the 1000 dollars he needs. Brando plays his counterpart Sky Masterson, who makes a bet for the love of a woman.

Family drama from 1981, Henry Fonda and Katherine Hepburn won Oscars for their leading roles. The ageing cynic Norman and his wife Ethel go on vacation to Golden Pond, as they do every year. Because Norman is turning 80, daughter Chelsea also turns up this time with her fiancé Bill and his son Billy. Tensions arise, but Billy is still to spend the vacation there.

The burnt body of a man has been found in a park. But this time the case is a secondary matter, because Captain Stottlemeyer wants to marry his girlfriend T.K. and Mr. Monk is to be best man. But then the captain's home is burgled and T.K. realizes how dangerous life as a policeman can be ...

Surprise for Mr. Monk: Captain Stottlemeyer has finally managed to get Monk back on the police force after 12 years. Monk is thrilled, but this also means saying goodbye to Natalie. However, when he has his first day, it turns out that he can no longer work in his old department and is not supposed to help in the search for a serial killer.

In a birthing center, the doctor is murdered, whom Mr. Monk had questioned 12 years ago about a missing midwife, on the same day that Monk's wife Trudy was killed by a car bomb. Monk is able to identify the murderer from a fingerprint, but the fugitive is ordered to poison Monk. If no antidote is found within a few days, Monk will die...

The likelihood of an antidote to Mr. Monk's poisoning being found in time is slim. With his end in sight, he unwraps the gift that his wife Trudy gave him before her death 12 years ago. It contains a video in which Trudy tells things that shake Monk, but also provide new clues to her death ...
French adaptation of the novel \This Sweet Sickness\" by Patricia Highsmith with Gérard Depardieu and Miou-Miou. Day after day
column3: David Martinaud builds a castle for his dream woman Lise - except that she is already taken and a mother."

abstract: US animated film by Walt Disney, who used Cinemascope for the first time. The film tells the touching story of the fine cocker spaniel (dog) lady who falls in love with the mongrel dog. One of the legendary (and much quoted) film moments is when the two of them eat spaghetti together.
Silas is an actor. He travels to London for an important audition. But in his wait for an answer, the line between reality and his fantasies becomes thinner and thinner.

In a culture immersed in technology, Instagram is reviving adventure, face to face community and real relationships. Through sharing the stories of friends old and new, \Instagram Is\" sets out to discover the answer to the question \"How can something so digital get people out from behind their devices and into the analog world?\""

Eloise goes to London to study fashion design. When she moves into a small apartment, she begins to dream vividly of the 1960s and a woman called Sandie who wants to become a singer. This is fitting, as Eloise is fascinated by the era. But then Sandie's story and Eloise's visions become increasingly dark...

War drama by Ronald F. Maxwell, set at the end of the 19th century. In the middle of the American Civil War, the two armies clash near the small town of Gettysburg. One of the bloodiest battle scenes in film history.

\Flight of the Conchords\" is a US comedy series about two New Zealand musicians who experience bizarre things in the USA. It is interspersed with jokes and their own music. The series was broadcast in two seasons by HBO and then ended at the request of the two protagonists."

Nine years ago, Norway cut itself off from the rest of the world and tried to be self-sufficient. Biologist Esther Winter is responsible for the food supply from salmon farms in Bergen. She actually wants to go to Oslo, but something seems to be wrong on one of the salmon farms. Meanwhile, an English couple with a baby are trying to cross the heavily secured border into Norway.

Following global crises, Norway elects a prime minister who ensures that the country completely isolates itself and tries to become entirely self-sufficient from the rest of the world. At first the plan seems to work, but then a virus breaks out ...

While Esther Winter is still busy securing the food supply after the outbreak of the salmon epidemic, the virus appears to have spread to a first human. The British woman Uma tries to reach Norwegian waters in a rubber dinghy and the ambitious speechwriter Ariel gets a job with the Prime Minister.

The emergence of the pathogen is to be blamed on illegal migrants. Prime Minister Heyerdahl uses biologist Esther to announce a lockdown in Bergen in a press release. Esther also finds a pathogen on the plantation where Briton Charlie works. There Charlie is still waiting for a sign of life from his wife ...
Award-winning documentary from France about the life of insects in a meadow in close-up.

After Jay has slept with her new boyfriend for the first time, he tells her that a curse has been passed on to her: a creature that can take any form and that no one but her can see will follow her - slowly but steadily and unstoppably.

Adaptation of the autobiographical novel by Stefanie Zweig from director Caroline Link. A Jewish couple leave Germany before the Second World War for Kenya, where their daughter grows up. Problems arise at the interface with African culture, to which only little Regina finds easy access

Drama about the life of a shepherd family in Inner Mongolia. The headstrong young Tuya confidently defies the difficulties of life in the barren Mongolian steppe. Chinese director Wang Quan'an was awarded the Golden Bear at the 2007 Berlinale for his film.

Guy and Prisca are vacationing on a remote island with their two children. What the children don't know is that this is their last family vacation together, as they are planning to separate. This trip to a picturesque beach is supposed to provide some wonderful memories. But it soon becomes clear that strange things are going on at the beach...\
\

One morning, farmer Graham Hess discovers a 200-meter crop circle in one of his fields. After that, more mysterious things happen: the dog attacks Graham's children, seemingly invisible strangers hang around the farm, more crop circles appear around the globe, and bright lights are discovered over major cities...

Programmer Caleb is invited to spend a week with the extremely rich, eccentric Nathan, whom he admires. Nathan has developed the dominant internet search engine and lives alone on a huge high-tech estate in the wilderness. There, Caleb is to test the revolutionary AI Ava and find out whether it can be certified as intelligent, conscious or even alive.

An anthology horror film that picks up on Halloween customs. Anyone who disregards them will have to deal with Sam, a pumpkin-headed gnome who's no good at eating cherries. But there are also other creatures roaming among the people on Halloween night...
The sitcom follows the lives of five single mothers and fathers and their children.

Sharona surprises Mr. Monk at the airport by telling him that he is to fly with her to visit her aunt. He gets on the plane despite his fear of flying, but his anxiety soon turns the passengers and the stewardess against him. This proves to be a disadvantage when he discovers evidence that a fellow passenger has killed his wife.

Adrian Monk was an investigator with the San Francisco police, but after a traumatic event he developed obsessive-compulsive disorder. Because of his extraordinary perceptive powers, however, he is reinstated as a police consultant when a woman is stabbed to death and shortly afterwards an assassination attempt is made on the mayoral candidate St. Claire.
Adrian Monk continues to search for the person who carried out an assassination attempt on the St. Claire mayoral candidate.

The wife of former commissioner Ashcombe drives her car off the road in the rain at night and plunges down a slope. Some time later, psychic Dolly Flint wakes up in her car and finds the wreckage half buried by a mudslide. Monk is certain that Ashcombe killed his wife and gave the psychic money.

A judge dials 911 because a man has broken into her house. She is only able to give the intruder's name, but then the connection breaks down and she is found beaten to death in her bedroom shortly afterwards. But when the investigators find out who the intruder allegedly was, they are faced with a problem: Dale Biederbeck weighs around 400 kilos and doesn't fit through any doors.

Lieutenant Adam Kirk meets an informant at the fairground. He insists that they talk on the Ferris wheel. But when they are in the air, the informant starts screaming that he is being attacked and soon lies stabbed to death in the gondola. Lieutenant Kirk swears he didn't do anything. Monk, meanwhile, hopes to be able to return to police duty soon.

Without realizing it, Monk has invaded the house of his deceased wife Trudy, believing it to be his home. The new residents call the police and Monk is sent to a mental institution. He learns from a fellow resident that a doctor was murdered there a few years ago, which immediately arouses his criminal interest.

Ex-cop Archie Modine and his girlfriend are attacked in a backyard by a man armed with a knife. Modine draws his gun and shoots the attacker. But he turns out to be the billionaire Sidney Teal. Meanwhile, Sharona is angry with Mr. Monk because he is not paying her salary, which she desperately needs.

Monk accompanies Sharona and her son Benjy on vacation. But lying on the beach is not his thing. When Benjy believes he has seen a woman being murdered through a hotel window, Monk joins forces with the crime-mad hotel detective Brownyn to search for a possible victim.

When San Francisco is shaken by an earthquake, Christine Rutherford seizes the opportunity, kills her wealthy husband and makes it look as if he has been killed by a fallen wardrobe. Sharona knows the couple and wants to support the widow. But because she could uncover the murder, the perpetrator sets her lover on her, who pretends to be a journalist.

Scotty has been paraplegic since birth and finally wants to lose his virginity. When he hears about a brothel in Canada that caters to the physically disabled, he persuades Mo, who is visually impaired, and Matt, who is also in a wheelchair, to go there with him. However, their parents are not allowed to know about it, which is why they hire the nurse Sam.

Cam and Mitch have bought a new house and are adopting another baby, but Mitch can't part with the old house. The Dunphy kids secretly try to clean up the aftermath of a party when Claire and Phil come home unexpectedly early, and Jay and Manny try to figure out which of them knows more about wine.

In this thriller, Jean-Louis Trintignant plays a patient who has escaped from a medical facility and finds shelter with an artist couple living in seclusion in the French Cévennes. He claims that he was tortured in the institution and is therefore on the run ...

Homer gives Moe the recipe for a drink that he has invented by chance. It tastes so good that Moe quickly turns the \Flaming Homer\" into \"Flaming Moe's\" and passes it off as his invention. While Moe has great success with it
column3: Homer is furious with his friend."

abstract: Bart is disrespectful towards Homer, which is why Homer wants to teach him who's boss. When Bart refuses to eat his broccoli, an argument ensues in which neither of them wants to give in. Marge can think of no other solution than to send them off on a therapy sailing ship. But Bart gets the upper hand there.

Homer is admitted to an insane asylum because he had Bart fill out his personality test. There he meets a tall white man pretending to be Michael Jackson, who is staying there voluntarily. Michael accompanies Homer to Springfield, where he works with Bart on a birthday song for Lisa.

Krusty the Clown has promised to come to the Simpsons for dinner because Bart once helped him. When he finally arrives, he is reminded of his father, a rabbi who disowned him years ago. Because Krusty suffers greatly from this, Bart and Lisa want to help reconcile the two.

Reporter Chuck once worked for the big newspapers, but was repeatedly fired because of his lifestyle and is now working for a small local newspaper in the countryside. When a local man is trapped in a cave, Chuck senses his chance to make it big with exclusive reports. But this means the rescue has to take as long as possible ...

Because Cam and Mitch's flight is delayed several times, the whole family still has time to say goodbye. Claire wants to take back with Mitch the figure skating trophy they won many years ago, Haley and Alex reenact an old video with Luke, while Jay seems completely absent to Gloria, but actually has a surprise for her.

Lisa's therapist explains to her that her anxiety is caused by Homer's reckless driving and prescribes go-karting as therapy. Lisa is quickly hooked and becomes a professional driver. The international Kids Formula 1 takes place in Springfield of all places, where her worst opponent is a rich boy from Italy.

After a plane crash in the French Alps, Mathieu Vasseur from the aviation authority examines the voice recorder. He hears someone entering the cockpit, so the case is classified as a terrorist attack. But for Mathieu, something is not right, yet he is not taken very seriously. Nevertheless, he continues to investigate and soon believes there is a conspiracy ...

The film tells the story of Brit Eddie Edwards, who has dreamed of taking part in the Olympic Games since he was a child and finally wants to try his luck as a ski jumper. A blatant outsider who is ridiculed by everyone, his determination leads him to find a sponsor in Bronson Peary, an ex-professional who is addicted to alcohol, to help him qualify for the 1988 Olympics.
Remake of the Swedish film \A Man Called Ove\". Otto pedantically ensures that the rules in his housing estate are obeyed. This doesn't make him any friends
column3: but he doesn't want any either
column4: because after the death of his wife he doesn't want to go on living. That's when the cheerful Marisol and her family move in opposite
column5: and over time she manages to build up a bond with Otto."

abstract: Sitcom about a circle of friends in New York. Looking back from the year 2030, Ted Mosby tells his children how he met the love of his life and the children's mother in the years 2005-2014. The series places as much emphasis on humor as it does on relationship advice and puts the modern single in the foreground.
Drama about the ordeal of a defenseless family man in New York who is accused of robbery by the investigating authorities - based on unknowingly false witness statements.

Darby wants to visit her mother in hospital when she gets caught in a snowstorm late at night. As the roads are closed, she finds shelter in a remote visitor center where four other stranded people are staying. By chance, she discovers that there is a kidnapped girl in one of the vehicles parked there. But who is the culprit and who can she trust?

On the way to the amusement park, Mr. Bean accidentally takes a baby carriage, including a baby lying in it, with the lever of the trunk on his car. Now he tries to have fun on the show rides despite the unwanted companion. Not only does the child get into danger, Mr. Bean also has to rescue a goldfish.

Comedy series about the three friends Parker Lewis, Mikey Randall and Jerry Steiner. The three of them compete with wit and coolness against the tyrannical principal Grace Musso and her right-hand man Frank Lemmer, as well as Parker's sister. They ensure their survival at high school by comparing watches and coming up with cool plans.

A paramilitary group of young people is guarding a foreign hostage in a remote area. The heavily armed boys and girls don't have much to do except for the occasional appearance of the messenger from their superior organization. This leads to tensions within the group ...

Musical version of Shakespeare's play. The King of Navarre and his three companions want to devote themselves entirely to science and forgo love affairs. But then the Princess of France appears with her three handmaidens ...

In 1979, six young people travel to a farm where they have booked the guest house to shoot a porn movie. Among them is Maxine, who wants to make it big, the young director RJ and his girlfriend, the shy Lorraine, for the sound. They haven't told the owners of the farm about their plans, but the two old people aren't as harmless as they seem.

Contract killer Arthur Bishop has retired in Brazil, but then a woman turns up demanding that he kill three people. He flees from her and her client to Thailand, where he meets the attractive Gina. But the client, an old acquaintance of Bishop's, soon has leverage to get him to carry out the murders.
Animated series based on the children's sitcom \The Ghost Busters\" from 1975. There is officially no connection with the 1984 blockbuster \"Ghostbusters\"."

Italian romantic drama by Giuseppe Tornatore, set in Italy in the 1940s. Malèna (Monica Belluci) is the most beautiful woman in a small Sicilian village. When her husband is drafted into the war, all the men in the village turn to her and the women weave a web of intrigue out of jealousy. Even 13-year-old Renato is already obsessed with Malèna ...

Crime drama about three cops in Brooklyn. The burnt-out Eddie Dugan (Richard Gere) has only a few days until retirement when he is suddenly asked to babysit a newcomer. Tango (Don Cheadle) investigates as an undercover cop in Brooklyn's drug scene. Sal (Ethan Hawke) is a member of a special squad, but his salary is far from enough.

At the end of the 1960s, 9-year-old Buddy is growing up in a Protestant working-class family in Belfast. Neighborly relations in his street are good, although Protestants and Catholics live together. But then Protestants start rioting and want to drive the Catholics out of the area. Life becomes increasingly difficult for all the residents ...

Abraham receives a commission from God to move to a land that God will show him. On the journey to the Promised Land of Canaan, Abraham and his tribe have to complete numerous arduous tasks. Abraham is also put to the test more than once, including on the day when he is ordered by God to sacrifice his son Isaac.

Terry believes that his fiancée June is secretly cheating on him. One day, when June rents a room at the Riverview Hotel, he secretly follows her and books room 508, directly opposite June's room 507. He calls his best friend Julian and confesses that he has stolen Julian's gun from his apartment. Julian fears the worst and rushes to Terry's hotel...
Fantasy comedy and sequel to \Airplane!\". This time the team is on a trip to the moon
column3: which is jeopardized by a crazy bomber."

abstract: German comedy, initially in two seasons, about a teacher who is transferred to a big city school with children from difficult social backgrounds. There he repeatedly puts his foot in his mouth.

Hungarian movie from 1918 by Michael Curtis. Professor ten Brinken experiments with artificial insemination using the sperm of an executed sex murderer. A prostitute is artificially inseminated with it. The product is the girl \Mandrake\"."

Professor ten Brinken is experimenting with artificial insemination using the sperm of an executed sex murderer. A prostitute is artificially inseminated with it. The product is the girl \Mandrake\"."

After the tragic accidental death of their young son, a couple retreats to a secluded cabin in the woods to come to terms with their loss and undergo therapy. In their attempt at therapy, the natural boundaries of sex, violence and human psychology are crossed.
After working for a long time in the USA, Pedro returns to his Mexican home village, to his wife and daughters, from whom he has become estranged.

When Jack's parents die in a bizarre mishap on his 35th birthday, Jack's life changes. He has to sell the house he has lived in since childhood. In the process, he carelessly throws away Benny, his favorite stuffed animal from childhood. He should not have done this, because Benny takes cruel revenge, not on Jack, but on everyone who makes Jack's life difficult.

In this drama, young Marty, who is more of an outsider, is constantly exploited by his friend Bobby. He has to do unpleasant jobs for him. One day, Marty falls in love with a woman who is then completely on his side and wants to finally get Bobby out of the way with him. The film is based on a true story that took place in Florida in 1993.
Brian de Palma's adaptation of Stephen King's horror novel about a young, abused girl who discovers her telekinetic abilities. With Sissy Spacek in the leading role of Carrie White.
Swedish version of the disguise theme \Charly's Aunt\" in feature film form made in 1926."

At an American high school, it is no longer the principal or the teachers who rule, but a teenage punk gang. The music teacher wants to put a peaceful end to it all. But he fails. A short time later, his car is on fire and a young girl dies. Canadian thriller by Mark L. Lester from 1982.
US cartoon series about ten-year-old Timmy, who gets help from the fairies Cosmo and Wanda.

Dark Blood is the unfinished last film starring River Phoenix, who died of a drug cocktail in front of the infamous Viper Room in 1993. Directed by George Sluizer (The Vanishing), Dark Blood tells a dark story about a young widower (River Phoenix) who lives a lonely and isolated life in a nuclear test site, waiting for the end of the world.
Comedy about a Berlin working day: Bulcke is a pushy man who annoys his whole family, his dictatorial decrees are subtly challenged and ridiculed by Quitt, the boyfriend of his daughter Katherine.

David, a shepherd from Bethlehem, is anointed as the new king of Israel by Samuel, the prophet of God. After David kills the Philistine Goliath and wins the sympathy of the people, he has to flee from the jealous Saul. Years later, he returns to Jerusalem and establishes his kingship. But there are also problems in his own family that challenge him.
Simone is in love with the pop star \R\" and writes him love letters. When he doesn't reply
column3: she lies in wait for him outside a TV studio and actually manages to get a lift from him. However
column4: everything turns out differently than they both imagined."

abstract: Retired policemen Alois Gallenmüller and Toni Wimser chase a gang of thieves all the way to Hamburg St. Pauli.

Historical documentary about the settler's daughter Cynthia Ann Parker, who was kidnapped by Comanches in 1836, which the German TV station \Sat.1\" broadcast in 2013 following the TV film \"Striving for Freedom\"."

Dirt Merchant is convinced of himself and believes he is an asset to the music world. His boss sees things differently and kicks him out. Later, his girlfriend is also gone. When Dirt finds a well-known rock star dead, he also comes under suspicion of murder. He has to find the real culprit and enters the underworld of Hollywood, which is full of danger and sex.
Two time travelers fighting for world power duel in New York.
\Dynasty\" was an American prime time soap on the ABC channel in response to the success of rival channel CBS and its series \"Dallas\". Even more than Dallas
column3: Dynasty became a part of pop culture in the 1980s
column4: the embodiment of a decade. In 1984/1985
column5: \"Dynasty\" was even the most-watched television series in the world."

abstract: American coming-out film from 1999 about Rod, a gay man who awakens unexpected feelings in \heterosexual\" Eric."
First film in the \Lemon Popsicle\" series
column3: which achieved cult status and was one of the first films to deal with teenage sexuality in the 1970s. Best friends Benji (Yftach Katzur)
column4: Momo (Jonathan Sagall) and Yudale (Zachi Noy) are on the hunt for sexual adventures. But then Benji falls in love with Nili (Anat Atzmon). However
column5: she has a crush on Momo
column6: who gets her pregnant."

abstract: The couple Carl and Yaya are modeling, with Yaya also having more money as an influencer. The two can go on a luxury cruise for free, where only the alcoholic captain is not prepared to fulfill all the wishes of the super-rich. But one stormy night, everything gets out of hand and they are shipwrecked ...

The Jewish girl Hadassah comes to the court of Xerxes, King of the Persians, and from then on calls herself Esther. Xerxes falls in love with her and marries the young girl. Esther soon discovers a plot. According to the plot, Haman, the king's chief chamberlain, is planning the annihilation of the Jews in Persia, and thus also her own life and that of her uncle Mordechai.

US sci-fi comedy in which an asteroid brings extraterrestrial micro-organisms to Earth. Dr. Kane and Prof. Block, the discoverers, discover that the organisms evolve rapidly and soon form an aggressive ecosystem. Although the military seals off the site, aliens keep escaping...
The documentaries in the style of the \mondo film\" show various
column3: particularly gruesome deaths
column4: which appear to the viewer like a montage of various news clips and amateur footage. The scenes depicted in the films consist of both real footage and re-enacted scenes. Due to the explicit depictions
column5: the films are banned in many countries."

abstract: Film comedy by Frederick De Cordova with Julie Adams.
Boris Karloff is probably the most unforgettable of all screen monsters in this movie. Frankenstein is considered by many to be the greatest horror movie of all time.

The film tells the story of the creation of the world and of Adam and Eve, who are expelled from paradise when they disobey God's word. Out of envy, Cain commits the first murder in history against his brother Abel. Centuries later, when mankind is evil, God decides to destroy the world in a flood; only Noah survives in his ark.

Third movie from Roberto Rossellini's neorealism series, which describes the fate of a 12-year-old boy who poisons his sick father in the distress of bombed-out Germany. The movie has rarely been shown in Germany.
A mentally disturbed man captures a woman at night and takes her home with him. There he ties her to a bed and, disguised as a samurai, begins to subject the woman to cruel torture.

A depressed man has finished with life and wants to take his own life. But he realizes that no self-mutilation technique, no matter how bloody, will kill him and so he ends up facing a friend with his neck cut open, his hand severed and a ruler rammed into his head...

Annie loses her mother, with whom she had a very difficult relationship. Shortly afterwards, her young daughter also dies in a car accident in which her son Peter is not entirely innocent. The tragedy opens up new and old wounds, but the real horror is yet to come for Annie...

After a car accident, Juliet is stranded with a broken leg in a hostile, post-apocalyptic wasteland. While she struggles to survive, the movie shows her complicated love affair with Jack in flashbacks. The two could hardly be more different: Juliet is a junkie and can barely read, whereas Jack is an educated and cultured gallery owner...
Sensual adaptation of Boccaccio's \Decameron\". Pasolini and his movie were often accused of pornography. In this and the two subsequent movies in his trilogy of life
column3: however
column4: the director did not want to merely hint at sexuality
column5: but to make it the central dramaturgical moment of the production."

abstract: The leitmotif of the film: all stories happen to a traveler. Aziz unknowingly lets his lover Aziza die because he follows his desires, Shazaman sleeps with the princess guarded by a demon, whose head is cut off as punishment, and Yuman is forced to kill an innocent man in order to overcome a witchcraft.

The film tells the pseudo-real story of English photojournalist Duane John Bradley, who was once traveling in the still unexplored Burmese/Thai border region when he disappeared without a trace. Years later, a scientific expedition discovers him in a remote village as the integrated head of a strange indigenous tribe.
In the movie by the German TV station \Sat.1\"
column3: German settlers fight against Indians in Texas."

abstract: A lonely hotel in a deserted area. Sarah (Johanna Leamo) is looking for her sister, who has been missing for two weeks. She is tired and desperately needs a place to sleep. \The Bridgeburn Hotel\" can be read on large illuminated letters at the side of the road. As she approaches
column3: the house looks empty and deserted. Sarah will soon hope that it was just that ..."

abstract: Six-part documentary from the \Icons Unearthed\" series about the animated series \"The Simpsons\"."

27 years have passed since friends Beverly, Bill, Richie, Mike, Ben, Eddie and Stanley defeated 'It'. With the exception of Mike, they now all live far away from Derry and can only remember fragments of what happened in the past. But now it's time to return home and face their demons - because 'It' is back...

Jacob betrays his twin brother Esau and must therefore fear his wrath. He flees through the desert to Haran to his uncle Laban. Here Jacob falls in love with Laban's daughter Rachel. He agrees to work for Rachel for seven long years, but is also betrayed at the wedding night when it is not Rachel but her sister Leah who lies next to him. Years later, Jacob also meets Esau again.
TV feature film about the life of Jesus Christ. The film is part of a thirteen-part series of television productions about the Bible. The film was broadcast as a two-part series.

The 18-year-old Joseph is sold into slavery in Egypt by his eleven jealous brothers. Here, Joseph comes into the possession of Potiphar, the head of Pharaoh's bodyguard. Thanks to his ability to interpret dreams, Joseph manages to become Pharaoh's deputy and one day sees his brothers again.
Larry Clark (known as the director of the scandalous film \Kids\" from 1995) shows young people who live out their sexuality without morals and taboos. Controversial
column3: partly pornographic film."

abstract: French social drama by Patrice Chereau. At the train station, Henri comes into contact with young male hustlers for the first time.

Susana, who works as a model in Paris, returns to her hometown of Madrid to look after her grandmother, who needs help after suffering a stroke. But the visit to her grandmother turns out to be very different from what Susana had imagined. Horror film by Spanish cult director Paco Plaza, known for films such as \[REC]\" (2007) and \"Verónica\" (2017)."

1985: The small town of Epecuén is hit by a meter-high tidal wave. 30 years later, the flood has receded. A group of young documentary filmmakers set off to make a documentary film. But apparently they are not completely alone in the destroyed city... Argentinian horror from the Onetti brothers (\Francesca\") in the style of \"Texas Chainsaw Massacre\"."

Suffering from paranoid schizophrenia, Frank Zito murders and scalps women on the streets of New York.
