The impulsive Pakistani and former DJ Ali still lives with his wife, but she has separated from him. When he drives a child from the neighborhood to school, he bumps into Ava, who works there. Despite their different tastes in music, they take a liking to each other, but Ava's grown-up son is against the relationship.

Musical adaptation by Tim Burton starring Johnny Depp and Helena Bonham Carter. Depp plays the barber Sweeney Todd, who returns to London 15 years after a bitter loss and moves in with the restaurateur Mrs. Lovett. However, he only has one thing on his mind: revenge on the man who took everything from him.

Greg tries to get through high school as inconspicuously as possible. He has neither enemies nor friends, except for Earl, whom he has known since early childhood, with whom he occasionally makes short films. When his mother finds out that his classmate Rachel has leukemia, she forces him to visit her. Over time, a kind of friendship develops, but then Rachel's condition worsens.

After “The Usual Suspects”, Bryan Singer's new film is based on a novel by Stephen King. In this US drama, sixteen-year-old Todd (Brad Renfro) befriends pensioner Kurt Dussander (Sir Ian McKellen) and believes he has discovered a Nazi criminal in him. A dangerous game of blackmail and addiction begins...
13-year-old Eric befriends eleven-year-old Dexter, who has AIDS.

German cult series about the Becker family from the Saarland. Father Heinz is simple-minded and prone to rambling stories, mother Hilde is just as naive, a typical stay-at-home mom and has her hands full cleaning up after Heinz. Son Stefan is the educated one of the family, who often has to play the mediator between Hilde and Heinz.

Heinz wants to build a terrace behind his house with the help of his neighbor Kurt. The daily noise disturbs the nouveau riche neighbors, the Schenkberg family, especially Mrs. Schenkberg. German bourgeoisie meets nouveau riche - and yet there are similarities...
Documentary about the lives of backing singers of big stars.

Award-winning documentary from 2003. Director Errol Morris interviews former US Secretary of Defense Robert S. McNamara about America and the key events of the 20th century. The main focus is on the question of why the last century is considered one of the cruellest in human history.

Western by Andy Warhol and Paul Morrissey from 1968. A bunch of cowboys in Arizona live in a male alliance. They have sex with each other. Suddenly a woman comes along and puts a strain on the clique's cohesion. But cowboys stick together.

Curtis lives a contented life with his wife Samantha and their deaf daughter Hannah. But suddenly he is plagued by terrible nightmares of an apocalyptic storm. However, he doesn't know whether these are visions of the future or the beginning of a mental illness, especially as his mother is suffering from schizophrenia. Worried, he tries to protect his family from the apocalypse.

Margot meets the artist Daniel on a flight. When they take a cab together, it turns out that Daniel lives just a few meters away from her. Margot is already happily married to Lou, but still feels attracted to Daniel.

After the death of her mother, 17-year-old Mia prefers to stay with her friend Jade. When they learn that classmates can summon the spirits of the dead using an embalmed hand, they also take part in such séances. During these sessions, they allow the spirits to take possession of the body of one of the participants for a short time. But one time this goes very wrong ...

Filmmaker Jafar Panahi has rented a room in an Iranian village on the border with Turkey, from where he is trying to supervise filming for a documentary in Turkey via the internet. It is about an Iranian couple who want to flee to Europe. But there is also drama at Panahi's place, as he is said to have photographed a forbidden love affair.

US sports comedy starring Adam Sandler, who also produced the film. He plays a notoriously unsuccessful ice hockey player who first finds his sporting happiness in golf. More by force than by choice, as this is the only way he can help his poor grandmother financially.\
\

Jimmy and Gretchen meet at a wedding and try to have a relationship even though they are both self-centered.\
\

Pop fairy tale by director Jacques Demy based on a fairy tale by Charles Perrault (1628 - 1703). The king only wants to marry a woman who is as beautiful as his deceased wife. He chooses his own daughter. The daughter wants to prevent this and hides, disguised in a donkey skin.

Chilean, internationally award-winning film from 2005 about two people who spend a night together in a hotel room. Director Matias Bize stages the film as a chamber play, with the camera and actors not leaving the hotel room for the entire film.
Batman
Spanish series in which teacher Tomás and investigator Maite try to solve a murder.
At a parents' evening, a group of parents decide that the primary school teacher Mrs. Müller is not good enough for their children and has to leave.

16-year-old Luce is sent to a secluded boarding school for adolescents with behavioral problems. On the one hand, because she has hallucinations and refuses treatment. On the other hand, because she is involved in a tragic death. Shortly after arriving, she meets the mysterious Daniel, whom she seems to know from her visions...

French horror film by and starring Roman Polanski from 1976. Trelkovsky, a young man, becomes the next tenant of an apartment in which the previous tenant has thrown herself out of the window. Only slowly does he begin to suspect that his neighbors want him to subtly become the previous tenant so that he too can take his own life.

Comedy from star director Wes Anderson with Jason Schwartzman and Bill Murray in the leading roles. Max is a loner at his private school, although he is involved in theater, among other things. Through his much older friend Herman Blume, he meets the teacher Rosemary and falls in love with her - just like his friend Herman...

In 1980, hard-working bank employee Dan Mahowny is promoted and now has greater freedom when it comes to granting loans. But his bosses have no idea that Dan is a gambling addict. In order to pay his debts, he resorts to more and more manipulations to try his luck with ever larger sums of money in casinos.

The animated film from the Disney studio is a free adaptation of the classic “Treasure Island” by Robert L. Stevenson. Space replaces the ocean that the treasure hunters Jim Hawkins, Long John Silver & Co. cross on their spaceship in search of the treasure planet.

TV star Lee Gates gives financial tips on his show “Money Monster”. But during the broadcast, an armed man gains access to the studio and forces Gates to put on an explosive vest. Kyle had followed Gates' recommendation to invest in IBIS shares, which cost him his savings. He now demands accountability on camera.
Steve Hudson's award-winning drama about a Scottish fishing boat crew who, in order to avoid financial bankruptcy, illegally transport Chinese emigrants to Scotland in their hold.

Fanny is married to the wealthy Jean and could actually be happy. But then she meets her old schoolmate Alain by chance. He is now a writer and very different from Jean and his rich friends. Fanny and Alain keep meeting up in secret and get closer ...
Drama series in which American history is rewritten when Charles Lindbergh is elected US President in 1940 and the country drifts towards fascism.

The narrator Joe looks back with nostalgia on his childhood in the 1930s and 1940s in the New York borough of Queens. Back then, the family lived with uncles, aunts and grandparents under one roof and the most important medium for information and entertainment was the radio.

This 1968 war drama stars Richard Burton and Clint Eastwood as two men from a special commando tasked with freeing an American general from German captivity during the Second World War. The film was directed by Brian G. Hutton and the screenplay and novel of the same name were written by Alistair MacLean.

Nerd Alvin is about to graduate from high school, where he is one of the outsiders. That's why he wants the attractive Paris to pay off her debt to him by pretending to be dating him for two weeks. Remake of “Can't Buy Me Love” from 1987.

Fossil collector Mary makes spectacular finds in her village on the English coast, but is hardly recognized by the male experts and lives in poverty. Then paleontologist Murchison and his wife Charlotte enter her lonely life. Because Murchison has to travel, Mary is asked to look after the depressed Charlotte. After some initial difficulties, the two grow closer.

Set in the year 1000 AD, this is the story of One Eye, a mute supernatural warrior who is held captive by the Vikings. He manages to escape, however, and joins a crusade to Jerusalem - together with a young boy who fed him during his captivity.

Ten years ago, Homer signed a timeshare contract with a luxury island resort. Now the family wants to redeem the points they bought for a vacation. But when they get there, they find out that the points are only good for a 20-minute stay. So they secretly stay at the hotel. While there, they run into an old acquaintance ...

Leslie is an alcoholic and although she won a large sum in the lottery a few years ago, she has no more money and has to vacate her apartment. She moves in with her 20-year-old son, but he can't stand her drinking any more than her old friend Nancy can. But when Leslie finds herself homeless outside a motel, the owner Sweeney gives her a job out of pity - her last chance.

The Griswold family go on a trip to Europe, which they have won in a game show. It goes without saying that not everything goes smoothly there. They suddenly have to drive on the left in London. And Paris is not spared either...
British comedy series about childish Don, who inherits his aunt's house and gets a few new housemates along with it.

Loriot is not only the French name for the oriole that adorns the coat of arms of the von Bülow family. Loriot is also the pseudonym of Vicco von Bülow, one of Germany's leading comedians. The series of the same name, first broadcast between 1976 and 1978, shows comedy sketches by and with Vicco von Bülow alias Loriot. There are a large number of episodes and specials.

In this famous early film by Andy Warhol, the painter Robert Indiane eats a mushroom for 45 minutes. This everyday action becomes an event through the absence of any other action - and shows that “real time” in film (where we are used to concentration) stretches the action and is almost unbearable.
Tough milieu study about trucker Don Barnes and his rebellious punk daughter CeBe.

Peter Fonda plays Heavenly Blues, the leader of the famous Hell's Angels motorcycle gang in Venice County, California. When he and his best friend Loser, played by Bruce Dern, try to get Loser's stolen motorcycle back, Loser ends up in the hospital. When the Hell's Angels get him out, he dies and they bury him. His funeral turns into another wild, uninhibited party...
Short film about a woman in her fifties (Claude Jade) who hides her drinking problem from her neighbors.

Psychological thriller by US director Robert Aldrich from 1962 starring Bette Davis and Joan Crawford. The two sisters Jane and Blanche live together in an estate in Hollywood. Both are famous actresses, but Jane has been in a wheelchair since an accident.

Psychological thriller by Robert Aldrich, which followed on from “What ever Happened to Baby Jane”. Bette Davis and Joan Crawford were originally supposed to play the leading roles again, but Olivia de Havilland stepped in for the ill Crawford and made the crime film about a mentally disturbed Southern woman a success.

Biopic about the German-Tunisian rapper Bushido. “Zeiten ändern Dich” (Times Change You  ) is the story of how the young school dropout and drug dealer Anis Mohamed Youssef Ferchichi became the musician Bushido and ultimately a German phenomenon. But it is also the story of an adolescent man who sooner or later has to face his demons.

Elisabeth, Empress of Austria-Hungary, finds herself in a life crisis on her 40th birthday in 1877. She has become estranged from her husband, Emperor Franz Joseph, her exclusively representative duties are not fulfilling her and the public is increasingly critical of the ageing empress. Her aversion to the strict rules is growing ...

“The Lovers” is Louis Malle's second film with Jeanne Moreau, who plays a married woman from the countryside with a lover in Paris. Due to its daring permissiveness for the 1950s, it sparked fierce protests and was only allowed to be shown in a shortened and toned-down version.

In this horror remake, Erin (Jessica Biel) is on her way back from Mexico with four friends when a disturbed, bleeding young woman crosses their path somewhere in the middle of nowhere in Texas. But before they can take her to the next town, she shoots herself with the words 'you're all going to die'. This turns out to be quite prophetic...

German comedy by comedian and show host Hape Kerkeling, who directs, writes and plays the lead role himself. He plays Peter Schlönzke, who has a stellar career in TV and rises from a cable carrier to show host, but then loses his grip on reality.
A man and a woman drive through a lonely Iranian mountain region. They have a suitcase full of money. They hand it out to various people along the way, but only if they agree to their terms.

Ehsan is frustrated with life: He would like to leave the country and work as a writer, but instead he has to look after his mother and his disabled sister. The latter avoids social situations because of her disability. Her mother therefore hopes in vain that she will find a man. Until Ehsan brings a colleague home with him...
A short film by PJ Liguori, \PJ
column3: Tiny Planet Explorer\" blends live-action and animation to depict an explorer's journey through strange worlds. Winner of the Virgin Media People's Choice Award in 2012
column4: it highlights Liguori's distinctive creative style."

abstract: \Stalled\" follows Pete
column3: a business executive who gets trapped in a time loop while in a restroom. As he experiences strange events and interacts with his past and future selves
column4: he must confront his selfish behavior to escape the loop."

abstract: The widowed Jeanne Dielman lives with her son Sylvain in Brussels and leads a seemingly normal housewife's life: cooking, cleaning and knitting are the orderly and uneventful tasks of her life. If it weren't for the visits from men she receives every afternoon while her son is at school.
From Senegal, a group of men set off for Europe in a simple fishing boat in the hope of a better life. But the journey, which lasts several days and is led by Captain Baye Laye, does not go as hoped.

Lisa goes to Capital City for a weekend with her aunts Patty and Selma. But the two women are only interested in food, so Lisa takes the opportunity to secretly immerse herself in the big city's art scene at night with friends of Patty. At first Lisa is happy, but then realizes that the artists are not what she thought they were.

Horror comedy by Mel Brooks. Frederick Frankenstein (Gene Wilder) is a surgeon and has to bite hard at his surname. Because under no circumstances does he want to be associated with the deeds of his grandfather, who tried to breathe life into dead matter. But when he inherits his grandfather's castle in Transylvania, he becomes interested in his grandfather's work.
The film meticulously depicts the fire at Notre-Dame Cathedral in Paris on April 15, 2019, the firefighters' battle against the flames and the rescue of relics.

Rosaline is in love with Romeo and is certain that they are meant to be together. But as their families are enemies, their love must remain a secret. Because her father wants to marry Rosaline off to Dario, Romeo meets Juliet, Rosaline's cousin, and falls in love with her. Full of jealousy, Rosaline plots against the two ...

Eco-activists Josh, Dena and Harmon plan to blow up a dam. Kelly Reichardt's drama sheds light not only on the preparation and implementation, but also on the effects on the psyche of the three protagonists.

Holly Burns returns from Christmas shopping with her three younger children to find her grown-up son Ben at the door. He is currently in rehab and shouldn't be home yet, but Holly makes an exception against her new husband Neal. Suspicious from previous experiences, she doesn't want to let him out of her sight for a second, but that doesn't go well for long.

Bart and Lisa end up with Professor Frink, who has invented a machine that allows you to see into the future. The two see their love life there just before high school. While Lisa is in a relationship with a muscular Milhouse, Bart is dating skateboarder Jenda. Homer, on the other hand, has been kicked out of the house by Marge and now lives in an underwater home.

Based on the novel 'A Kestrel For A Knave' by Barry Hines. Billy grows up in a working-class English town in poor circumstances with his mother and adult brother. He is terrorized by his brother and is an outsider at school. The only joy Billy finds is in raising and training a falcon.

At the beginning of the 17th century, Benedetta comes to the Pescia convent as a child. 18 years later, the peasant girl Bartolomea, who has fled from her violent father, is taken in. Benedetta is attracted to her and the two begin a secret relationship. As Benedetta has visions of Jesus, her role in the convent becomes increasingly important.

OJ Haywood is a horse trainer and works for film productions - when he is actually hired. Business is bad and the ranch owned by him and his sister Em is on the verge of bankruptcy. However, the problems somehow fade into the background when strange phenomena start happening around the ranch. The two want to capture this on camera in order to get some money ...

In 1986, young Ada is at an amusement park with her parents. In an unnoticed moment, she goes alone into a mirror maze, where she meets a girl who looks exactly like her. 30 years later, she returns there on vacation with her husband and two children. But in the evening, doubles of her family dressed in red appear at the door. A fight to the death begins.

Coroner Dr. Quincy is the main character of the series of the same name. In a total of 148 episodes, the doctor tries to solve mysterious deaths, sometimes somewhat overzealously, but always with the best of intentions. Quincy is usually accompanied by his assistant Sam Fujiyam, his superior Robert Asten and Lieutenant Frank Monahan.

While on vacation on a beach contaminated after a tanker accident, the children Eva and Hansi find a mass that they think is plasticine. They use it to make a blue and a green octopus, which soon develop a life of their own.

Research into the deadly Ebola virus is being carried out in the Oxenford Bio Lab research laboratory. Company founder Stanley Oxenford has invested his entire fortune and is interested in his managing director Antonia Gallo, much to the displeasure of his children Olga, Miranda and Kit. After a break-in at the laboratory, the family and the criminals are trapped in the same house by an ice storm.
A nightclub singer helps an eleven-year-old girl find her mother after the death of her father.
It tells the story of Patrick Olobo, Uganda's top-ranked tennis player, who has left the devastating civil war behind him to celebrate success in professional tennis.
A boy and a girl meet when they visit their fathers in prison.

The New York subway is paralyzed by crashed space debris from an old Soviet space station. However, it soon becomes clear that this is the least of the problems: something alive and very dangerous has also come to Earth with the scrap metal...

The three gangster brides Hal, Trixie and Camero are after diamonds worth 200 million dollars that are supposedly hidden in the desert. Of course they want to get their hands on the diamonds, but unfortunately others have the same plan. Thus begins a merciless chase under a blazing hot sun, in which many fall by the wayside.

Grace belongs to high society. She lives on a beautiful estate, grows orchids and organizes tea parties. When her husband commits suicide, however, she realizes that she is bankrupt and has an unaffordable mortgage on the house. Her talent as a gardener opens up a way out: she starts growing hemp with her Scottish employee Matthew...

Roman Polański's cult vampire movie comedy. Professor Abronsius travels through the Carpathian Mountains with his apprentice Alfred to research vampirism. In a country inn, they not only meet vampires, but also the beautiful Sarah, who fascinates Alfred just as much as local vampire lord Count von Krolock.

Social media influencer Madison is on vacation in Thailand. But she feels lonely because her boyfriend Ryan couldn't come with her. She is all the happier when she meets CW, who shows her around the country. CW also helps her out when Madison is robbed. But accompanying CW to a desert island was a mistake she shouldn't have made ...

The silent film 'The Last Laugh' (1924) is one of Murnau's masterpieces alongside 'Metropolis' (1927), which also brought him international popularity. Karl Freund's innovative camera work is more important to film history than the plot itself.

Action thriller by John Frankenheimer from 1998, set on the Côte d'Azur and in Nice, starring Jean Reno, Natascha McElhone and Robert de Niro. A mysterious young woman hires a team of mercenaries to retrieve a valuable suitcase. But others are after it too...

The actor Étienne is asked to lead a theater workshop in a prison. After initial difficulties with the five inmates, they manage to put on a successful short play in the prison. Étienne's ambition takes hold and he convinces the prison warden to rehearse the play “Waiting for Godot” so that they can perform it in a real theater.

Lydia Tár has come a long way as the internationally acclaimed chief conductor of a German orchestra. But her marriage to her first violinist Sharon suffers from her ambition. When Lydia takes the attractive young cellist Olga into the orchestra and gives her special support, this leads to conflict, while at the same time she is confronted with the consequences of a previous affair.

Santa is fed up with his job: the festivities have degenerated into pure commercialism and the children are greedy turds. So he sits in a bar on Christmas Eve and gets drunk before taking off in his sleigh and making his rounds. When he arrives at the estate of the dysfunctional Lightstone family, however, Santa's night gets even shittier because they're just being robbed...

Thriller by Wes Craven from 2005. While waiting for her night flight (hence the title Red Eye) from Dallas to Miami, the attractive Lisa Reisert meets the handsome Jackson Rippner. He also happens to be sitting next to her on the plane and turns out to be a contract killer who wants to kill Lisa's father if she doesn't help him organize an assassination attempt.

To make gardening easier for his dog Gromit, Wallace invents an intelligent robot garden gnome called Norbot. The penguin Feathers McGraw, who had been put behind bars by Wallace and Gromit for diamond theft, finds out about this. He manages to reprogram the robot remotely and use it for his evil purposes ...

Adaptation of the Assassin's Creed video game series, which, however, only adopts the basic setting. The plot, on the other hand, offers hardly any points of reference. It revolves around Cal Lynch, who is supposed to be executed but ends up in a secret research facility. There, his genetic memories are supposed to lead to a lost artifact...

Semi-autobiographical drama by Steven Spielberg about the young Sammy Fabelman, who wants to become a director himself after a traumatic first visit to the cinema in the 1950s and gains his first film experience with fellow pupils as actors. But through the camera, he also becomes aware of the marital problems of his parents, he a successful computer engineer, she an ex-pianist and now housewife.

At the height of his career, Puss in Boots loses his penultimate life. Fearing death, he moves anonymously to a cat shelter. But then he learns of a map to a wishing star, from which he wants to wish for new lives. Together with a carefree dog and his ex-girlfriend Kitty, he sets off on a search, but they are not the only ones who want the wishing star.

The Pin Pals bowling team, currently consisting of Homer, Moe, Carl, Flanders and the Portuguese Fausto, has qualified for the state championship. Barney wants to fly them there in a helicopter, but they crash in the snowy mountains. Left to their own devices, they now have to find their way back...

Animated film about a gang of thieves who seemingly turn good in order to avoid jail and commit a spectacular robbery as a bonus. The plan would certainly have worked if a criminal genius hadn't intervened. Suddenly the gang is the scapegoat for a robbery they didn't commit...

Bernardo Bertolucci's film adaptation of Alberto Moravia's novel \The Conformist\" shows a man who has always conformed throughout his life and whose conformism in the fascist system brings guilt upon him."

The ingenious super criminal Fantomas is wreaking havoc throughout France. Using ever new tricks, he manages to fool the police and escape. Inspector Juve is persistent but apparently has no chance. The famous journalist Fandor believes Fantomas is a fiction and publishes a fake, mocking interview with him. This makes the criminal feel challenged ...

An action thriller by Alex de la Inglesia, set in the USA and Mexico. The gangster couple par excellence, the prostitute Perdita (Rosie Perez) and the crook and drug mule Romeo (Javier Bardem), embark on a wild journey through the border region. On the way to Las Vegas, they even kidnap a teenage couple.
Big-budget German television series about Berlin in the golden 1920s. Four seasons with 40 episodes have been produced to date.

During a reburial at the cemetery, one too many bodies are found in a grave - and a business card from a private detective agency with Grampa Simpson's name on it. Grampa explains that he and his partner Billy were private detectives in the 1980s and that Agnes Skinner had hired them to spy on Mr. Burns. Billiy agreed to do this and then disappeared without a trace ...
Science fiction thriller by James Cameron in which a submarine sinks and encounters a mysterious, UFO-like structure. Known for its extraordinary special effects and underwater shots.

Norwegian road movie. Ex-professional skier Jomar lives a secluded life in a mountain hut. He tries to cope with his depression and anxiety by drinking. But when he finds out that he has a four-year-old son, he sets off on his snowmobile across snowy Norway to visit his son and his ex-wife. On the way, he meets a lot of quirky Norwegians.

After an argument, Vittoria leaves her messed-up relationship with her boyfriend Riccardo one morning. At the stock exchange, where her mother speculates, she meets Piero, a stockbroker. But this relationship has no future either ...
A man stuck inside his house during a worldwide lockdown starts to lose not just his friends, but also his sanity.
One man's hat is another man's treasure when it comes to the importance and significance of saving items of historic value.
A vlogger with an aspiration to conquer a difficult hike encounters a dark secret after a mysterious man offers him help.

Single mother, highly intelligent but chaotic Morgane Alvaro works as a cleaner for the police. She accidentally comes across inconsistencies in the case of a murdered man and his missing wife and writes them down in the files. Inspector Hazan realizes that Morgane, with her razor-sharp mind, could be of help. But Morgane also has a problem with authority.

Morgane has been officially hired by Inspector Hazan as a consultant for the police and is supposed to help Karadec with the investigation, which he doesn't like at all. Her first case is a dead man in a hotel bathtub who had met a woman there under a false identity. Meanwhile, Hazan is trying to find out something about Morgane's boyfriend Romain, who disappeared 15 years ago.

Joe Buck is a simple country boy who goes to New York to earn money as a gigolo. Instead, he is cheated, including by the down-and-out small-time crook Ratso. When Joe is broke, he moves into the sick Ratso's squat. In the freezing cold, they try to keep their heads above water and dream of a warm Florida. Big city drama by John Schlesinger.
A young man loses touch with reality after his mother dies, and blames the local church, while the police look to solve a murder.

Bolivia, 1981: Backpacker Yossi has made friends with like-minded Kevin and Marcus when they meet dropout Karl, who persuades them to go with him on a trip through the jungle to an isolated tribe. It soon becomes clear that the trip is more difficult than they thought, and shortly afterwards it's a matter of bare survival...
What road rage can do to you if you have the right moves.

Olivia wishes she was the kind of person who goes to book clubs but she isn't. During a phone call with her book club friend Emma we realize that Olivia has other plans for the evening. But no one needs to know that. What a shame ...\
\
\

Halloween episode in which Bart and Lisa must fight monsters created by Springfield's political divisiveness, 1900s Mr. Burns treats his employees so badly that they appear to him as ghosts in his huge mansion, and Homer gets help from an alien being in the form of a pair of jeans to conquer Marge.

Sophie takes her new crush Bee to a small party in a villa where everyone except Bee has rich parents and a lot of drugs are taken. The seven people start a party game in which one of them plays the murderer who is supposed to kill the others. But then an approaching storm leads to a power cut and soon there is the first real corpse. Now everyone suspects everyone else...

Out of nowhere, 12 giant alien spaceships appear all over the world. One of them is in Montana, where linguist Louise Banks is called to establish communication on behalf of the Americans. But the strangeness of the beings and their language is soon joined by very earthly problems...

British heist series in the tradition of Ocean's Eleven or Grifters. The focus is on a group of con artists who pull off a major coup in every episode. Their victims are exclusively morally questionable people or representatives of the London underworld.

Anne leads an unremarkable and isolated life, the only highlight of her day is the quiz show she has been watching since childhood, where she can answer almost all the questions. She avoids contact with her chaotic older sister Jenny, but then Anne's dog is kidnapped and Jenny tries to convince her to take part in the quiz show in order to pay the ransom.
Clean-cut policeman Scott Turner has to look after the drooling Great Dane Huutsch, whose owner was killed by criminals in front of the dog. The two try to find the perpetrators.

Thriller starring Nicolas Cage as an ex-soldier who ends up in a small town in the US state of Wyoming in search of work. There he is mistaken for a contract killer by the barkeeper Wayne. He is to murder his wife Suzanne for money. A tempting offer. But the woman offers him double for Wayne's murder.

Millionaire heiress Linnet Ridgeway spoils it with everyone: she steals her friend Jacqueline's fiancé and spends her honeymoon with him on a ship on the Nile in Egypt. Each of the travelers has a reason to kill her. When this happens, Hercule Poirot has to investigate.
On a Greek island, Broadway diva Arlena (Diana Rigg) is a nuisance until she lies strangled to death on the beach. Hercule Poirot (Peter Ustinov) investigates among the illustrious island guests.

British star-cast thriller by Sidney Lumet from 1974, based on the novel of the same name by Agatha Christie. Hercule Poirot faces one of his most difficult cases: On an icy winter's night, the famous “Orient Express” has to stop and the next morning the body of a multimillionaire murdered with 12 stab wounds is found.

This comedy by Justin Kerrigan is about Jip, a jeans salesman in Cardiff, who goes out partying with his gang every weekend. Everyone in the group of friends has their own problems with growing up, be it trouble with their parents, drug use, sexual problems or quitting their jobs.
This film tells the story of three women who share an apartment in New York.

The series was produced from 1974 to 1983 and was a great success. It was based on the autobiographical book series of the same name by Laura Ingalls Wilder, but only matched it in a few respects. For example, there were a number of characters who were invented contrary to the original book because they suited the public's taste.
US thriller drama series about the Rayburn family, who run a hotel in Florida.

An old bamboo collector finds a tiny girl in a bamboo that turns into a baby. He and his wife adopt her as a child. The bamboo collector thinks the fast-growing girl is a princess and takes her to the capital to introduce her to royal circles.

Afghanistan, 2018: Sergeant John Kinley and his unit are tasked with locating and excavating a bomb workshop. But the mission goes wrong. After a fierce battle, Kinley and his translator Ahmed are the only survivors. With no contact with their own troops, the two have to fight their way back to base through hostile terrain...

Danni works as a photo editor for an online magazine, but is an outsider there. To act important, she claims to be going to a workshop in Paris and then posts fake pictures of herself in the city. But then there is an attack in Paris and because Danni claims to have witnessed it, she becomes an internet celebrity. But that doesn't go well forever...

The Last Full Measure tells the story of a soldier who saved the lives of several comrades in the Vietnam War and was killed himself in the process. 30 years later, some of the survivors are calling for him to be posthumously awarded the Medal of Honor.

In the pilot episode, the main character Dexter is introduced and told how he becomes a serial killer. The episode opens with a gruesome murder. Later, Dexter, who also works as a forensic scientist for the police, has to find a murderer who always bleeds out his corpses and then leaves them in pieces. He is helped by his sister Deb, who is also an enthusiastic police officer.

While searching for the ice-truck murderer, Dexter's sister Deb finds the truck, which contains new clues. Another case arises from the murder of an undercover investigator. Meanwhile, Dexter finds a new victim for himself in court and, along the way, arranges a double date with his girlfriend Rita, sister Deb and her new boyfriend.

A new victim of the ice truck killer is found in the middle of an ice hockey stadium. A surveillance video shows the night watchman, who has since disappeared, discarding the body parts. Captain LaGuerta thinks he's the culprit, but Deb thinks it's too easy. Detective Doakes continues to investigate the cop killing, Rita gets a visit from her ex's dealer and Dexter finds a new victim.

The women of an isolated Mennonite community find out that they have been drugged and raped by men for years. As the men of the community are on their way to get the perpetrators back on bail, the women have time to discuss what to do next. The choice is to stay and fight or leave. The movie is based on the novel of the same name.
Highly acclaimed German romantic film from 2006. Emma lives alone on her farm when Max, who is terminally ill, crashes his car on her property.

The ice truck killer has changed his modus operandi and is now placing body parts in places he has seen in Dexter's photo albums, but Dexter is keeping this information secret. The body parts are from the missing night watchman that Captain LaGuerta thought was the serial killer. Rita, meanwhile, has a problem with the neighbor's constantly barking dog.

Anime adaptation of Type-Moon's visual novel, blending action, fantasy, and psychological drama. The story follows Shirou Emiya, a high school student who becomes unwittingly involved in the Holy Grail War, a deadly competition where seven mages summon powerful heroic spirits to fight for the chance to grant any wish.

Donya, a young Afghan woman, had to flee to the USA after the Taliban came to power because she had worked as a translator for the US army. She now lives in Fremont, California, and works in a fortune cookie factory. But her experiences and her concern for the family she left behind lead her to isolate herself and deny herself any happiness.

This episode features 12 short stories about the women of Springfield, including Marge, who has the problem of Homer refusing to buy her tampons, and Lisa, who dreams of being queen in the Chronicles of Narnia.

Sally Alexander does not want to see herself reduced to her role as a mother in 1970 and studies history despite facing resistance. At university, she comes into contact with the women's movement, for whom the Miss World competition is a particular thorn in the side. They plan protests during the live television show, while the girls at the competition hope for a better life.
In Buenos Aires, an agoraphobic musician lives in seclusion, while his friends work around the city.

The short film is about the last man who lived alone for a long time on the island of Spiralonga, which was once a leper colony. Despite resistance, he now lives on Crete, but no longer speaks a word. He now pursues his musical talent for the lyre, an ancient plucked instrument, every evening.
\El Espinazo del diablo\" is a mixture of historical and fantasy film with horror elements. The story is set in a boarding school
column3: where the partially parentless children have to face a ghost and an inhuman enemy during the Spanish Civil War."

abstract: When Carrie wants to split up with her fiancé Mike, he has a serious accident. Carrie is faced with a difficult decision: should she live her own life as planned or take care of Mike, who is now paraplegic? Even when Carrie goes to New York, she can't forget him.
The British crime series is a prequel to the series \Inspector Morse\"."

The odyssey of a young film actor (Luc Merenda) through a chaotic society characterized by excessive sexuality and aggression. The film attempts to reflect real end-time moods through absurd exaggeration. A social satire and cabinet of curiosities with explicit pornographic scenes.

Women are like pearls in an oyster. A shell that may consist of nature, society, politics and religion and many other things. In this film, the strict rules that have been created for women's society in the world are analyzed and analyzed in the form of love.
Sierra Nevada Jones is trying to get back her father's farmland, which rancher Tom McCord has snatched up. She gets help from cowboy Farrell.

The leaders of the criminal organization “The Five Golden Dragons” meet in Hong Kong, where one of them is murdered. A track leads to reporter and playboy Bob Mitchell, who then finds himself in danger.
2014 Kickstarter-funded remake of the 1922 silent film classic “Nosferatu - A Symphony of Horror” based on the novel “Dracula”.
“Are You There, Chelsea?” is an NBC sitcom that was filmed for one season in 2012.

Lady Haloran has invited her sons and their wives to the annual memorial for her little daughter Kathleen, who drowned in a pond as a child. But strange events soon begin to occur on the estate... Francis Ford Coppola's black-and-white film was also distributed in Germany under the title “Fright Night”. Director Richard LeMay made a remake in 2017.

In his first directorial work in 10 years, Coppola films one of his declared favorite books with Tim Roth and the upcoming German actress Alexandra Maria Lara in the leading roles. An aging linguist miraculously gets the chance to advance his life's work and yet only finds fulfillment in love.

A horror film with splatter elements produced in Germany and the USA, inspired by horror films from the 70s and 80s. A brother and sister are harassed by a mysterious truck driver who apparently does not shy away from murder.
Rosa von Praunheim's docu-drama about violence and abuse in the life of martial artist and former pimp Andreas Marquardt.

The A-Team is an action series from the United States created by Stephen J. Cannell and Frank Lupo. It was produced from 1983 to 1987 and was one of the most successful American television programs of the period. The TV series is about a group of former soldiers who help people in need, but are themselves hunted by the military police.
Eva Kende is a single mother of twins. She tells her sons Peter and Paul that their father is traveling. The children want to search for their father with the help of the Russian singer Mitja.

Eric-Emmanuel Schmitt turns his own novel into a movie: ten-year-old Oskar writes letters to God. He is seriously ill and only has a few days to live. To make the most of this time, he imagines that one day actually lasts ten years. As a result, Oskar rapidly experiences puberty, adulthood - and death.

The persecution of Christians in ancient Rome is revived under proconsul Junius. The tribune Marcus, who lives outside the city with his wife Licia, is also arrested and is to be thrown to the wild beasts in the arena. Marcus is released, however, and sets off with Licia and a few loyal followers to assist Consul Caius in his fight against the barbarians...

Classic by Pier Paolo Pasolini: A strange guest appears in the villa of a wealthy family and seduces the father, mother, daughter, son and maid. After sleeping with the stranger, the son discovers his calling as an artist. The father, for his part, gives away the factory and the maid becomes a faith healer.

Pier Paolo Pasolini combines a collection of English novellas into a kaleidoscope of erotic episodes. Eight pilgrims on the way to Canterbury tell stories about the coexistence of men and women. The film won the \Golden Bear\" at the Berlinale in Berlin in 1972."

Fast-paced mix of animation and live-action film about an elite unit made up of guinea pigs. The small rodents were trained as part of a secret government program and now have the task of stopping a crazy millionaire.
Four-part documentary about the collaboration between rapper Dr. Dre and music producer Jimmy Iovine.

Cullen Bohannan is a former slave owner and Confederate soldier. After the end of the Civil War, he sets out in search of his wife's murderers, Northern soldiers. His hunt for the perpetrators leads him right into the middle of one of the biggest projects in US history, the construction of the first transcontinental railroad in the 1860s.
British drama series about the life of Queen Elizabeth II and her family.
After decades, novelist Stéphane Belcourt returns to the city where he grew up.

Only the best pilots in the free world come to Pensacola, Florida. There they are trained to become an elite combat unit that will be used to fight crime worldwide. The men and women of the squadron are committed to the idea of a free and just world.
Three women, 25-year-old Leila, 35-year-old Frenja and 45-year-old Ann, go to a psychotherapy clinic because they are at turning points in their lives.
US drama series about the reclusive Farrell clan living in the Appalachians.

Like others, Fahrije's husband disappeared in a massacre during the Kosovo war in 1999. That was seven years ago and since then Fahrije has had to look after her two children and her sick father-in-law on her own. Against the will of the men in the village, she tries to sell homemade ajvar with other women. And she is still searching for certainty about the fate of her husband...

Maral, a young passionate writer, despite having many social differences and many contrasted values with Hamed, a book publisher, falls in love and marries him. The story shapes around the social conflicts and tensions between the two and their families and examines the outcomes.

Jazireh is not a place, it is an excuse for conflict between people who seek their destiny in it, and it is the basis for the efforts of those who decide to have a greater share in life; They do everything to reach the island.

The officer Cyrano is skilled with his sword and with words and is madly in love with the attractive Roxanne. But he keeps this to himself because he is small in stature and therefore convinced that she would reject him. Then Roxanne falls in love with the cadet Christian. Because he can't express himself well, Cyrano writes the love letters for him...
Western by Howard Hawks with John Wayne and Montgomery Clift in the leading roles. Father and son experience severe hardships crossing the Chisholm Trail from Texas to Missouri.

Tax consultant Gene Watson has just arrived in LA with his young daughter Lynn when two supposed police officers ask him to get into their van. As it soon becomes clear, it's a hostage situation: Watson is to murder Governor Eleanor Grant or his daughter will die. A race against time begins...

While Tony Tucci, the last victim of the ice-truck murderer, recovers in hospital, Rita asks Dexter to look into the case of a colleague's missing fiancé. He was supposed to be brought to the USA from Cuba by smugglers and Dexter finds out that the smugglers kill their victims if the relatives don't pay more money. A new victim for Dexter?

In 1984, Élisabeth is left by her husband and now has to look after her two teenage children alone. She finds a job on the nightly radio program “The Passengers of the Night”, where she meets the aimless teenager Talulah. Spontaneously, she takes her into her home.

A body disposed of by Dexter turns up again, so he has to investigate his own case. Also, a Cuban boy stuck in the trunk of a car has seen him. Lieutenant LaGuerta tries to question the disturbed child, so Dexter has to worry about being exposed. Meanwhile, Rita's ex is out of prison and wants to come to his daughter's birthday party.

To get his car repaired, an unnamed stranger takes on the janitor job at Willy's Wonderland. But the establishment has been closed for years for a reason. The animatronics have developed a murderous life of their own...

Debra finally finds a hot lead in the case of the ice-truck killer: a witness from one murder is also connected to another murder case, and when Debra and Batista try to visit him in his mobile home, he flees. Dexter comes across another murderer he knows, while Rita's ex keeps coming unannounced to visit his children, much to her displeasure.
Action-packed US civil war drama starring Bruce Willis. Lieutenant Waters is sent to Nigeria to evacuate American doctors after the president is assassinated and chaos reigns in the country.
British crime series based on the novels by Alan Hunter, set in the North East of England.

US television series produced from 1977 to 1983 starring Larry Wilcox and Erik Estrada as California Highway Patrol motorcycle cops. Originally planned as a comedy series, CHiPs later developed into a program with serious themes.
US youth sitcom about the adventures of superhero Captain Man and his sidekick, 13-year-old Henry Hart.
The film depicts the experiences of a small group of Neanderthals during the Stone Age.

“Ghost Whisperer” is a fantasy mystery television series from the USA. Melinda Gordon is able to communicate with the spirits of deceased people. These spirits regularly visit Melinda and the young woman sets out again and again to fulfill the lost souls' last wishes. She is usually successful, but her ability also gets her into trouble.

The series is about the Garnett family, which is patriarchally led by Alf Garnett, a reactionary white working class worker with racist and anti-socialist views. “Till Death Us Do Part” is one of the models for the German cult series ‘Ein Herz und eine Seele’.
The loss of his wife and job plunges 65-year-old Theo Winter into a deep crisis. Then he meets Johanna, a young offender, as part of a victim-offender mediation program...

The British drama series portrays the lives of a group of teenagers growing up in Bristol, South West England. The multi-award-winning series shows the teenagers searching for their place in the world as they grapple with love, drugs, sex, school and their families.
Computer-animated fairy tale parody trilogy about the green ogre Shrek.

So-young leaves her newborn baby in a baby hatch, but when she wants it back, it has disappeared. Sang-hyeon and his helper Dong-soo have taken it in order to sell it illegally to a couple who want to adopt it. When So-young finds out, she goes along to share the money with them. But two police officers are already hot on their trail.

American horror film from 2002, loosely based on the story of the Italian cruise ship SS Andrea Doria, which sank in 1956. Pilot Jack Ferriman discovers an abandoned ship off the coast of Alaska. He commissions a team to salvage it, but the supposedly ownerless ship drifting in the Bering Sea turns out to be occupied by evil spirits.

Dexter tracks down a therapist who drove three rich ladies to suicide. Before he kills him, however, he goes into therapy himself. With good results: Rita and he finally have sex! Meanwhile, the fake ice-truck killer admits to being a liar and the true identity of Dexter's playmate is revealed.

Surreal slapstick comedy without words in the style of the 1920s: after applejack salesman Jean's plantation is destroyed, he struggles to survive on his own in the relentless winter. With little skill, he tries to catch animals and gets into trouble with beavers in particular. But when a trapper helps him, he soon even has a chance with the daughter of a fur trader.

Dexter receives the news that his biological father has died and that he has inherited his house. He believes there has been a mistake, because his adoptive father Harry had always told him that his parents had died before the adoption. Dexter drives to the house with Rita, where Debra and her boyfriend Rudy also turn up unexpectedly. Meanwhile, Sergeant Doakes shoots a fugitive.

A hotel key was sent anonymously to the police. The hotel room is completely covered in blood, which is actually Dexter's specialty. But he has a flashback from his childhood in the room. He doesn't want to talk to Debra about it, but Rudy pays him a visit. Meanwhile, Rita is afraid of losing custody to her ex because he has filed charges against her.

Award-winning historical drama based on the novel of the same name by Alexandre Dumas. The film focuses on the conflict between Huguenots and Catholics in 16th century France. Princess Margot is forced to marry the Protestant Henry of Navarre in order to bring peace between the two camps. But after the wedding, her mother Catherine de Medici initiates a bloody pogrom.

Harold's pride and joy is his traditional furniture store, which he has run with his wife Marny for decades in a small Norwegian town. But then an IKEA store opens next door. At first Harald is convinced that his quality will prevail, but he soon goes bankrupt. Harald wants revenge and travels to Sweden to kidnap Ingvar Kamprad, the founder of IKEA.
The US drama series deals with the 1996 crash of an airplane carrying a high school soccer team. The survivors of the accident are trapped in the Canadian wilderness.

Remake of the 1987 film of the same name with reversed roles: Kate, a single mother of three daughters, is barely keeping her head above water with jobs. When she is asked to clean the yacht of the arrogant millionaire's son Leonardo, she clashes with him. A short time later, he falls overboard and loses his memory. Kate makes him believe they are married and takes advantage of him.

Dexter desperately tries to find out where Rudy is with Debra. He is convinced that Rudy has left him a clue. Doakes is sure Dexter knows more than he's letting on and goes after him. Meanwhile, Rita's ex Paul tries to convince her that Dexter isn't who she thinks he is.

Rudy interferes more and more in Dexter's life, but Dexter suddenly suspects who is hiding behind the mask of Debra's boyfriend. But by then it's too late - Rudy has already kidnapped Debra. Dexter also learns that his mother was the victim of a slasher and that, as a small child, he had to wait days in the blood of the murdered woman to be rescued.

After her husband Owen took his own life, Beth lives alone in the house by the lake that he built. But strange things start to happen in the house and Beth hopes that it is Owen's ghost that is still with her. She starts looking through his things and finds out that he had a secret.

In 1999, after studying in Japan, American Jake Adelstein applies for a job at the Tokyo newspaper Meicho Shimbun. He starts there as a police reporter, but on his very first case he learns that initiative is not welcome. Nevertheless, he investigates on his own and seeks contact with Jin Miyamoto, a detective at the vice squad.

Dexter is frustrated because he can no longer kill since his brother's murder. Doakes follows him everywhere and Debra is currently living with him because she can't cope on her own. After letting a blind murderer go free, the massive ganglord “Little Chino” comes in handy for him. Meanwhile, Rita is under pressure from her ex to help him get out of prison.
TV series from ABC Network Chicago from 1950 to 1951 in 34 episodes of 30 minutes each. The series is considered lost.
The adventures of the wondrous Mr. Tau, who communicates silently with a bowler hat and umbrella and can perform magical feats by tapping his hat.

Because Dexter failed to kill gangster Chino, he has murdered another woman. Dexter wants to make up for the crime, but Chino is now warned and Doakes continues to follow him everywhere. The police, led by FBI agent Lundy, go all out for the Bay Harbor Butcher, as Dexter is called by the press. Meanwhile, Rita thinks he's a drug addict.

Rita forces Dexter to attend a self-help group because she thinks he is a heroin addict. He has an attractive sponsor there called Lila, who wants to help him kick his addiction. Dexter has also found a new victim: a used car dealer. Meanwhile, Debra recognizes a pattern in the Bay Harbour Killer's murders.

The second part of the Millenium trilogy based on the novels by Swedish author Stieg Larsson, which revolves around the trafficking of girls and corruption in Swedish society. Lisbeth's fingerprints are found on the body of her proxy. Only Mikael believes in her innocence.

First film adaptation of the Millennium Trilogy, which is about how journalist Mikael Blomkvist tries to solve the disappearance of Harriet Vanger over 40 years ago. He is assisted by a young hacker named Lisbeth Salander, who uses her computer skills to uncover the dark secrets of the Vanger family in the far north of Sweden.
“Baywatch” is a series about lifeguards on the beach in Malibu (seasons 1-9) and Hawaii (seasons 10-11).
US science fiction series about a UN employee whose agency monitors a gateway to a parallel dimension in which his parallel self is traveling as an agent.
\Get Smart\"
column3: created by Mel Brooks and Buck Henry
column4: is an American television series that parodies the life of an agent. It revolves around the agents Maxwell Smart and his assistant “99” who work for the secret government department “CONTROL”
column5: which wants to hunt down their enemy “KAOS”."

abstract: The BBC series, starring Rowan Atkinson, was voted 20th among the best television shows of all time by the film magazine Empire. The four seasons of the series are set in four different eras of English history. Rowan Atkinson plays the current representative of the Blackadder family in each era and his reputation gets worse from season to season...

The life of the legendary eccentric Howard Hughes is portrayed. In the USA, the series was shown as a two-part television film. There is also a feature film version in Germany, which has a running time of around 120 minutes.
Crime series from the German TV channel ZDF, in which the police officer and single father of three daughters Robert Heffler has to support the new inspector Kay Freund in her cases.
US sitcom about the life of the two sisters Valerie (Jennie Garth) and Holly Tyler (Amanda Bynes) in New York City.
US sitcom about donut store owner Arthur and his young and ambitious employee Franco.
An adaption of Iain Banks' dark novel, whose central character is a young Scots history student.

Eleven-year-old Tori and 17-year-old Lokita migrated alone from Africa to Belgium, where they pretend to be siblings and support each other, becoming inseparable. Lokita would like to work regularly, but she can't get the necessary papers. So they both work as drug couriers until Lokita gets an offer, for which she is separated from Tori.
Drama series about the British James Delaney, who becomes involved in the British-American War with his trading company at the beginning of the 19th century.

After the death of his father, twelve-year-old Ayoub becomes the head of his family, which consists of several sisters and Madi, who is disabled. He has to earn enough money to live on, as well as to pay for Madi's vital operation.

In a dystopian time on a labyrinthine sports ground without sunlight, a murder has been committed. The police want to meticulously recreate the events in the area, which is cut off from the outside world, with the men present there, including the victim's sister. In various time loops, ever new aspects of the unclear events come to light.

In 1953, during a performance of a play by Agatha Christie in London, a US director who was to film the play is murdered. Scotland Yard assigns the hard-drinking Inspector Stoppard and the eager but inexperienced and hasty Constable Stalker to the case. But the victim was unpopular and so there are many suspects.

Spanish social drama about euthanasia by Alejandro Amenábar with Javier Bardem in the leading role. Ramón, who is almost completely paralyzed after an accident, wants to end his life with dignity, which is met with incomprehension by those around him. The film won the Goya 2004 and went on to win the Oscar and Golden Globe for Best Foreign Language Film in 2005.
Crime series centering on building contractor John Nolan, who moves to Los Angeles in his late thirties to start a new life as a police officer.

Miami is hit by a heatwave. Dexter is worried that Lila sees through him and wants to get rid of her as a sponsor, which pleases the jealous but understanding Rita. Debra starts dating Gabriel from the gym. Meanwhile, Dexter is worried about his colleagues, because they have discovered seaweed that can be used to determine the harbor where the killer's boat is located.

The drama series is about Riley Parks, who is left by her husband and has to look after her two children alone. When she gets into financial difficulties, she is forced to take a job as a masseuse at the local spa. However, she soon realizes that they offer more than just massages.

Surreal comedy set in an alternate reality of a wintery Winnipeg where almost only Iranians live. Three seemingly unconnected stories tell how two children try to get hold of a banknote frozen in the ice, a man visits his old mother after years, but she no longer knows him, and a travel guide shows tourists trivial things.

Dexter learns that Lundy has set up a video camera in the harbor. This could reveal that Dexter has been cleaning his boat at night, which he is determined to prevent. Another murder by the Bay Harbor Killer turns out to be the work of a copycat. Rita breaks up with Dexter because she thinks he had sex with Lila. He then actually has sex with Lila...

Dexter finds out that one of his mother's three murderers is still alive and goes with Lila to see him, not knowing what he will do with him. Rita's mother tells him to leave the family because she thinks he's a junkie. Meanwhile, Lila flirts more and more with him... and the police are on the verge of exposing him.

Action comedy with Samuel L. Jackson as chemist Elmo McElroy. McElroy has concocted a miracle drug, but doesn't want to throw it down his boss's throat. Instead, he blows him up and runs off to Liverpool to sell the formula there. But the deal doesn't work out as he'd intended, partly because his ex-boss isn't as dead as he'd hoped...
Colonel Tom Parker, Elvis Presley's former manager, recounts the life of the legendary rock'n'roll star in fast-moving images, from his early days to his rapid rise to fame and his excesses.

As the Bay Harbour Butcher, Dexter sends a multi-page manifesto to the press, which should keep the police busy for a while. The real problem, however, is Doakes, who is still snooping on Dexter. Meanwhile, Lila turns out to be very obsessive and Dexter misses Rita, Cody and Astor, while Debra and Lundy get closer.

Shortly before the French Revolution in 1789, Pierre Manceron is cook to the Duke de Chamfort. But because Pierre's skills are not sufficiently appreciated, he returns to his parents' orphaned farm. There he opens an inn with his son and Louise, who was keen to be apprenticed to him, for which they develop revolutionary ideas.

Bill Baker is a simple man from Stillwater, Oklahoma - with a criminal record, a dry alcoholic, his wife is long dead and his daughter Allison is in prison in Marseille for the murder of her lover. Although all legal means have been exhausted, Bill firmly believes in her innocence and goes to France in the hope of getting her released even years later.

Robert Rodriguez's contribution to the classic double feature, which he created together with Quentin Tarantino. Two full-length action films, with “Death Proof” being the first part. Both films were shown together in cinemas in the USA and separately in a longer version in Europe.\
In the 1950s in a small Texas town, the billiard saloon and the movie theater are the few places where young people can pass their time. One of the classics of the “New Hollywood” era.

Mikey is completely broke on the doorstep of his ex Lexi in rural Texas. He had worked as a porn star in Los Angeles for 17 years, but now he is no longer welcome anywhere. He manages to persuade Lexi and her mother Lil to let him stay with them and makes some money dealing weed. His relationship with Lexi seems to be improving, but then Mikey meets young Raylee.

Lila is becoming increasingly obsessive, as Dexter slowly realizes, because she didn't just set the fire specifically to bind him to her. Lundy is now looking for the Bay Harbor Butcher in his own ranks and Debra and Angel find an important lead. Meanwhile, Doakes is becoming more and more of a problem for Dexter, even though LaGuerta has put him on leave.

In a mysterious circus, Lisa meets a man whose tattoos tell stories: In the 1950s, Bart hears the voice of a woman buried alive, but no one believes him; in a near future, high school principal Chalmers buys a robot as his doppelganger to replace him at Skinner; and in a distant future, Homer helps destroy lowbrow TV shows.
British political satire by Armando Iannucci, which takes a close look at the British government and its inner workings.
When Bill decides to open a healthy food restaurant, he doesn't realize what kind of resistance he will face.
Documentary about the fight against the destruction of the rainforest in Nicaragua through cattle farming.
Interview series with two different celebrities who meet at a specific location and talk to each other about their own work.

Colleen West (Ellen Barkin) is an actress whose best years are behind her. No one is interested in her anymore, even her last theater performance and her affair with a young man are now over. Now the diva sits in a mountain cabin and reflects on the past year...
Filmmaker Margherita is in crisis after her divorce, in the middle of filming with a US movie star. And then she finds out that her mother is ill.

Detective Ryan Barnes discovers a perfidious series of murders in which old and sick people are poisoned with insulin. The investigation is difficult and Barnes himself has been mentally disturbed since his wife was hit by a drunk driver on their wedding day and left in a coma...

The “Big Eden” is a nightclub that was opened in Berlin in 1967 by the German entrepreneur, real estate owner and actor Rolf Eden. In the film of the same name, filmmaker Peter Dörfler goes in search of traces of the Berlin nightclub scene. The “Big Eden” was sold in 2002.

A young couple have to finance their lives in the urban jungle of Berlin. While the advertising graphics student contributes to their joint livelihood by driving a cab, his wife works in a hotel. Neither of them remains untouched by the temptations of the metropolis...

Young girls recruited as dancers are transported from Genoa to the Orient through newspaper advertisements and marijuana parties. After several murders of beautiful women, Interpol is able to dismantle the trafficking ring in Berlin.

The Solé family has been growing peaches on the land next to their house for generations. However, the contract with the Pinyol family, who own the land, was only ever verbal, so they have no evidence when the youngest Pinyol asks them to leave the land because he wants to build a photovoltaic system there. In particular, the father of the family, Quimet, does not want to accept this.
Mystery thriller by Alfred Hitchcock starring Marlene Dietrich, in which the true murderer of a crime is sought.
The two lonely lives of a young photographer and a veteran cheesemaker collide in an intimate and unexpected clash between two worlds.

Danish crook comedy from 2003. Four petty criminals, including Mick and his son Tom, are given the job of stealing a work of art from a barely secured museum. They accidentally take the wrong painting: Denmark's only Rembrandt. While they try to get rid of the hot commodity, the police are hot on their trail.

Charlie is extremely overweight and therefore leads a reclusive life. He always has his webcam switched off for the writing courses he gives online and only his good friend Liz still visits him. As his health is failing, he tries to get in touch with his teenage daughter Ellie, whom he hasn't seen since he left her and her mother years ago.

In 2005, German comedian Christian Ulmen taught German television viewers what it means to be a stranger with “Mein neuer Freund”. In each episode of the reality show, Ulmen appeared as a different pain in the ass. He tormented his victims in front of their partners, relatives and friends. The aim of each episode was for the contestant to survive the ordeal for one day. Not an easy task.
A young photographer confronts the dark side of online sharing when an unexpected encounter reveals the hidden risks of intimacy and privacy in the digital world.
During a game of Truth or Dare in the mountains, a boy and a girl confront their deepest fears and desires, embarking on an unexpected journey of self-discover.

Doakes knows who Dexter is, but Lundy also seems to know something, because he has sent FBI agents after Dexter and talks to Debra about a breakthrough in the case without being more specific. Dexter tries to keep a cool head, but he hasn't disposed of Jimenez's body yet. Lila continues to cause problems, however things are getting better with Rita.

Dexter still doesn't know what to do with Doakes, who has hinted at things about his father Harry that Dexter had no idea about. He is very preoccupied by this and it overshadows the fact that Rita is seeking contact with Dexter again, and not just because of the children. Meanwhile, Angel and Lila are getting closer.

Dexter has made up his mind: he can't let Doakes pay for Dexter's actions, so he wants to turn himself in. But first he wants to spend time with Rita and the children and Debra. Lila continues to play her evil games and this time Angel is the one who is the victim.

Lila has discovered Dexter's secret and solves the problems in her own way. Now she becomes important to Dexter again, even though the relationship between him and Rita has just been rekindled. Meanwhile, Debra has to decide how far she wants to go with Lundy.

As he does every year, Georges Ljoie (Jean Carmet) spends his vacation on the Côte d'Azur with family and friends. “It never hurt anyone,” he whispers in Brigitte Colin's (Isabelle Huppert) ear as he rapes her - and breaks the girl's neck. Lajoie now incites father Colin and other vacationers against Algerian guest workers...

Eva, a single masseuse, meets Albert, who is also divorced, at a party. Although she doesn't find him attractive at first, an affection develops. At the same party, Eva also meets Marianne, who becomes her customer and friend. But Eva soon realizes that the ex-husband Marianne is talking so badly about is Albert.

Single mother Julie has a job as a chambermaid in a luxury hotel in Paris, but even getting there from the suburbs is exhausting, especially as the trains are on strike. Despite all her efforts, she only sees her children early in the morning and late at night. That's why she hopes to get a better job with her university degree.

When documentary filmmaker Zoe learns that her actually modern childhood friend Kazim wants to enter into an arranged marriage according to Pakistani tradition, she wants to turn it into a documentary. Zoe, who has not yet found Mr. Right herself, accompanies Kazim to Lahore, where his family has chosen a bride for him.

Thriller by Sam Raimi about two very different brothers who, together with a friend, find a crashed plane in the snowy forest with a large amount of cash inside. They manage to hide the money without anyone noticing, but they don't trust each other...

Comedy series about the ambitious Mr. Griffin, whose career dreams at university have been dashed, which is why he now has to work as a biology teacher at a high school. There he tries to use the pupils for his revenge plans.

The film is based on a true story about the hostage-taking at the American embassy in Tehran between 1979 and 1981, when the CIA smuggled some diplomats who had managed to escape from the consulate out of the country by faking a sci-fi movie called “Argo” and passing them off as a Canadian film crew.

It's been 10 years since California.wav permanently changed the American comedy landscape, but what has become of Gary Cunningham and David Kennedy? Join host John Lasqueezie as he takes a deeper look into the betrayal, passion, and hardships that plagued the duo over the last decade.

“American Dad” is an American satirical animated series from the creators of ‘Family Guy’. It focuses on CIA employee Stan Smith and his family, who live in Virginia. Stan and his wife are characterized by a conservative world view; the family members include two children, a talking goldfish and an alien.

A 1953 war drama that won 8 Oscars, including the coveted film prize for Best Picture and Best Supporting Actor (Frank Sinatra and Donna Reed). The film tells the story of the soldier Prewitt, who is transferred to the Hawaiian island of Oahu shortly before the attack on Pearl Harbor and has to defend himself against his captain.

Bestselling author Mike Noonan (Pierce Brosnan) is unable to overcome his grief after the sudden death of his wife Jo (Annabeth Gish) and their unborn child. Suffering from nightmares and writer's block, he retreats to their summer home on a lake in Maine.

The Earth's surface, devastated some time ago, is habitable again. But Miles doesn't want to lose control of the underground cities, so he decides to use the remaining nuclear weapons to make the Earth's surface inhospitable. Dakota, a former executor of death sentences, must stop him...

Franck and Paul are two police officers who are friends with little success on the job. But while they are chasing the drug lord Carlos, Paul finds out from Franck that he is having an affair with Paul's wife Valeria.

Miguel continues to seek contact with Dexter, but Dexter is suspicious. They both know that the Skinner, as the new killer is called because he peels off parts of the victims' skin, can't be Freebo, since Dexter killed him. Dexter tries to come to terms with the fact that he is about to become a father. Then he notices that Rita's daughter Astor is being approached by a stranger ...

Private detective Vicky Nelson investigates mysterious deaths in Toronto. She is assisted by the cool, seductive vampire Henry and her ex-boyfriend Detective Mike Celluci. Together they hunt the unknown and become increasingly drawn into Henry's world of vampires, demons and the occult, where blood, sex and power merge in a frightening way.

Dexter and Rita tell Rita's children that she is pregnant. Astor reacts negatively to the new baby because Dexter and Rita are “not even married yet”. This gives Dexter an idea ... However, he is worried about Miguel's brother Ramón, who is furious because the police still haven't found Freebo. Miguel wants to tell Ramón what happened, but Dexter is against it.
This documentary is about the history of the \Simani\" company and its fifty years history in the agricultural industry."

Nicolas Cage plays Nicolas Cage, an egocentric actor who is long past his prime. Things have now reached the point where he has himself flown to Mallorca to attend rich Javi Gutierrez's birthday party for money. But there, to his surprise, Nick is recruited by CIA agents...

Dexter wants to put Freebo, a woman-killer, out of circulation. At his house, however, he is attacked and killed by Oscar Prado, a member of a powerful political family. The big question that arises during the investigation and also for Dexter: Why was Ramon in Freebo's house! Meanwhile, Deb gets into trouble for her big mouth and Angel is promoted.

Debra makes progress in identifying the woman's body through an informant, so Dexter has to hurry to catch Freebo before the police find him, especially as Miguel Prado is also conducting his own investigation. The fact that Rita is pregnant doesn't necessarily improve the situation...
About the personal life of the founders of the Faculty of Physics, Isfahan, Iran.

Rita has accepted Dexter's proposal, but now she wants to buy a house with him. It's all happening far too fast for Dexter, who is afraid he'll have to give up his space. What's more, Prado has provided him with a new victim, so he takes a day to finish the man off. With problematic consequences in more ways than one...

Popular documentary by Frenchman Luc Jacquet, who filmed emperor penguins in the Antarctic. The resulting images are extraordinary and unique. The film achieved the highest box office takings of any documentary worldwide after Michael Moore's Fahrenheit 9/11.

In this first episode, genius scientist Rick secretly takes his grandson Morty out of school to go with him through a portal to another dimension, where he is supposed to help him obtain a special plant seed. But the truancy does not go unnoticed and Jerry now wants his father-in-law Rick to leave the family home.

Dexter wants to test how far Miguel would really go and suggests getting a convicted Nazi and murderer out of prison so that Dexter can kill him. To his astonishment, Miguel really does go along with it. Meanwhile, the police continue their feverish search for the Skinner and Debra fears she could be responsible for the death of a witness. But then she has an idea who the Skinner might be.
Earthlings is a documentary about factory farming and the dependence of humans on animals as a source of food, raw materials for clothing, entertainment and as test subjects in animal experiments.

Things are slowly coming to an end with Dexter's old friend Camilla and she asks Dexter to redeem her. Miguel also comes with a request: he wants to get rid of lawyer Ellen Wolf. However, both requests clash with Dexter's code and he is faced with difficult decisions. Meanwhile, the police want to use Anton as bait for the Skinner, which upsets Deb.

After moving to the small town of Sunnydale, schoolgirl Buffy Summers learns of her true destiny: she is the Slayer, the one who is supposed to keep the forces of darkness under control. Sunnydale lies directly above a hellmouth that spews out new vampires and demons with regularity. Under the guidance of her mentor Giles, Buffy takes up the fight.
Independent movie about the kidnapping of Frank Sinatra Jr in 1963 by Barry Keenan
Lanterns follows Green Lanterns John Stewart and Hal Jordan. Based on DC Comics

Buddy cop film based on the series of the same name from the 70s and 80s: washed-up ex-stunt driver Jon applies for a job with the California Highway Patrol. Although he fails completely in all disciplines except motorcycling, he is accepted. His partner is Ponch, who is an undercover FBI agent on the hunt for criminal cops. Chaos is inevitable...

Miguel has found a new victim in an ex-football player and urges Dexter to kill him together. However, Dexter is cautious and wants to stick to his code. Meanwhile, Rita is stressed by her pregnancy and Deb finds out that Anton is not officially listed as an informant. Plus, there's finally a hot lead in the Skinner case.

Anton is still missing and Debra is desperate, because although the skinner has finally been identified, he can't be proven guilty of anything. Meanwhile, Miguel seems to be keeping secrets from Dexter and then Ellen Wolf disappears - Dexter becomes suspicious and wants to teach him a lesson.

At a Congressional hearing, the Simpsons talk about a flight they took with “Convenience Airways”, the last airline to take them because of Homer's escapades. While Marge gets an upgrade to first class, the flight turns into a disaster for the rest of the Simpsons ...

Author Ben receives a phone call from a stranger telling him that his girlfriend Abby has died. In fact, Abby was just one of his many loves, but Ben doesn't dare tell her brother Ty. So he flies to Abby's family in Texas for the funeral. There, Ty tells him that he believes Abby was murdered. Ben sees an opportunity to turn the story into a podcast...

This mixture of road movie and gangster epic starring Clint Eastwood and Jeff Bridges from 1974 is Michael Cimino's directorial debut. Crooks Thunderbold and Lightfood plan and carry out a daring heist, but their two other accomplices pursue their own interests and the police soon take notice.

University professor Leda Caruso is on vacation alone on a Greek island. The arrival of a noisy extended family with a mother and her young daughter brings back memories of the time when Leda herself was a young mother and made a decision with far-reaching consequences.

Episodic film by Woody Allen from 1986, which was his biggest commercial success to date. At the center of the constellation of characters is the quiet Hannah, who repeatedly comes together with friends and family at Thanksgiving. The characters' relationships are shown over a period of around two years, from a love affair to the suffering of a hypochondriac.

Dexter wants to get rid of Miguel and tells him to devote himself to his own life again after the wedding. Miguel doesn't exactly like this and they have a confrontation. Sylvia throws Miguel out because she thinks he is having an affair with Maria Laguerta. But in fact he is trying to use Maria to control her in the Ellen Wolf case.
