Two grieving people find each other in their grief - young Machiko, who has lost her child, and old Shigeki, whose wife died 30 years ago.
Follow the on-screen lyrics and sing along to your favorite songs as you watch \Hamilton.\""

Biopic about the British artist Louis Wain, who became famous mainly for his cat paintings. After the death of his father, Louis has to look after his five sisters and his mother and finds a job as a newspaper illustrator. He marries Emily, his sisters' governess, but she soon becomes terminally ill. Louis begins to paint pictures of cats and is successful, but his mental state deteriorates.

Sigfried Kronmayr and Elfie Hoffmann are the new tenants in house number 3 on Lindenstrasse. The first problems arise upon moving in: When caretaker's wife, Else Kling, sees a cage of gerbils in the hallway, she leaves no doubt who's in charge: She's the only one! This is the beginning of a 34-year soap opera by producer Hans W. Geißendörfer with 1,758 episodes.

Stress for the Beimer family: Marion, Hans and Helga Beimer's eldest child, is grounded. Last week, she and her boyfriend got into a fight with teenagers. She refuses to reveal who her current boyfriend is. The youngest child, Klausi, has measles. The new tenants are having a falling out. Sigi is working with his ex-girlfriend again. Elfie doesn't like that at all.

Tanja Schildknecht has an important interview appointment. Due to illness, she unfortunately has to cancel it. Father Franz isn't disappointed... After an argument between Sigi and Elfie, Sigi proposes to his girlfriend as a way to reconcile. Marion Beimer is still with her boyfriend Vasily. She is gradually distancing herself from the family...

Christmas 1985 on Lindenstrasse: The Schildknechts are arguing about the Christmas decorations, the Beimers have guests: Gung from the shared flat, Lydia Nolte and her staid daughter Berta, as well as two children Hans is bringing from the youth welfare office because their parents died in an accident. Marion is in Greece with Vasily. She's taken her mother's birth control pills with her!

Jack had artificial insemination abroad. To prevent anyone from finding out about the surrogate motherhood, Jack must invent a plausible reason for her pregnancy. - After her move, Tanja is completely overwhelmed. Her apartment is a complete mess. Suddenly, Carsten and Käthe show up at the door. - Helga has strictly forbidden Lea from seeing Orkan. But Orkan doesn't let up...

Isolde Pavarotti wants to sell the house at Lindenstrasse 3 to Dressler. Angelina is to act as the real estate agent. - Lea and Orkan meet in Helga's absence for a little hour in Lea's room. But then Helga unexpectedly returns home early. - Enzo and Momo have their eyes on Marcella and are competing for her attention. Who will Marcella choose?

Orkan and Paul have been caught stealing. Lisa wants Orkan sent back to Berlin because she believes he's a bad influence on her son. Jack has undergone artificial insemination and can now carry the Sarikakis' baby as a surrogate mother. Hajo has learned that Angelina has been laundering illicit money for Dressler. He confronts Dressler.

The Beimers still haven't heard from their daughter in Greece. Elfie and Sigi want to invite all the neighbors to their upcoming wedding. The Schildknechts have guests for New Year's Eve: Tanja's neighbor and tennis coach Stefan Nossek, as well as the president of the tennis club, have announced their attendance. The evening ends differently than expected: Franz reconciles with his daughter Tanja.

Frank Dressler, son of doctor Ludwig Dressler, and Carsten Flöter, son of Ludwig's girlfriend Elisabeth, return to Lindenstrasse from vacation. Dr. Dressler diagnoses a heart defect during a subsequent examination of his son Frank. Marion Beimer also returns from her vacation in Greece. However, she doesn't want to talk about what she experienced with Vasily in Greece...

Hans finds out that Marion and Vasily had a row during their vacation. Marion has spent Christmas and New Year's Eve in Greece without Vasily. A planned skiing vacation for the Beimer family doesn't take place: Hans has an accident on the trip. Else finds out that the tenants have been overcharged for heating for years. She wants to keep it a secret, but Egon doesn't like it at all...

Shot in real time, the film follows young Kaja, who witnesses the attack on a vacation camp on the Norwegian island of Utøya in 2011. While gunshots are heard again and again, Kaja hides with other teenagers from the unknown number of perpetrators, but at the same time she also tries to find her younger sister.

Jan Thomas, who was responsible for the death of a child as a teenager, falls in love with the pastor Anna, in whose church he plays the organ, after his return from prison. When he meets Agnes, the child's mother, again, his past catches up with him...

When Homer messes up his sisters-in-law Patty and Selma's escape room game on their birthday, the three of them get into another argument. Because Krusty's aunt Sadie has just started a TV show in which she solves problems, Marge calls her in to help. Sadie believes that Marge is the problem, and when Homer meets with Patty and Selma alone, they actually get along well.

Directed by J. Lee Thompson, this 1961 war drama tells the story of an Allied commando attempting to destroy the cannons installed by the Wehrmacht at Navarone, along with their fortress. Based on the novel by Alistair MacLean.

Spanish-Argentinean psychological thriller based on a play, for whose screenplay Marcelo Piñeyro received a Goya in 2005. Seven job applicants sit in a conference room and fight each other for a position as top manager using the “Grönholm method”. One candidate after another is weeded out using nerve-wracking mind games.

Iranian couple Amir and Narges love each other and want to get married. But the bride price Amir would have to pay for Narges, who comes from a good family, is too high, especially as he has just lost his job. In order to get money quickly, he signs on with a fisherman. However, there is only any significant pay if he also takes part in illegal activities ...

Satirical western by Arthur Penn from 1970, based on the novel of the same name by Thomas Berger. Dustin Hoffman plays the white settler's son Jack, who grows up with Indians. As an adult, he is torn between cultures.

The gentle war widow Ada Harris works as a cleaner in London in 1957. When she sees a Dior dress at a client's house, she develops the desire to own one herself. She manages to save enough money, but when she arrives in Paris, she is out of place among the rich. However, there are enough people who mean well by her to bring her closer to her dream.

The renowned linguistics professor Alice Howland has just turned 50. Because she is forgetful from time to time, she goes to a neurologist. He discovers that Alice has a rare form of Alzheimer's disease. As this is genetic, it is likely that one of her three children will also be affected. The family must now learn to deal with the inevitable.
Unsuccessful reporter Quoyle is left by his wife and moves to Newfoundland with his daughter and aunt. There he learns about the history of his family and begins a new life.

After a conversation with Hajo, Dressler reports himself to the tax office for tax evasion. - The Dagdelen family has decided that Orkan should return to Berlin. He cannot and will not accept this. An argument with Lea and Andy Zenker breaks out at the Akropolis. The argument has fatal consequences... - Iffi talks to Nina. Nina assures her that she no longer has feelings for Klaus.
Like two feature films with the same content, the series was based on the actual experiences of Anna Leonowens in 19th century Siam, today's Thailand. Each of the 13 episodes was 25 minutes long.

The robbery of a money transport, the treasure map of an unknown island and the escape of two convicts - who could have guessed that eight boys on a vacation trip around New Zealand on board the two-master “Sloughi” would ever be associated with this? Least of all the friends Doniphan Weldon and Dick Sand.

The fearless Aladdin and his new girlfriend Paige are on the hunt for a stolen magic lamp. The dynamic duo sails through some crazy Arabian nights. There they meet an Egyptian queen, an English king, dinosaurs and pirates, among others.

Dragonball (jp. ドラゴンボール Doragon Bōru) is the first of two television series based on the manga of the same name by Akira Toriyama. A total of 153 episodes were produced by the animation studio “Toei” for the first broadcast on Japanese television on the television station “Fuji TV” from February 26, 1986 to April 12, 1989, which were later continued by “Dragonball Z”.

Salem is an American television series with a historical background and many fictional elements, developed by screenwriters Brannon Braga and Adam Simon. The series is set during the witch hunts of the 17th century and is mainly a drama, but contains mystery and horror elements.
Drama about the Roman philosopher Seneca and his relationship with Emperor Nero.
With a pirate radio station, three young radio producers cause quite a stir and are pursued by the authorities, but also set the course for a career and personal happiness.
Italian crime series, the first three seasons of which center on forest ranger Pietro (Terence Hill), who helps the police solve cases.
Michael Moore's biting documentary from 2004 attempts to shed a critical light on the Bush administration's involvement and motives in the events of September 11, 2001.

In 2035, due to Japan's low birth rate, few young people attend school. To breathe new life into Saioh High School for Girls, the energetic Manami Amamiya decides to become student council president and, together with the other members of the student council, organize a big summer festival.

New York high society is having fun at a party with a scavenger hunt, which also involves finding a homeless person. Competing sisters Cornelia and Irene come across Godfrey at a garbage dump, and Irene is immediately taken with him. She spontaneously hires him as a butler in her parents' house. Godfrey tries to assert himself in the dysfunctional family.

Andy's eye is injured after the fight between Orkan and Andy. In the worst case scenario, he could lose his sight. Meanwhile, the conservative party and the Boluevard press are exploiting the case and calling for the immediate deportation of criminal foreigners. This puts Klaus in a conflict of conscience, as the conservative party is his employer.

Dr. Dressler wants to propose to Elisabeth. However, Elisabeth misunderstands the secret preparations. Marion's (ex-)boyfriend now has a new girlfriend. Marion is dismayed. Hans realizes that he has paid too much for heating. He can really use the money. Berta Nolte and Elisabeth Flöter are still considering whether to go to the new tenants' wedding.

Elfie and Sigi are getting married and have invited the entire neighborhood to the Greek restaurant “Akropolis” run by Vasily's parents. Neighbor Joschi Bennarsch gives the couple an old, valuable Bible. He doesn't know that Sigi had previously denounced him. Elisabeth Flöter's daughter, Beate, suddenly appears on the doorstep: she has been expelled from school.

Beate suddenly appears and starts working as a temp in the hairdressing salon. Her mother Elisabeth is happy about it. Berta Nolte has quit her job because she is unhappy about a transfer. Fearing the reaction of her strict mother, she initially keeps this a secret. Chris from the shared flat is pregnant. She resolves to stop drinking. She resolutely throws away her gin supply...

Tennis instructor Stefan Nossek is flirting with Henny. Henny's husband Franz happens to be watching them kiss. Berta Nolte meets her neighbor Gottlieb Griese at a sailing course at the adult education center. She still doesn't tell her mother that she has quit her job and is now unemployed. Sparks also fly between Berta and Gottlieb...

Berta and Gottlieb continue to flirt with each other. They meet up for a date and go out for dinner together. Elfie finds out that she is pregnant even though her husband doesn't really want children and tells her neighbor Gabi. When she leaves the apartment, however, she forgets to turn off the bath water. Sigi later finds out from Lydia Nolte that the apartment below him is under water...

A stone flies through the Beimers' window. A threatening message on it. The Beimers are at a loss. Isolde learns that her husband Hubert is having an affair. Beate, who is also interested in training as a hairdresser in Isolde's salon, comforts her. The joy of Elfie's pregnancy comes to an abrupt end: according to Dr. Dressler, it is only a false pregnancy...

When Dressler learns that his son Frank does not want to become a doctor, he is horrified. To numb his disappointment, he reaches for the bottle. Shock for the Beimers: son Klausi has not arrived at school. When an employee from the garbage collection service later drops him off at home, everything clears up: Klausi wanted to rescue his teddy bear, which mother Helga had thrown in the bin earlier.

Berta is still hiding her unemployment from her mother. When her mother confronts her about not being able to reach her on the phone at work, Berta has to come up with an excuse. Hans Beimer receives an offer to run a boarding school in Portugal. Not all the Beimers are thrilled. Gabi and Benno return to the shared flat from their vacation. The flat is devastated...

Dressler and his wife Elisabeth fall out for good. Dressler terminates Elisabeth's employment at the practice. When Elisabeth's son Carsten finds her unconscious that evening, Carsten asks Dr. Dressler for help. But he thinks it's all a trick and refuses. The Beimers want to move to Portugal! But Marion still absolutely refuses to move to Portugal with them.

Elisabeth files a complaint against Dressler for failure to provide assistance. Dressler then receives a visit from the Munich police. The Beimer family is not going to Portugal after all. Hans is convinced that he is doing meaningful work as a social worker at the Munich Youth Welfare Office. Marion and Vasily reconcile. Marion has learned that Vasily's mother is currently in the hospital...

Berta Nolte and Gottlieb Griese continue to meet and flirt. When Berta comes home drunk one evening, she is confronted by her strict mother Lydia. Berta threatens to move out... Benny Beimer encounters a completely drunk Chris Barnsteg in the hallway. After a conversation with his parents, he brings Chris into the Beimers' apartment.

Mr. Smithers has assigned Homer to look after a $1 million bottle of wine, but despite his best efforts, Marge unwittingly uses it for dinner. Professor Frink manages to make an exact copy of the wine, which gives Marge and Smithers the idea of selling the fake wine to the rich and giving the money to the poor.

Dr. Dressler examines Berta Nolte and diagnoses her with pneumonia. During a later visit from Gottlieb Griese, he tells a story and unintentionally reveals Berta's secret: her unemployment. Lydia is horrified and decides that Berta should start giving piano lessons immediately. Benny visits Chris in the shared flat. When mother Helga finds out, she has a terrible fear.

Beate is in love with her flatmate Gung. But he doesn't seem to be interested. Phil confesses to Gabi that he likes her. Gabi is perplexed. When she goes into the kitchen one night, Phil is sitting there. Gabi asks him if he really meant what he said. Elisabeth Dressler tries to set Carsten up with a girl at one of Beate's parties. But Carsten doesn't seem to be interested.

Benno has bought a house for himself and Gabi. Gabi doesn't know about it yet. What Benno doesn't know is that something is developing between Gabi and her roommate, Phil... Helga and Hans have an argument: Helga believes Hans is having an affair because she sees a lipstick mark on his shirt. But there's a happy ending. Hans and Helga reconcile.

Gabi and Benno have a dispute. Gabi is horrified that Benno has bought a house without her knowledge. Benno then spends the night alone in the new house. Gabi continues to flirt with Phil and decides to leave Benno for him. But will Phil be as serious as she is? Gottlieb Griese wants to go on a sailing trip. Berta confesses to him that she would like to go with him...

The so-called “home soil” that Joschi sold was stretched by his wife Philo. Philo confessed to this in court. Joschi reproaches her, but later forgives her. Benno from the flat share is still clueless: he has no idea that his Gabi is having an affair with Phil. But Phil is obviously playing several tricks: The next blonde is already waiting for him in his room.

Dressler has hired Berta Nolte as a new receptionist at the practice. Elisabeth tries to speak to Dressler - but he shows no interest in talking to her. Things are not going well for Elisabeth with her daughter Beate either: she has been reading her diary! When Beate finds out, she doesn't tell her mother that she has inherited a house in England from her recently deceased father.

A argument breaks out between Sigi and Elfie in the “Akropolis” restaurant. Elfie leaves the restaurant and goes home. Later, when Sigi comes home drunk, he hits Elfie! She flees to Gabi in the shared flat. Elisabeth is still hoping for a reconciliation with Dressler. But her son Carsten tries to dissuade her. Berta and Gottlieb have made up their minds: they finally want to get married!

Dr. Dressler has a serious word with Sigi Kronmayr: as he has repeatedly beaten his wife Elfie, Dressler recommends that Sigi should undergo professional therapy. Meanwhile, Henny Schildknecht asks her father Gottlieb Griese for money: she wants 30000 Deutschmarks from him to invest. But Griese needs the money for his upcoming wedding to Berta Nolte. Henny is disappointed.

Henny has received the 30000 DM from Stefan Nossek. Frank Dressler confesses to his father that he has dropped out of medical school for good. Dressler is horrified and kicks Frank out of the medical practice! Berta and Gottlieb's wedding is due to take place in two weeks' time. The preparations are in full swing. Gabi has to remake Lydia's wedding dress for Berta...

Berta's wedding dress is finished. She proudly presents it to her future husband, Gottlieb. Gottlieb needs a replacement for his kiosk for their honeymoon. He asks Else Kling if she could take over. Frank Dressler wants to talk to his father. But his father reacts coldly and dismissively. Frank even has to hand over the house keys!

Scream by Wes Craven was a hit film in 1996 and is regarded as the renewal of the teen slasher film. A masked serial killer is on the loose among the teenagers in the small town of Woodsboro. He is particularly targeting Sidney, whose mother was murdered a year earlier. But not all teenagers take the matter seriously ...

In the 1930s, three illustrious characters meet in Manchuria: “The Weird” steals a treasure map from a Japanese official. “The Bad” is paid to get it back. “The Good” hunts them both down to supplement his wages. Hot on their heels is the Chinese liberation army, which believes the map to be the Japanese construction plans for an enemy railroad line.

The big day has finally arrived: Berta Nolte and Gottlieb Griese are getting married! Almost the entire neighborhood is invited. At the party, a fight breaks out between Henny and Franz. Later, Henny admits to Franz that she never loved him and that she now wants to live with her affair. That same night, she moves into Stefan Nossek's apartment!

A row between Berta and Gottlieb: Shortly after leaving for their honeymoon, they return to Lindenstrasse. Gottlieb doesn't want to leave Henny alone, as she's currently going through a marital crisis. She's now living with Tanja at Nossek's. A fight breaks out between Benno and Phil. Benno has learned that Gabi was actually having an affair with Phil. Benno is injured in the head...

Else was attacked the week before at the Dressler villa when she went to check whether she had switched off the iron. When questioned by the police, she identifies Frank Dressler as the perpetrator. Frank is subsequently arrested. Benno is in hospital with a head injury. He has suffered a brain haemorrhage. Gabi then urges Phil to move out of the shared flat.

Hans' boss Hütthusen and his wife are guests at the Beimers'! Pears are served for dessert. At night, they make the Beimers very nauseous. The Hütthusens have also eaten the pears... Henny has left Nossek. Tanja has stayed with him in the apartment. Berta is temporarily staying with Lydia, as Gottlieb has taken Henny in. First episode directed by Ilse Hofman.

Mrs. Hütthusen has to go to hospital! Suspected food poisoning from the pears Helga served last week. The Grieses can probably go on their honeymoon after all: Lydia has given them a large sum of money. Problems for the Sarikakis family: beer sales are below the brewery's expectations. In the worst case scenario, the family is threatened with termination of the lease.

The Beimers are still in quarantine. They have been infected with salmonella. Henny Schildknecht has moved back in with Nossek and Tanja. Franz is not happy about his daughters Tanja and Meike having contact with Nossek. He wants to remedy the situation. Frank Dressler is in prison. In a letter to his mother, he has asked her to convince Ludwig to visit him.

Franz Schildknecht receives a visit from the youth welfare office: at Henny's request, custody of Meike is to be taken away from him. Benno has been released from hospital. When he finds out by chance that Gabi is pregnant, he is delighted. But Gabi has to make a confession: The child is not his, but Phil Seegers'!

Things are not going well for Benno: his company has gone bankrupt and he is now unemployed. The child Gabi is expecting is not his, but Phil's. Benno only finds solace in alcohol. Benny Beimer wants to drop out of school. He now wants to become an actor. His parents don't like this at all. Henny and Franz are still at odds. Henny moves into Gottlieb's empty apartment.

Franz Schildknecht becomes increasingly addicted to alcohol. He can't cope with the fact that Henny will soon have custody of Meike. Tanja is in love with Stefan Nossek; she sees her mother as competition and tells her to fight for Nossek. Frank Dressler has been sentenced to prison. Phil Seegers has made a large inheritance... he wants Gabi back at all costs.

A surprise for Helga: on their anniversary (they have known each other for 20 years), Hans surprises her with an expensive pearl necklace that Helga has always wanted. The two of them celebrate this special day with great enthusiasm. Benny is obviously interested in Tanja Schildknecht, which displeases Helga. She uses an excuse to stop him from visiting Tanja at a tennis tournament.

Benno hears a thud in Lydia's apartment above him at night. When he knocks, no one answers.  He enters the apartment with Else's master key. What has happened? Meanwhile, Dressler and Elisabeth are getting closer again. Benny still has a crush on Tanja. He writes her love letters. Tanja is not interested. That night, Helga finds Benny's bed empty...

It's Meike's birthday. She wants to celebrate with the whole family. Just like in the old days. When Franz presents her with his present, the family once again gets into an argument. Disappointed, Meike retreats to her room. Lydia is back from hospital. She had a sugar shock last week. Benny is still missing! A short time later, the police find a body...

Orkan is sentenced to an educational measure in court: He must nurse Andy back to health until he recovers. The judge sees this as a victim-offender compensation. - Pregnant Jack has stomach pains. Sandra sends her to the doctor immediately. From now on, Jack will have more rest. - Tanja is worried: her apartment is a mess. Dressler confronts her. Is Tanja mentally ill?

For generations, Jesmark's ancestors have lived from fishing in Malta in a small fishing boat called the Luzzu. But the catch is now almost non-existent and Jesmark can no longer feed his wife Denise and his newborn son. With a heavy heart, Jesmark joins the illegal black market fishing to make some money.

In 1969, Chase Andrews is found dead in the swamps of North Carolina, where he has apparently fallen from a fire watch tower. The local residents blame the “marsh girl” and so Kya Clark ends up in court, who was abandoned by her family in her home in the middle of the swamps as a child and lived there in virtual isolation ever since - until she met a man ...

US-American staged documentary film in which Morgan Spurlock wants to prove how unhealthy fast food is for the body by means of a self-experiment. For 30 days, he eats only fast food in the morning, at lunchtime and in the evening and observes his physical reactions. A team of doctors monitors him the whole time.

A son of Tamil Nadu's biggest garment owner goes missing. The police are secretly involved in the search for him. The police investigation is moving towards one goal, but things are different. The police officer is shocked when the investigation takes unexpected turns. Whether the abducted person is alive or not, what happened in his life, why was he kidnapped, is the story of the movie Rekkai Mul

At Christmas in Zurich, the fates of several people intertwine around the young Bulgarian prostitute Mia. Divorced Rolf doesn't want to spend Christmas alone, social worker Judith fulfills her sexual needs outside of marriage, which pregnant Lena also notices in her husband, and widow Maria wants to let a man back into her life.

French drama from 1986 based on the novel of the same name by Philippe Djian and starring Béatrice Dalle. Young Betty meets Zorg, a bon vivant ten years her senior. Despite great mutual attraction, their love affair proves difficult.

In 1948, the Korean peninsula was divided into North and South Korea at the 38th parallel. Jiwon Choi introduces viewers to modern Korean history and culture by contrasting the story of her grandfather, who served in the Korean War, with the rise of K-POP.

Nathan realizes early on that he is different from other children. He has little to do with people, but is all the more interested in mathematics. He only has a connection to his father, but he dies in a car accident. The unconventional teacher Humphreys encourages Nathan's talent for math and the teenager meets like-minded people when he is selected for the Math Olympiad.

Antonio earns his living as a parking valet for the rich and lives with his mother after his wife has left him. He accidentally ends up in a paparazzi photo showing the married entrepreneur Vincent with the film star Olivia. To prevent Vincent's wife from becoming suspicious, Antonio is asked to play Olivia's lover for a while.
Fantasy film from 1985 based on a comic. The fighter Red Sonja wants to take revenge on the evil Queen Gedren. The barbarian Kalidor supports her endeavor.

Havva and Nurhan return in quick succession to the remote mountain village where their father lives. They had both worked as maids in the city, as did their older sister Reyhan, who is already living with their father again with her husband and her baby. They all regret that they had to return, as the village cannot offer them any prospects.

A Russian politician has been murdered in Vienna and the only witness, his Polish girlfriend, has fled to London. There, Eve Polastri, who works for MI5, is responsible for protecting her. She interviews the witness without permission and finds out that a woman was the perpetrator, not a man as MI5 claims. And she already has her next murder assignment, this time in Tuscany.

Carolyn Martens from MI6 has become aware of Eve's investigation into the suspected contract killer and offers her a new job to find her. Eve also takes Bill and Elena onto her new team. Villanelle's clients have doubts about her state of mind after her last assignments didn't go so well, but that doesn't bother Villanelle much.

Villanelle has another new murder assignment. To her frustration, however, she has to proceed inconspicuously on Raymond's instructions, and she also doesn't like the fact that she has a new rival who Eve is supposedly more interested in. Eve is surprised to meet Konstantin at Carolyn's and manages to accompany Niko to a school event. But even there she is not safe from her job.
\Hell Below\" is a series based on true events that depicts scenes and stories of the fierce underwater warfare during World War II."

The life of singer Whitney Houston is told with a lot of music, from her early success as the daughter of a well-known singer, to her problematic marriage with Bobby Brown, and her drug abuse and the resulting deterioration of her singing.
New Zealand series about 13-year-old Jessie, which was broadcast in 24 3-minute episodes every weekday on WNTV in 2001/2002.

Brynn lives alone in her parents' house, which lies secluded in the forest. The inhabitants of the nearby town obviously avoid her and so she passes the time by building a model town. But one evening, alien beings invade her house, and while Brynn fights them, she also has to face her past.

Homer wants Bart to become a DJ because there's money to be made. Bart does indeed start DJing in his tree house and is very successful. But the nights get so loud that neighbor Flanders gets himself noise-cancelling headphones, which Homer steals straight away. This is a step too far and Ned swears that he will never speak to him again.

In 17th century Spain, Don Salluste de Bazan, the king's greedy finance minister, is dismissed from his post because of an affair. In revenge, he wants to frame the queen for an affair. His servant Blaze is to pretend to be Don Cesar and ingratiate himself with the royal couple at court. But Blaze is actually secretly in love with the queen.

Duel at Diablo is a western starring Sydney Poitier that takes a critical look at racial prejudice. It deals with the bloody conflict between the Apaches and the American settlers, into whose clutches an outlaw and a young mother fall.

A vandal is wreaking havoc in Dexter's neighborhood and this is a growing problem for him as his neighbors' increased vigilance restricts his freedom of movement. Meanwhile, the Trinity Killer kills the second victim in the series of three by throwing her off a warehouse, but apart from Lundy and Debra, everyone believes it was suicide.

When Harper Marlowe wants to separate from her husband James, an argument ensues after which James apparently commits suicide. After the events, Harper wants to relax on a vacation in a rented country house, but the men there behave strangely and Harper is soon threatened.
Comic drama by old master Robert Altman. Noble couple William and Sylvia McCordle organize a hunting party in 1930s England, where a murderer is also present.

The programmer Gareth is questioned by two investigators. It turns out that he has developed an AI that pretends to be the young girl Cherry and so catches child molesters on the Internet. To become even more powerful, the three form a team, but over the years Cherry develops beyond her actual task.

To give Dexter a break, Rita takes the children to a wedding for several days. Dexter wants to use this to satisfy his dark urges: Officer Zoey Kruger has shot her husband and daughter and framed a dealer for the crime. But as Dexter searches for evidence, Kruger figures Dexter out. Meanwhile, Deb and Lundy get closer again.
Drama by Eran Riklis about a Palestinian woman whose lemon trees become a political threat to the house next door to Israel's defense minister.

The koala Buster Moon runs a theater with a lot of passion and dedication. However, it is also rather unsuccessful, which is why he is on the verge of bankruptcy. A new singing competition with a big casting is supposed to save him, but a curse seems to lie on the venture right from the start...

Teacher Sergio arrives at a school in a town characterized by drug cartels and poverty, where he tries to reach the pupils with a new approach: the curriculum does not decide what the pupils learn, but rather they should acquire knowledge largely independently according to their interests. Despite initial difficulties, he is successful, but everyday life keeps catching up with the pupils.

John Dutton runs the family's large ranch in Montana, with the help of two of his three sons. But his land is under threat from construction projects and members of a tribe on the nearby reservation have taken his cattle by moving them onto their land. When he tries to get the cattle back, the situation escalates and people are killed.

Dexter follows in Arthur Mitchell's footsteps to find out how he keeps his serial killer identity a secret from his family, as this issue becomes an increasing problem for him after Rita discovers his hideout. So he hopes to learn enough from the Trinity Killer to save his own family. Deb, meanwhile, is dissatisfied with the investigation about Lundy.
The six-episode miniseries centers on a poverty-stricken family in West Baltimore.

In Chennai, four boys are mysteriously murdered, while several young women die in similar road accidents. A newly appointed female officer begins investigating the cases. During the inquiry, a shocking connection surfaces when the inspector meets the doctor conducting the post-mortems. What links the murders and accidents? Why is the inspector startled by the doctor? And who is behind these deaths

While Dexter continues to emulate Arthur Mitchell's example in order to put his family life in order, he also has to work on a new case. A woman's arm, severed post-mortem, has been found in the stomach of an alligator. The fingerprints lead to a young foreign woman and a fashion photographer who Batista is sure is the killer. However, there is a lack of evidence...

Dexter's conscience is plagued by the murder of an innocent man. To distract himself, he wants to kill the Trinity Killer as quickly as possible. But things turn out differently than he had planned. Meanwhile, Debra succeeds in convincing LaGuerta of the Trinity Killer theory and initiates the search for the serial killer by means of mass DNA testing.

Hans is sent to prison in 1968 for homosexual acts. There he meets Viktor, whom he already knows from previous stays, as Hans had already been transferred directly from the concentration camp to prison in 1945 because of his homosexuality. Although Viktor does not like gays, a friendship develops between them.

12-year-old Jake discovers a sealskin in Wellington, New Zealand, unleashing mythical creatures and dangers. He must protect his family from these threats amidst an adventurous journey into a fantastical world.

Jonah Mitchell, the son of the Trinity killer, invites Dexter to Thanksgiving dinner - mainly to protect himself from his father. In this way, Dex gets a direct insight into the Mitchells' completely broken family life, while neglecting his own family.

Dexter observes Arthur kidnapping a young boy. To find him, he asks Jonah to help him and searches empty houses in the city - which again clashes with family and work. He realizes that Trinity doesn't always kill three victims, but four. His murder cycle begins with the ten-year-old boy. Deb, meanwhile, believes that something is wrong with Christine.

US adaptation of the Melville classic novel by John Huston, which quickly became a cult film. The ageing Captain Ahab stubbornly fights against his overpowering enemy, the whale Moby Dick. Both seem to suspect that this battle will come to its predetermined end.

Christine Hill is interrogated by the police but refuses to testify, so Quinn still sticks by her. Meanwhile, Dexter tries to lay a false trail so that Arthur Mitchell remains undetected and doesn't jump off the blade by being arrested. But he also has to sort out his family problems somehow...

The Trinity killer has identified Dexter and even visits him at the police station. Dexter sees only one way out: he wants to kill Mitchell as quickly as possible and is able to overpower him in an underground parking garage before he escapes. But then everything goes wrong. Meanwhile, the rest of the team realize that they have been following the wrong trail.

After the death of Rita, Dexter is on autopilot. Fortunately, he has Debra, who takes on many tasks in connection with the funeral. Meanwhile, Astor reproaches Dexter and he himself feels responsible for his wife's death because he didn't kill the Trinity killer sooner.

The governor informs Jamie that Lee could not have killed Robert and that a third person must have shot him, so there was no self-defense. John realizes that it must have been Kayce and uses his connections to stop the case from being pursued. Kayce, on the other hand, wants to go back into the Navy.
US crime series from the 1980s. The two dissimilar brothers Rick and A.J. Simon run a private detective agency in San Diego and solve their cases using often unconventional methods...
Film adaptation of the story of the same name by Hermann Hesse.

Tanja has realized that she can no longer manage her everyday life on her own. She asks Momo for help. - Orkan has taken up the court-ordered care service with Andy. But Andy provokes Orkan at every opportunity. - Klaus, who works for the conservative party, is asked by his boss to exploit the story about Orkan's crime even more.

Orkan has gone into hiding because of the dispute. Murat tries to find him. If Orkan doesn't continue to look after Andy, he will have to go to prison. - Hajo has started playing double bass in a jazz club. He keeps his new hobby a secret from Sabrina so that she doesn't get jealous. - Momo takes therapeutic care of Tanja. Enzo uses this opportunity to continue flirting with Marcella.

Benny has contacted Helga! He has written a letter from Portugal. He works for a fisherman there. Helga wants to leave immediately to look for her son. Tanja against Henny: Tanja continues to try to steal her mother's boyfriend (Nossek). She threatens to change the tennis club if Nossek doesn't get involved with her. News from Beate: she gets a trainee contract at the hairdressing salon.

Henny wants to reconcile with Franz. She has seen Nossek cheating on her. But she meets with rejection from Franz. Helga calls from Portugal: Her wallet and identity card have been stolen. Hans wants to help her and send her money. Later, however, Helga is suddenly at the door. But Benny is not with her. He wants to stay in Portugal.

Franz has an affair with housekeeper Angelika. The two get closer and closer. Meike, dressed only in her underwear, sits in the fridge in her grandfather's apartment. She wants to get sick so that she can reunite her parents. But suddenly the door slams shut. Meike is unable to free herself. Meanwhile, Dressler visits Frank in prison and offers to help.

Meike's “fridge action” is interpreted as an attempted suicide in the house and causes quite a stir. Sigi Kronmayr starts a petition in the house: he wants the Schildknechts to be stripped of custody. Isolde wants to buy the house in which the hairdressing salon is located. The house is to be foreclosed. Tanja wants to travel to the USA with Nossek for two weeks.

Isolde Panowak tries to persuade the Sarikakis family to buy the house in which the hairdressing salon is located. Meike Schildknecht is with father Franz. She didn't want to stay with Henny. Suddenly Meike gets a high temperature. In her feverish dream, she talks about her most fervent wish: a happy family life. Meanwhile, Henny finds a booking confirmation from the USA in Nossek's apartment.

Lydia Nolte has received a message from Berta and Gottlieb: They have taken two American men on board as crew on their journey. Lydia finds out from the American embassy that the two men are wanted criminals. Tanja and Nossek have returned from the USA. Franz confronts Nossek. Benno Zimmermann has to intervene...

Dexter finds a bloodstain in his removal van. A thorough investigation reveals that a woman was probably murdered there. The truck then leads him to Boyd Fowler, the new target for Dex's dark passenger. Meanwhile, he wants to be a good father to the children and stand by them, but Astor in particular doesn't make it easy for him.

Dexter tries to make it clear to Lumen that she needs to put the events behind her and return home. But as he soon realizes, he can't really get through to her. This puts Dexter under pressure to act. Meanwhile, Debra, Angel and Cira find more murder victims while searching for Carlos Fuentes.

Lumen is finally out of town and Dexter's life can return to normal - or so he thinks. The first thing he does is find a new target - a serial killer. But as soon as he has the stunned man on the table, Lumen calls and asks Dexter for help. She has shot one of her tormentors and is panicking because she doesn't know what to do now...

\Grand Theft Auto: The Movie\" is a film project produced by MTV Project set in the universe of Rockstar Games' iconic video game series Grand Theft Auto V (GTA V). This project offers an innovative cinematic experience that allows players to showcase their creativity by utilizing in-game locations
column3: characters
column4: and story elements."

abstract: Shock for Dex and Lumen: Out of the blue, Astor appears at the door. Completely drunk and with a girlfriend in tow. And the next day is even worse. The two of them suddenly disappear and everything looks like a kidnapping. Although this raises a lot of unpleasant questions, Dex calls in the police.

Divorced teacher Rachel meets Ali, who is separated and has a four-year-old daughter, Leila. Rachel would like to have a child of her own, but her doctor tells her that she doesn't have much time left. Over time, her relationship with Leila becomes closer and closer, but Rachel never really becomes part of the family.

After the early death of his wife, journalist Benjamin can no longer get his life together and is also struggling to bring up his two children, Dylan and Rosie. He wants to try a fresh start and buys a property with a run-down zoo. His funds are tight, but they get help from animal keeper Kelly, among others.

Barney is given the drug Othinquic because of high blood sugar levels, which also causes him to lose a lot of weight. Word of the supposed miracle cure for losing weight spreads quickly in Springfield and soon there are no more overweight people. Only Homer remains, until Marge convinces him to take the drug too. But taking it also leads to side effects ...

Dex and Lumen, as well as Deb and the team, are getting closer and closer to Jordan Chase. However, the situation changes abruptly when Dex discovers Liddy's camera. Now it's time to find out who is actually spying on them...

Jordan Chase has Lumen in his power and has gone into hiding with her. Both Dex and Deb are feverishly searching for him. But both are distracted: firstly, Rita's family and children pay a surprise visit to celebrate Harrison's birthday. Secondly, Liddy's body is found, which leads to Quinn's arrest.

During the Gulf War in 1987, Qader is at work when an Iraqi fighter jet drops a bomb containing mustard gas over the town where Qader's pregnant wife Maryam and their three children are. Qader tries everything to keep his family alive, but the hospital is overcrowded and there is not much the doctors can do anyway. The movie is based on true events.

Adaptation of the novel of the same name by Lois Lowry: Jonas lives in a world in which there is neither war nor crime. The other side of the coin is that emotions and any kind of non-conformism are suppressed. But when Jonas is appointed the new Keeper of Remembrance, he gets to know a completely different world and has to confront the positive and negative forms of humanity.

In a peaceful village, Two Young best Friends fall for the same Beautiful Girl. What starts as friendship soon turns into a comedy-filled Love war. Each tries to win her heart with charm, tricks, and emotions, but the girl has a surprise of her own is shown in a Comedy Suspense with Fun filled power packed manner.

It's the anniversary of the death of Jamie, Kayce and Beth's mother, which is particularly upsetting for Beth. Kayce accidentally finds a car with dangerous contents on the reservation. Jamie wants to run for attorney general and gets John's reluctant support. Meanwhile, John has Rainwater sent to prison for cattle rustling.

A construction crew discovers the graves where Kayce had hidden the bodies. Meanwhile, his son Tate is at Grandpa John's, where they plan to build a fire by the river, but an accident occurs. Beth goes to a bar with Dan Jenkins, where she makes sure he doesn't fare well.

The story is about the hero who comes to Chennai Central from a small village due to his family situation, what kind of hardships does he experience in the name of capitalism and how does he recover from it.

Three friends desires to start their own medical shop, find issues by chain of troubles, Struggles inside a thorn forest along with strangers to resolve all their issues before they lost their life more than money.

Kayce's arrest doesn't last long, Jamie takes him straight home again. John fears that things won't end well with Kayce, so he tries to get him and Monica to move in with him. Rip recruits a new ex-con for the ranch, while Beth is once again out of character.

Confined to a secluded rest home and trapped within his stroke-ridden body, a former Judge must stop an elderly psychopath who employs a child's puppet to abuse the home's residents with deadly consequences.

Retired teacher Nancy meets callboy Leo in a hotel room. Her husband died two years ago, with whom sex was an unsatisfactory duty, and Nancy has not had any other sexual relationships. Now she wants to make up for what she has missed out on, but the situation makes her uncomfortable.
Film by Michael Winterbottom about the music scene in Manchester, where “Joy Division”, “New Order” and the “Happy Mondays”, among others, originated.

Police officer Yohan has just become head of the homicide squad in Grenoble when 21-year-old Clara is doused with petrol in the street at night and set alight. Over time, the investigators find more and more men who could have committed the crime, but they don't find the perpetrator.

Paul grows up in the 1980s in a wealthy Jewish family, but he only gets on well with his grandfather. His performance at state school is not great, and on top of that he makes friends with the rebellious black classmate Johnny. Worried that Paul won't graduate, his parents enrol him in a private school where different rules apply.
A violent fight between two teenagers sparks a tense family conflict. The community shatters as neighbors turn into enemies.
Houseboat is a romantic comedy starring Cary Grant and Sophia Loren, in which the Italian plays a charming nanny for the widowed sonny boy's three children.

After the end of the war, Jewish Holocaust survivor Max returns to his hometown, where he learns that his wife and son have been murdered by the Nazis. He joins a British army unit made up of Jews who secretly track down and kill Nazis. This brings him into contact with the Jewish group Nakam, who want to take revenge on all Germans.

Charlie is homeless, has to steal his food and has no luck finding work either. But then he makes friends with a stray dog. He secretly takes him to a dance bar, where he meets a singer who flirts with him. He can't invite her out for lack of money, but the stray dog helps him out.

John tells Monica how he and Kayce fell out. Governor Perry hosts Jamie and Beth about their plans to run for office, but she doesn't think much of Beth. Rainwater teams up with Dan Jenkins to buy land and take action against John. Monica tries to settle a school brawl and gets caught in the middle herself.
Women present and discuss their ongoing Wages for Housework campaign.

Third film in the Pink Panther series. Inspector Clouseau is in demand again: the Pink Panther, the world's largest diamond, has been stolen in an Arab country and he has to find it again. He suspects Sir Charles Litton, who lives on the Côte d'Azur, of being the notorious criminal “Phantom”. But Litton's girlfriend Claudine lures Clouseau onto the wrong track.

Thriller from 1989 starring Al Pacino and Ellen Barkin. While investigating the case of a serial killer who lures his victims via personal ads, New York cop Frank Keller falls in love with the main suspect.

Sam works as a professional hitwoman for a syndicate and she's having a pretty bad day: first, an otherwise straightforward job turns into a massacre. Then she has to take out a thief, but it turns out that he himself is the victim: his daughter is being held hostage. Sam decides to rescue the girl...

A grizzly is in the area and Rip is supposed to make it vanish with a few other cowboys, but a dangerous situation arises. Monica has woken up after an operation, but her condition remains critical. Jamie starts his campaign, while Rainwater and Dan Jenkins can't come to a business agreement for the time being.

Take a break from mainstream politics with Michael Knowles as he journeys with you into the world of fascinating people with extraordinary testimonies. ‘Michael &’ is a long-form conversation series where discussions can lead anywhere, allowing guests to share their shocking stories and engage in civilized debates.
Michael Knowles sits down with two combat veterans of The Korean War to share memories of the fighting and discuss the war's politics.

A former astrologist finds the truth and gives a clear warning against new-age practices. Angela Ucci spent 10 years dabbling in many new-age arts from tarot cards or yoga before her life was changed forever when she was saved by Jesus Christ.
Michael Knowles was joined by Bronte Remsik, a third-year medical school student and social media influencer, to debate abortion.
Very Rev. Daniel Reehil, VF joins the show to discuss the dangers of the occult and how to fight the enemy when he comes for you.
Michael Knowels sits down with Joshua Zatkoff to discuss things he saw after taking psychadelic drugs.The things he saw may shock you.

Join Michael Knowles as he engages in a candid and transformative interview with Joshua Broome, a former adult film star. Michael dives into Broome's personal journey, including the challenges he faced in the adult entertainment industry and his decision to pursue a new path in life.

Join Michael Knowles in this highly anticipated, exclusive long-form interview with the QAnon Shaman (Jacob Chansely) - a central figure of the events that unfolded on January 6th. In this episode, Jacob Chansley finally sheds light on the controversies and narratives surrounding the most talked-about day in recent memory.
Tracy Shannon is a \trans widow\" who lost her husband of 15 years of marriage to the transgender ideology. Michael Knowles sits down with Tracy to get the full story."

Embark on a riveting journey with Michael Knowles, brought to you by The Daily Wire, as he sits down with Jenn Nizza, an ex-psychic, to unearth the mysteries and truths behind the world of psychic phenomena. This revealing conversation promises to shed light on a realm that remains shrouded in intrigue for many.

Michael Knowles goes head-to-head with viral BLM activist Joshua Joseph (@jwilliamj)! In this riveting exchange, we dive deep into pivotal topics currently defining and dividing the socio-political landscape.

In one of the most chilling interviews of the year, Michael Knowles sits down with Julie Lopez, a former witch who stepped away from the dark realm of the occult to embrace the light of Jesus. With the haunting backdrop of her father's demise due to a 'blood oath,' Julie's narrative is a gripping tale of redemption, spirituality, and the age-old battle between good and evil.

Michael Knowles sits down with Alex Rosen, the founder of 'Predator Poachers,' a group dedicated to hunting down and exposing pedophiles. This interview delves into the dangerous and necessary world of tracking sexual predators, the methods used to expose them, and the subsequent involvement with law enforcement.

In this episode Michael Knowles goes head-to-head with renowned social commentator Pearl Davis in a thought-provoking debate on the relevance and significance of marriage for men in 2024. As society evolves and the traditional values surrounding marriage undergo significant transformations, Knowles and Davis delve deep into the merits and challenges of matrimonial commitment in the modern age.

In an incredibly moving and powerful episode, Michael Knowles sits down with Nala Ray, who left behind a lucrative $9 million career in adult entertainment after a life-changing encounter with faith and Jesus Christ. Nala Rey opens up about the realities of the industry, the emptiness of chasing material success, and the profound moment of spiritual awakening that led her to leave it all behind.

Michael Knowles sits down with Dr. Epstein, the former editor-in-chief of Psychology Today. Together, they uncover how big tech companies, particularly Google, wield immense influence over our thoughts and behaviors through search engine algorithms. Dr. Epstein breaks down how seemingly neutral search results can be subtly manipulated to shape public perception.

Join Michael Knowles for a deeply moving and inspiring interview with Lex and Nick Renick, a couple who were once married as a gay transgender pair but now live as husband and wife after a life-changing encounter with Jesus Christ. In this compelling episode, Lex and Nick share their extraordinary journey of transformation, faith, and redemption.
Join Michael Knowles in a captivating episode of \Michael &\" as he sits down with the dynamic and influential Justin Waller. Dive deep into a wide range of topics
column3: from personal growth and business to President Trump and Aliens. Justin Waller brings his unique perspective and thought-provoking ideas
column4: making this a must-watch interview for anyone interested in current events and culture."

abstract: In this exclusive one-on-one interview, Michael Knowles sits down with Donald Trump Jr. just days after an attempted assassination of his father, President Donald Trump. Join us as Donald Trump Jr. opens up about the harrowing incident, sharing his thoughts on the motives behind the attack and the current state of political violence in America.

Michael Knowles sits down with Sam Brown, a decorated Purple Heart recipient and current Senate nominee. Sam shares his incredible journey from the battlefield to the political arena, discussing his service, the challenges he faced after being wounded in combat, and his commitment to serving his country in a new capacity.
In this powerful episode of \Michael &
column3: \" Michael Knowles sits down with former Satanist-turned-evangelist John Ramirez for an eye-opening conversation you won’t want to miss. John shares his chilling journey from being deeply involved in the occult to finding redemption in Christ."

abstract: Michael Knowles sits down with Blake Healy, a man who has seen angels and demons as vividly as seeing people in front of him for as long as he can remember. From witnessing angels dancing in worship services to hearing demons whispering lies, Blake's extraordinary perspective on the spiritual realm has captivated audiences nationwide.

Michael Knowles sits down with Jack Barsky, a former KGB spy who led a double life as both a Soviet agent and an everyday American. Barsky opens up about the challenges of living with two families, the lies he told to maintain his cover, and the moments that ultimately led to his defection and freedom.
One year after her powerful story went viral, Nala Ray returns to \Michael &\" and this time
column3: she’s joined by her husband—for the first-ever repeat guest episode. In this candid and deeply personal conversation
column4: Nala reflects on the incredible changes in her life since leaving behind her $9 million Onlyfans career and embracing her faith."

abstract: Can humans push the limits of aging and live to 150 years old? If you could, would you want to? In this episode of Michael &, I sit down with Kayla Barnes-Lentz, a leading performance coach and health consultant, and her husband Warren Lentz, a biohacker and entrepreneur, who are on a mission to extend their lifespans through cutting-edge science, extreme daily routines, and radical lifestyle.

Are lost civilizations, Nephilim, and ancient aliens more than just fringe theories? In this explosive episode, Michael Knowles sits down with \Rogue Archaeologist\" Tim Alberino to uncover what the mainstream won’t tell you about the ancient past—and how it all ties back to the Bible. From forbidden history and buried technology to the biblical implications of giants and extraterrestrials."

Is the Shroud of Turin the real burial cloth of Jesus Christ—or the greatest mystery in Christian history? In this powerful episode of \Michael &\" theologian and historian Dr. Jeremiah Johnston uncovers the mind-blowing discoveries surrounding the Shroud. From scientific analysis and historical evidence
column3: they explore what makes the Shroud one of the most studied and debated relics in the world."

abstract: Is this the actual cloth that covered Jesus' face in the tomb? In Part 2 of this powerful episode of \Michael &\" Dr. Jeremiah Johnston dives into the mystery of the Sudarium of Oviedo—a lesser-known relic believed to be the head cloth of Jesus Christ. But that’s just the beginning."

Is there a link between vax and autism—or is it all a conspiracy? In this episode of \Michael &\" Michael Knowles sits down with one of the most controversial figures in modern medicine: Dr. Andy Wakefield. Before Joe Rogan and Aaron Rodgers started discussing potential effects from various shots
column3: Dr. Wakefield was getting the word out."

abstract: In 2017, investigative journalists Megan and Jodi from the New York Times team up to look into allegations of abuse made by an actress against film producer Harvey Weinstein. In the process, they come across more and more women who have been harassed by the powerful Hollywood mogul, but no one wants to speak out publicly.

After Matthias has become violent in his job in Germany, he flees to his home village in Transylvania, Romania. His ex lives there with his traumatized son Rudi and his former lover Csilla. Csilla is now the boss of the local bakery and has brought in guest workers from Sri Lanka due to a lack of applicants. But there is a riot against this in the village.

After years in Germany, Alina returns to Romania to reunite with her best friend Voichita from her orphanage days. But Voichita now lives in a convent. Alina follows her there with the aim of persuading Voichita to go to Germany with her.

After the incident with the bear and the tourists, Rip is in trouble, but when an official from Fish and Wildlife comes to investigate, another accident happens. Jamie is so busy with his campaign that he can't answer his father's calls. This makes John so angry that he forbids him to run for attorney general.

John informs Beth that she should look for a new lawyer for the ranch because Jamie is out. His assistant convinces Jamie to continue his candidacy all the more. Rip brings stripper Avery to the ranch to help figure out what's being plotted against John. Kayce returns to John at the ranch and wants to support him.

The translator Mia is sitting in a busy café in her home town of Paris when terrorists break in and start shooting at people. Mia survives injured, but has no memory of what happened. In order to come to terms with what she has experienced, she joins a group of survivors in the hope of finding her memory again.

Comedy about four friends who want to celebrate a bachelor party in Las Vegas. The next morning, they wake up in a chaotic hotel suite, hungover and with a blackout - but the groom Doug is missing. Little by little, they try to reconstruct the events of the previous night.

Comedy by John Hughes from 1985. The two computer nerds Gary Wallace and Wyatt Donnelly have a crazy idea: they create their dream girl via computer. The experiment is a success and L.I.S.A. finally draws the attention of real girls to the two lonely teenagers.

Writer and literature professor Rama travels to northern France to attend the trial of Senegalese immigrant Laurence Coly, who killed her 15-month-old daughter by letting the tide take her from the beach. The drama is inspired by a true case in 2013.

Adventure film in which the kids gang “the Goonies” set off in search of a fabulous treasure to save their housing estate from the demolition plans of real estate sharks. But the gang of crooks “Fratellies” are also trying to get their hands on the riches.

Marge is celebrating her birthday and because she is always so nice, almost the whole town comes. But the next day she realizes that a box is missing. She had collected hate mail in it over the years, which she had always written when she was annoyed with someone. She never wanted anyone to see the letters, but now a blackmailer comes forward and wants money from her ...

Film adaptation of the Marvel superhero Iron Man starring Robert Downey Jr. Tony Stark, head of the major corporation Stark Industries, is kidnapped by terrorists and is supposed to build a new weapon for them. But instead he develops an indestructible suit of armor for himself and escapes. The birth of a new superhero!

Longjumeau, 1996. Filip, Adel, and Frank, lifelong best friends, dream of breaking through the walls of their suburban town. The series is due to be released against a backdrop of rumors about the abusive behavior of one of its main actors, Marin Judas.

When outsider Sunny's crush disappears at a party with someone else, the frustrated girl spontaneously has her first sex with the first guy who comes along. But the next morning she realizes that her contraception didn't quite work out. That's why she and her best friend Lupe want to get the morning-after pill. But getting one is not so easy ...

Vada is in the toilet at her school when a student starts a school shooting. In mortal fear, she hides in one of the cubicles with her schoolmates Mia and Quinton, who happen to be there. Although physically unharmed, Vada is unable to come to terms with what she has experienced. She withdraws from her family and seeks contact with Mia, who has similar difficulties.

Fairytale family drama about the Maori girl Paikea, who resists the entrenched patriarchal traditions and ultimately convinces her stubborn grandfather and tribal chief Koro of her qualities. Lead actress Keisha Castle-Hughes was nominated for an Oscar for her performance as the youngest actress in the history of the Academy Awards.

Grad student Eric Cord becomes infected with lycanthropy after his friend turns into a werewolf and attacks him. Now, Eric and his girlfriend are after the monster that infected his friend, and a tough cowboy bounty hunter pursues Eric.

Grad student Eric Cord becomes infected with lycanthropy after his friend turns into a werewolf and attacks him. Now, Eric is after the monster that infected his friend so he can break the curse, while being pursued by a cowboy bounty hunter.

Traveling on a ferry to the island where they will spend their vacation, Maria loses her son Diego. Has someone taken him away? Impossible to know. Diego has simply disappeared. Months later, Maria struggles to overcome the pain of the loss, to get on with her life. Then she receives an unexpected call; they have found the body of a child, so she must return to the island.

The eccentric Brian lives alone in his cottage and spends his time with useless inventions. One day he has the idea of building a robot and, as if by a miracle, Charles actually comes to life. He soon wants to get to know the world, but danger is already looming from Brian's nasty neighbor Eddie.

Disillusioned, dry alcoholic Detective Dave Robicheaux joins forces with FBI agent Rosie Gomez in Lousiana to hunt down a serial killer who is targeting young women. But he also has another case to deal with: the body of an African-American man has been found in the swamps and links to his own past emerge...

Three teens, Tim, Rolf, and Freddy, spend summer chasing crushes and playful adventures with three very different girls. Confident mechanic Tim steals attention, sparking rivalry and testing friendships amid wild hormones

Laconic suburban drama in quiet images with Kaurismäki's muse Kati Outinen, who plays a girl who works in a match factory and looks after her mother and her boyfriend in her free time. The woman is constantly humiliated by her social environment - until she snaps at some point.

When Santa's on trial, Christmas hangs in the balance. Made in the spirit, though not to the same rules, of the 48hr film project. We set out to make an Xmas short, filmed on December 14th, edited, scored and mixed ready for Christmas.

A group of students are camping on a lake near the Caspian Sea, where they want to fly kites. No one else is around except three chefs looking for meat for their restaurant. The movie was shot in one piece without editing.

Benno Zimmermann is still unemployed. Despite a reconciliation with Gabi, he is plagued by financial worries. Unexpectedly, Lydia Nolte asks him for some neighborly help: Benno helps Lydia dismantle a slide projector in her apartment. Lydia is very grateful to him. But Benno discovers valuable pieces of jewelry in Lydia's apartment. Can he resist the temptation?

Beate and Gung would like to spend a weekend together at Lake Constance. The short vacation is financed by Elisabeth. Franz Schildknecht is also on vacation with his new love Angelika. Meike is staying with her mother Henny and Tanja during the vacation. When Lydia Nolte confronts Benno with her suspicion that he may have stolen the jewelry, he ruefully admits his mistake.

Berta and Gottlieb Griese were robbed on their honeymoon: Both the sailing boat and all their belongings are gone. The Beimers are with Benny in Portugal. Franz Schildknecht now wants a final divorce from his wife Henny. At a dinner together, Dr. Dressler informs Elisabeth that her son Carsten is homosexual. Elisabeth is shocked.

Joschi Bennarsch has not recovered from his heart attack. He dies and is laid out in the apartment by Philo. The Beimers return from Portugal and learn that Marion was in Austria and had an accident there. Her boyfriend Thomas was even killed by a road rager. Carsten brings his friend Gert home with him. Mother Elisabeth is very reserved...

In Nossek's absence, Henny discovers a video cassette in the apartment on which daughter Tanja can be seen performing a striptease. When she sees him later, there is a clap: she greets him with three resounding slaps. Benny Beimer is back home in Munich and has a new idea: he no longer wants to live in a room with his brother Klausi, but wants to move into the empty hobby cellar.
Meike paints a picture titled \Joschi in Heaven\" and gives it to Philo
column3: who still can't get over the death of her husband. Isolde and the Sarikakis have bought the house in which the hair salon is located at auction. They are overjoyed. When Tanja learns that Nossek intends to commercialize the striptease video
column4: it slowly becomes too much for her too: She leaves the apartment in a rage."

abstract: Isolde Panowak still needs 17,000 German marks to buy the house. Using a forged signature on a check, she tries to withdraw the money from her husband's account. But the account no longer exists... Nossek has destroyed all the videotapes, fearing he won't be able to get a job as a tennis coach in the future. But Tanja has apparently secretly secured a tape...

Elisabeth's dream comes true: Dressler proposes to her! - Isolde wins a large sum of money gambling and can pay the 17,000 Deutsch Marks to the bank. - Tanja has taken the videotape to the police and reported Nossek! The family subsequently receives a visit from the police. A registered letter also arrives: Tanja is to undergo a medical examination to determine her virginity!

Marion Beimer has been discharged from hospital. The death of her boyfriend Thomas is still very much on her mind. - Benno finally proposes to Gabi: Gabi happily accepts the proposal and the ring that goes with it. - The divorce petition arrives at the Schildknecht family. Franz wants Dr. Dressler to carry out a virginity test on Tanja. But Tanja runs away.

Tanja has withdrawn her complaint against Nossek. She admits that the complaint was only made out of feelings of revenge and disappointed love. - Philo Bennarsch has been depressed since Joschi's death. Meike tries to cheer her up. - Gabi and Benno want to celebrate a nice Christmas according to Bavarian tradition. But suddenly Chris Barnsteg shows up on their doorstep, completely drunk...

New Year's Eve 1987: Dressler and his wife Elisabeth get married! Frank is the best man and gets a day's leave from prison for this. Tanja wants to go to boarding school. During her discussion with Nossek, he reacts coldly and unfriendly. Tanja then goes to cry to Marion Beimer. At midnight, the neighbors gather in the street in front of the house and dance together to welcome the New Year!

Berta wants to have a child with her Gottlieb. Her mother, Lydia, is also enthusiastic about the idea and has already started knitting. Gottlieb, however, is still hesitant.  - Henny is desperate: Meike and Franz are avoiding her. She tries unsuccessfully to get closer.  - Benno is looking forward to Gabi's child, even if it isn't his. He's even already building a soapbox car for the future baby..

Elisabeth moves in with Dr. Dressler. She wants Beate and Carsten to move in with her, but they refuse. They want to lead their own, independent lives. In the end, Beate moves in with Benny in the hobby cellar, which Helga doesn't like at all. - Helga needs a break from being a housewife. She wants to treat herself to a two-week vacation on a beauty farm. Hans is astonished.

Henny and Franz Schildknecht are now off to see their divorce lawyer. The final details of the divorce still need to be settled. - Carsten and his friend Gert have moved into Elisabeth's old apartment. - Benny has moved back into his room. Beate continues to live in the hobby cellar. - Helga has realized her plan: she is now on a beauty farm and is being pampered.

Karim lives with his family in the countryside and can barely make ends meet. Of all things, he loses his job at an ostrich farm when his daughter Haniyeh's hearing aid breaks down. Because Haniyeh desperately needs a new hearing aid for school, Karim starts running errands in Tehran on his motorcycle. He earns relatively well, but becomes increasingly greedy ...

Cedar Cove is an American dramedy television series based on the original book series of the same name by American author Debbie Macomber. It is the first series produced by the Hallmark Channel and focuses on the district court of the fictional town of Cedar Cove. It revolves around Olivia Lockhart's professional and personal life.

Teenagers Casey, Claire and Marcia are kidnapped and held captive by a man. Two things quickly become clear: on the one hand, their kidnapper suffers from a split personality. Secondly, the teenagers are to be used as a kind of sacrificial offering. The girls try to play off the kidnapper's different personalities against each other, but time is running out...

Siblings Rebecca and Tyler travel to visit their grandparents in rural Pennsylvania so that their single mother can take a short vacation with her boyfriend. They are curious to meet the two elderly gentlemen, with whom they have never had any contact before. But the teenagers soon realize that something is very wrong with their grandparents...

British horror thriller in which a group of young women descend into an unknown cave system. A landslide closes the entrance and they set off to search the caverns for an alternative exit. But they are not alone...
Rome in the first century at the end of the reign of Emperor Galba: fierce power struggles break out over his succession and it becomes clear that politics is only made by a few and dominates many.

\Panic Room\" is a 2002 American thriller by David Fincher. Meg Altman and her daughter Sarah are surprised by burglars on the first night in their new apartment. They manage to escape to the panic room
column3: but unfortunately that's also where the criminals are after the loot. A cat-and-mouse game begins..."

abstract: “Im Namen des Gesetzes\ (In the Name of the Law) is a television series that was broadcast by the German television channel RTL from October 1994 to 2008. It is about the work of police officers who solve crimes without a protagonist. The series was filmed in Berlin."
“Mein Leben & Ich” (\My Life & Me\") is a German comedy series produced from 2001 to 2009 about the schoolgirl Alexandra ‘Alex’ Degenhardt. Alex's thoughts
column3: which can be heard as a voice-over
column4: give the series a special charm and a connection is established between the viewer and the series character."

abstract: Lars and his friends are heading out into the big wide world. Together with the penguin Caruso and the seal “Robby”, Lars, the little polar bear, crosses the great sea. On the Galapagos Islands, they experience many adventures and meet lots of unknown animals, with whom they soon become friends. But then Lars is captured by the humans and needs help.

“The Kill Point” is an American series from 2007 about a group of soldiers who plan a spectacular bank robbery after returning from the war in Iraq. The series is the first to be produced for Spike TV.
The US comedy series centers around the life of former American football star Spencer Strasmore, played by Dwayne Johnson, who is now making a living as a financial manager.
Halim and his wife Mina run a kaftan store in the Moroccan town of Salé. But then the attractive apprentice Youssef starts working for them and Halim feels attracted to him.
The film is the sequel to \Scream 4\" and the fifth film in the Scream series
column3: as well as the first after the death of the director of the previous installments
column4: Wes Craven."

abstract: Deputy Joe Deacon is supposed to pick up evidence from his colleagues in LA. However, this doesn't go as quickly as hoped and brings him into contact with the young detective Jim Baxter, who is chasing a serial killer. Deacon sees similarities to an old case, and the two begin working together...

Charlie Chaplin in the role of the Tramp: a helplessly overworked factory worker loses his job and goes through the hardships of the industrialized USA of the 1930s. He makes the acquaintance of prison, homelessness and a poor girl for whom he sacrifices himself. Despite its late date, Chaplin's last comedy is fully committed to silent film.

The 'Virtuoso' is a professional killer who knows his job. He carries out his jobs with cool calculation and precision. But he can't get one piece of collateral damage out of his mind: a mother who burns to death during one of his jobs. The facade he has painstakingly built up begins to crumble...

«Contraband» is a remake of «Reykjavik-Rotterdam» from 2008, in which Mark Wahlberg plays a former alcohol smuggler who has dropped out and works as a simple security guard. When his money troubles get worse and worse, he returns to his old milieu. Director Baltasar Kormákur had already played the leading role in «Reykjavik-Rotterdam».

After her husband is critically injured in a factory explosion, Bella has to earn a living for her family by singing in a variety show. She falls in love with her composer and he falls in love with her. But the breaking of their marital vows leads to tragedy. Silent movie.

As the new star lawyer Perry Mason, Matthew Rhys fights to secure an acquittal for his client. Even though all the evidence is against his client, he is able to force the confession of the real perpetrator through clever maneuvering in the courtroom.

Family comedy from 2008: Little Nim (Abigail Breslin) lives with her single father on an exotic island. When her father suddenly stops coming home, the girl seeks help via the internet from the novelist whose books she always reads. But the novelist must first overcome her agoraphobia in order to save the girl.

An action film directed by Jonathan Liebesman and staged with a great deal of pathos: Earth is attacked by aliens. A ragtag group of marines, who were initially only supposed to evacuate civilians from LA, suddenly find themselves trapped behind enemy lines. And time is of the essence, as the entire area is soon to be bombed by the US Air Force...

Two New York narcotics officers are on the trail of a major drug deal: a heroin shipment worth millions from Marseille is to be smuggled to New York by a drug trafficking ring. Director William Friedkin adapted Robin Moore's novel as an action thriller and became the pioneer of a generation of action productions in American cinema.
“Reign” is an American television series about the life of young Mary Stewart at the French court in the 16th century.

Although the almost 50-year-old Brad could be satisfied with his life, he is plagued by self-doubt, as some friends from his college days are apparently more successful and, above all, richer than he is. So Brad is mainly preoccupied with himself when he accompanies his talented son Troy to Boston, where Troy is looking for a place at university.

It's not exactly easy for 15-year-old Charlotte: she, her free-spirited mother Rachel and her little sister are constantly moving house because their mother doesn't want to commit. Charlotte takes refuge in the Catholic faith. But then she falls in love for the first time, and Rachel also starts seeing someone again: shoe salesman Lou.

The Australian film is based on the novel “Follow the rabbit-proof fence” by Doris Pilkington. It deals with the forced separation of Aboriginal children from their families in the first half of the 20th century. The two sisters Molly and Daisy manage to escape from an orphanage. On the way to their mother along the Rabbit-Proof Fence, they are pursued.

Teacher Samet is doing his compulsory service at a school in a remote Anatolian village and can't wait to be transferred to a big city soon. But accusations made against him by female pupils could put paid to that. He finds a diversion with the attractive Nuray, whom he actually wanted to set up with his roommate Kenan.

Vittorio De Sica received the Golden Bear for this film in 1971. Ferrara 1938-1943: The fate of two Jewish families of different status, linked by a love story that finds no fulfillment and ends with their deportation. The Finzi-Continis open their garden to the public after Jews are no longer allowed to participate in public life.
A police orchestra accidentally gets stranded in the middle of nowhere in Israel and is seemingly on its own. Eran Kolirin's comedy looks at the cultural conflict between Israel and Egypt.

In the “brave new world”, all unpleasant emotions are suppressed by means of drugs - but at the same time, art and creativity are also suppressed. While diseases and armed conflicts no longer exist, people reproduce out of convenience using genetic engineering and consume without restraint.
