Those who refuse to accept this system are interned in reservations...
French crime series that ran for over 20 seasons from 1992 to 2014.

Gottlieb and Berta have sought advice from Dr. Dressler: Pregnancy is possible, the risk is low. - Henny sees no way out: she writes a farewell letter to her father, opens a bottle of red wine and swallows a large quantity of pills!  At home, Gottlieb finds Henny's letter: he rushes to her apartment and finds her unconscious in the bedroom.

Henny Schildknecht is dead! Her father Gottlieb reproaches himself and Franz. Almost the entire neighborhood attends the funeral. - Bianca and Beate are alone in the hairdressing salon because Isolde is also at the funeral. Suddenly Nossek comes into the salon and tells Bianca his grief. - Helga waits impatiently for Benny's return. She decides to look in the hobby cellar.

The Beimers are moving again: Beate moves upstairs into the apartment while Benny moves back into the hobby cellar. Marion is not happy about Beate moving in. - Phil Seegers finds out about Gabi and Benno's upcoming wedding from Lydia Nolte. He threatens to stop the wedding because he doesn't want his child to have Benno's surname.

Gabi and Benno get married. During the wedding ceremony, a drunken Phil staggers into the church and loudly announces that the child is his. Later, at the wedding party in the Acropolis, Meike suddenly collapses! - Marion finds a patient listener to her worries in the young priest Matthias Steinbrück. - First appearance of Manfred Schwabe in his role as Matthias Steinbrück.

Following her collapse last week, Meike is suspected of having a weak immune system. More detailed examinations are still pending. - The Grieses invite the Schildknechts to dinner. Together they remember the deceased Henny. - Helga notices in the evening that Benny's bed is empty. He is back in the hobby cellar. But Beate is also in the hobby cellar! The Beimers suspect the worst...

Franz receives a shocking diagnosis from Dr. Dressler: his daughter Meike has leukemia! The type and extent of the disease have not yet been determined. However, according to Dressler, there is a 50 percent chance of recovery. - Marion and Beate don't get along as roommates. There are constant arguments. - Gabi suddenly goes into labor! Chris Barnsteg calls the emergency doctor.

The baby is here! Gabi and Benno are the proud parents of a little boy. Benno wants the boy to be called Max. Things are slowly getting tight in the flat share... Meike's diagnosis has now been confirmed: a very aggressive form of leukemia. She has to go to hospital immediately! - Dinner at Carsten and Gerd's. Elisabeth, Beate and Dressler are invited. But Elisabeth's mood is particularly bad...

Elisabeth Dressler simply cannot accept the fact that her son Carsten is gay. She reproaches herself and wonders whether she could be to blame for Carsten's orientation. - Philo Bennarsch wants to see her deceased Joschi. She asks Dressler to help her with the suicide. - Lydia offers Chris the chance to move in with her. After some initial difficulties, the two become friends.

Philo Bennarsch is getting ready: On the day of her golden wedding anniversary, she finally wants to go and see her late Joschi. She sits down in the armchair and holds her breath. But something goes wrong... Meanwhile, Marion Beimer and the priest Matthias are getting closer and closer. Apparently they both feel more than just affection.

The Beimers still dream of owning their own house. But the financing seems to be proving more difficult than initially thought. Helga wants to look for a job to supplement the household budget. Benny and Beate arrange to meet in the evening at the “Akropolis”. There, Beate makes it clear to him that she wants to break up with him. Benny is extremely disappointed and runs out of the restaurant.

Brothers Kikue and Isamu desperately want a television. When their father refuses, the two swear not to speak another word until their wish is fulfilled. “Good Morning” (original title: Ohayô) is one of the late works of the great Japanese director Yasujiro Ozu.
TV series in 6 episodes about the persecution of Christians in ancient Rome under Emperor Nero.

Comedy about a pirate radio station in the North Sea in the 1960s. A group of English DJs live on an old freighter equipped with a transmitter. In contrast to the BBC, they pay homage to rock. This reaches a wide audience, but is also a thorn in the side of the government...

David Sumner, a screenwriter from LA, and his wife move back to their hometown in backwoods Blackwater, Mississippi. But tensions quickly arise with the locals. Remake of ‘Straw Dogs’ (1971) and remake of the novel ‘The Siege of Trencher's Farm’.

Ray Breslin is paid to break out of prisons in order to test and improve their security. When the CIA hires him for one of their privately run black sites, however, he soon realizes that he has been betrayed. Suddenly a job turns into a fight for survival...
Kalaxyja disappeared without a trace 18 years ago. A year later, she was declared dead - but her body was never found. Now she returns, accompanied by a sinister creature: a vampire.

Benny Beimer isn't so easily fobbed off: He continues to try everything to save his relationship with Beate. But she gives him the cold shoulder. - At the Akropolis restaurant: Isolde, Bianca, Beate, and Elisabeth sit together and discuss the future of the hair salon. - Meike is still in the hospital. A blood transfusion could be a good treatment for the cancer...

Isolde's husband died of a heart attack in Africa. Isolde is desperate. Frank is released from prison on parole. He wants to find his own apartment. Will his past be his downfall? Franz and Tanja are preparing everything for Meike's release from the hospital: she is to be given a nursing room at home.

Despite his past, Frank has found an apartment with the understanding landlady, Mrs. Tibor. Klausi receives a small dog as a gift and initially hides it in the basement. When Helga later learns of this, she isn't thrilled at first. However, she later accepts the new family member. Marion disappears after a date with Steinbrück. Helga is worried...

Hans Beimer presents his family with a fait accompli: He has spontaneously bought a house! - Meike is back home in her new care room. She is lovingly cared for by Franz, Tanja, and Carsten Flöter in rotation. - Marion has reappeared: she went for a walk in the cemetery at night last week. This is how she is processing the death of her former boyfriend.

Phil demands regular visitation rights for his son Max. But the Zimmermanns refuse. - Lydia and Chris have organized a welcome dinner for Frank at Lydia's apartment. Benno and Gabi are also there. Suddenly, a completely drunk Phil arrives and loudly demands his visitation rights. - A row at the Beimers: Benny has been banned from school because of his refusal to study!

Are ancient mummies and modern alien abductions connected? In this mind-bending episode, Michael Knowles sits down with rogue archaeologist Tim Alberino to explore the shocking links between ancient civilizations, extraterrestrial encounters, and biblical prophecy.

In the 1980s, in the Italian countryside: Englishman Arthur has just come out of prison and is soon back together with his cronies, against his original intention. For Arthur has a supernatural gift: he can locate ancient burial chambers, which the gang then rob. But then he meets the singing student Italia ...

Film adaptation of Tom Clancy's successful book of the same name, starring Harrison Ford. Former CIA analyst Jack Ryan foils an attack in London that is the work of an IRA splinter group. Terrorist Sean Miller is arrested and his brother is shot dead. Miller seeks revenge and is soon to get his chance...

The story unfolds Five days prior during election season, where a police team and a notorious gangster are significantly affected by the election. Ultimately, the narrative leads to a decisive resolution of their conflict with many twists, turns, and emotions.

After years away, Tomás travels back from Canada to his old home in Spain for four days to see his old best friend Julián again. But the trip has a sad reason: Julián has terminal cancer and Tomás has to say goodbye, but also persuade him to continue his treatment. But Julián is already looking for a new home for his beloved dog Truman.
